results.description:
Hosts: George & Michael Y are off this week.  Dec. 11th - Yen is substituting.


George wrote:
"CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005. 21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages"

********************

About this week's moderator:  Yen is a parent and is currently trading at  $[masked] US.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me at a table near the piano as depicted in the photo of the atrium floor.  Look for the red "Conversations New York" sign.
results.name: "A Conversation About Happiness" CitiCorp Atrium at 53rd & Lex. Guest Host: Yen

Save the date for our annual Hanukkah Bar Crawl!!
Register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hanukkah-bar-crawl-2015-tickets-19709453506

Click here for the facebook event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/1000340166683918/


The night will include a menorah lighting followed by celebrating at several Hoboken bars.


Your registration includes a bar crawl T-shirt, Hanukkah goody-bag and the drink specials at the bar. Registration deadlines are as follows:


Online Registration : $12, ends Sunday 12/06 at 10:00pm. You will choose your shirt size when you register and it will be waiting for you at the event.


Late Online Registration: $16, ends Friday 12/11 at 4:00pm. You cannot choose your shirt size in advance. You are garuanteed a shirt but will have to pick your size when you arrive first come first serve from the pool of extra shirts.


At the door: $20 CASH ONLY, while shirts last, pick your shirt size first come first serve from pool of extra shirts when you arrive. (Good chance this will sell out)


Bar Schedule and Specials:

5:00pm  Little Town Social (formerly Village Pourhouse) - $3 Domestic Draft, $4 Well Mixers, $4 Mixer Shots, Appetizers covered by Moishe House Hoboken

6:00pm McSwiggans - $3 Bud light, Coors light, Miller Lite drafts and $3 shots of Fireball

7:00pm The Shannon - $3 House shots, $3 Domestic Pints, $4 Domestic Bottles, $5 Well Drinks, $5 Jameson, Fireball, Dr. McGillicuddy shots


8:00pm Tally Ho - $3 Yuengling, Bud Light, Coors Light, $5 fireball shot, $5 well drinks

9:00pm Wicked Wolf - $4 mid shelf mixers, $3 domestic draft beers (specials valid til 10pm)

results.description:
We have special guest, Stephen Browett,  joining us to lead chanting for the Christmas satsang tomorrow. Stephen is an amazing musician drawing on over 20 years study and practice of Yogananda’s teachings, he loves to bring people together to access calm, well-being and to feel uplifted.  He will be leading some of Yogananda’s chants such as Cloud Covered Christ.

Christmas Meditation, Satsang & Celebration! Join us for our annual Christmas satsang in honor of Jesus and the Christ Consciousness in all creation! Come and celebrate the birth of divinity in this world through saints of all religions and in the hearts of devotees everywhere. We will have a candle ceremony, chanting, Christmas readings, meditation and Pray Stars (where we all pick randomly a prayer person to pray for in 2016 - pray and get prayed for all year!). Please bring prasad (blessed treats:) for the gathering and a Christmas reading if you feel to.
results.name: Christmas Meditation, Satsang & Celebration w/Special Guest Stephen Browett!

group.name: Ananda NYC Paramhansa Yogananda Meditation & Satsang

results.description:
Come join the NYC Recent College Grads for FREE Quiet Clubbing @ Winter Garden in Brookfield Place!

Quiet Events is having an awesome Quiet Clubbing Dance party in lower Manhattan at the Winter Garden at Brookfield Place. This spot is AMAZING! With palm trees covering the dance floor and a lighting display to dance under, it’s one event not to miss!

This event is open to all ages. And FREE.

There will be 3 DJs Spinning Live!
Green DJ: Top 40 & Kids' Favorites
Red DJ: 80's, 90’s, 2k
Blue DJ: Hip-Hop

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets do NOT matter. Admission is only available to the first 500 who show up at the event (this means we'll need to meet an hour-two in advance).
This party is going on rain or shine.
This party is for ALL ages.
Drinks available outside of the dance floor @ Le District

Event Location:
Winter Garden (at Brookfield Place)
230 Vesey Street (b/t West Street & North End Avenue)
New York, NY 10281
Battery Park

Pricing:
Admission: $0 

For more information, check here: https://quietevents.com/events/quiet-clubbing-for-all-ages/

***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process***
When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.


Nearby Train Stations:
- Cortlandt St. via 1 Train 
- Cortlandt St. via N,R Train 
- World Trade Center via E Train

Where to Find Us:
T.B.A.

Contact Information:
If you have any questions, feel free to call/text Anthony at:
(917) 526-3750.

Facebook Group:
For those interested in getting faster, more reliable notifications (since most people are spammed with MeetUp emails and as a result, tend to ignore them - myself included) and better feedback, here's our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/nycrecentcollegegrads/

All members will be approved :)
results.name: [Battery Park] FREE Quiet Clubbing @ Winter Garden Dance Party

Join us for a meditation for world peace. 

So many people today are facing difficult situations- natural and man-made. The world today needs peace, harmony, understanding and kindness. Lets get together to meditate and create peace, inside and outside us. 


No previous experience required, just an intention to help create a better world. 

Hosted by the Art of Living Foundation.

Saturday's sessions are a little slower paced and a good opportunity to work on basic techniques (rolling, ball handling, etc.) and just have fun. The pace may pick up, depending on the group, but new players will be incorporated into the play. (If you don't have experience kayaking w/ a skirt--rolling or doing a wet exit--please attend one of our Intro Sessions first.)

Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. ACA Membership is required and due separately from club and facility fees (one-time ACA event membership is included for those in free trial sessions). Regulars: please confirm that your ACA membership is up to date or renew now. NYKP Members receive a discount! Newcomers can join ACA for 6 months at $15 for or for full year $30 (use PAC Individuals & Families options and select New York Kayak Polo).

So there are very few things that beat saunas in the winter. One of them is playing go in the Sauna in the winter.

So I invite you all to join me.

King's Spa is a Korean style bathhouse in New Jersey. There is a free bus that gets you there from either flushing or 32nd street.

The place has a space separated by gender where the bathing occurs and a coed area where there are many dry Sauna and activity areas, including go boards. I will bring two more just in case.

They provide clothing for the coed area. There is also a restaurant, and for $10 extra you get a blanket and can spend the night on a lazy boy. (This is not mandatory) Anyway it will be fun!

Here it is again

https://www.groupon.com/deals/king-spa-fitness-8-47

results.description:
The weather outside on Saturday WON'T be frightful except in the thought that it's December 12th and temperatures in the 60s are predicted!  It's the annual tree lighting for the Friends of St Nicholas Park and we thought it would be a nice way to start the evening by getting together to meet face-to-face over a cup of hot cider. So, if you are free for a hour or so, please drop in. The choirs will set the tone and if there are kids, there will be an arts table to make ornaments for the tree.

We will also be collecting used or new books for re-distribution by Total Equity Now  Holiday Book Drive.  See their note below..

TOTAL EQUITY NOW AND PARTNERS PRESENT THE . . .      4TH ANNUAL   LITERACY ACROSS HARLEM HOLIDAY BOOK DRIVE!       COLLECTING NEW AND LIKE-NEW BOOKS, BENEFITING CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN HARLEM SHELTERS  TUESDAY, DECEMBER 1 - FRIDAY, DECEMBER 18*

<a>www.bit.ly/HarlemHolidayBookDrive</a>  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This week, you have the power, the power to give children and families in Harlem shelters the invaluable gift of reading.

If you haven't already, please take a few minutes to bring new or like-new books to one of our Holiday Book Drive donation-site partners listed below. If you've already donated, thank you for your thoughtfulness and generosity. Please spread the word and encourage others to do the same.

Know that your Harlem neighbors with limited means to purchase books will enjoy your reading treasures over the holidays and beyond.
Some say it takes a village; we say it takes a Harlem!

Books may also be dropped off at the following locations:

<a>Behind the Book</a>
216 W. 135th St. (between 7th and 8th)  

<a>Cafe One</a>  1619 Amsterdam Ave. (at 140th)

<a>El Museo del Barrio</a> [* = Donations also accepted at "<a>Super Sábado</a>" from 12PM to 1PM on Saturday, 12/19] 5th Avenue (between 104th and 105th)  

<a>Hamilton Grange Library</a> 503 W. 145th St. (between Broadway and Amsterdam) 

<a>Silberman School of Social Work at Hunter College</a>[masked]rd Ave. (at 119th)

  <a>Harlem YMCA</a> 180 W. 135th St. (between 7th and Lenox) 

<a>Sisters Uptown Bookstore & Cultural Center</a> 1942 Amsterdam Ave. (at 156th)

 <a>St. Matthew's Baptist Church</a> 43 Dr. John J. Sass Place (formerly Macombs Place) (between 152st and 152nd) 

<a>Teachers College, Columbia University</a>   525 W. 120th St. (between Broadway and Amsterdam) Department of Education Policy and Social Analysis - Zankel Hall, Room 212  Office for Diversity and Community Affairs - Zankel Hall, Room 128   

<a>The City College of New York</a> 160 Convent Ave. (at 138th)   Program in Premedical Studies - Marshak Science Building, Room 529    Undergraduate Student Government - USG Office, North Academic Center, Room 1/111

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 34-48 - SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Let's enjoy some wonderful Ramen soup and other dishes at Roc N Ramen in New Rochelle on Saturday December 12 starting at 6pm. I will make a reservation for six and your $3 will secure your spot. 

Ramen (ラーメン rāmen, ɽäꜜmeɴ]) is a Japanese noodle soup dish. It consists of wavy wheat noodles served in a meat or (occasionally) fish-based broth, often flavored with soy sauce or miso, and uses toppings such as sliced pork (チャーシュー chāshū), dried seaweed (海苔 nori), kamaboko, and green onions. Nearly every region in Japan has its own variation of ramen, from the tonkotsu (pork bone broth) ramen of Kyushu to the miso ramen of Hokkaido.


Here are some comments by prior diners:

I had the rib tips ramen... omg the best ramen I've ever had in my life!! It is sooo good. I'm not really a ramen person but this place has me thinking about my meal a day later, planning when I can visit again. I live in the Heights but this place is special and definitely worth the drive. The owner is very nice. 

After so many visits, I finally got a chance to meet and chat with its owner Wayner. He clearly has a passion for this business and I was delighted to learn that he actually took a trip to Japan to sharpen his skills. Definitely admirable!

Tonkotsu - Creamy, flavorful broth! Not too thick or thin. Comes with scallions, bamboo shoots, sesame seeds, and soft-boiled egg by default - but you can request additional toppings for $1 each. The noodles were a bit too al dente, but I suppose that's just up to preference. On the other hand, their braised pork belly was soooo tender, juicy, and delicious. Just the right amount of fat! In hindsight, I should have asked for two more pieces for $2.

Roc-N-Punch - "What's in it?" To which our server replied, "What's -not- in it?" A very tasty and strong cocktail in the prettiest shade of pink, served with a lime wedge. I liked it so much, we ended up ordering three glasses each. ;)

Cream Puff - The perfect way to end our meal. Dessert with a very light, fluffy, and whipped texture. Wasn't overly sweet, which I really appreciated.

The owner and staff are so friendly and charismatic; They really know how to make you laugh and feel at home. Service, food, and casual atmosphere were excellent on all accounts. Couldn't recommend this place more!!!

I was staying in the area and looking for some late night food. I showed up a few minutes after closing and they stayed open a little longer to accommodate me. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen with extra chashu. 


The broth - Smoky with a hint of sweetness. Rich without being as oily as other tonkotsu broths I've had. Not overly salty.
Noodles - Thin but not in the standard hakata style. Curly instead of straight. Al dente. Cooked perfectly and was a highlight of the meal.
Chashu - Seems like they grill it before they drop it into the broth. I like it! It adds a delicious crisp to each bite.
results.name: Let's go to Roc N Ramen in New Rochelle~ for some great Ramen!

results.description:
Discover the Benefits of Buddhist Meditation with a Real Buddhist Monk 

Have you ever wanted to meditate but don’t know where to start? Do you have an interest in Buddhist teachings but wanted to learn from a live human being rather than Wikipedia? Buddhist monk and teacher Bhante Saddhasara is excited to be able to offer bi-weekly meditation and discussion sessions that will help you reduce your level of stress and bring you a peace of mind which is sadly lacking for most of us living in the urban jungle. 

Whether you have absolutely zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us every Saturday at 06:00pm for a short meditation and discussion session. This Meetup is offered free of charge as a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) so please come and invite your friends. Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you at our next get together! 

About Bhante Saddhasara 

Bhante Saddhasara joined the Mahamevnawa Meditation Monastery in Sri Lanka in 2005, became a novice in 2006 under Ven. Kiribatgoda Gnanananda Thero, and after two years of study and practice, attained High Ordination in 2009. After three more years of study, he had begun to develop a deep understanding of insight and tranquility techniques. In 2012 he was asked to begin and to organize a meditation center in Tampa, Florida to provide training to all those who wished to learn. The center was to be non-denominational; anyone of any religion could come and study the practices. Bhante Saddhasara also offered a Recovery Program for those suffering from addiction; an introductory mindfulness program for children; a prison program; and, throughout Florida and throughout the U.S.A, he also gave lectures and provided mindfulness and meditation teaching, as well as private counseling to adults and to youths of all ages. Bhante Saddhasara speaks fluent English and very much enjoys the back and forth of his conversations with Americans.
results.name: Join Us for Guided Meditation and Discussion with Bhante Saddhasara!

results.description:
Уважаемые друзья, Фонд Оранжевый Пингвин приглашает познакомится с нашим соседом - журналистом и писателем Гарри Каролинским, автором шеститомной эпопеи “Последний Мирный Год-1913", которая недавно была издана в Москве. Г.Каролинский -это псевдоним популярнешего 60-70гг радио-журналиста Гарри Табачника, который брал интервью у многих знаменитых людей того времени, включая маршала Жукова и Юрия Гагарина.
Встреча будет проводится в доме у Гарри в городе Greenburgh, Westchester, поэтому количество мест ограничено: необходимо заранее зарезервировать, позвонив по телефону: (914)[masked] или по email [masked].
В программе вечера - знакомство, рассказы Гарри о его творчестве, писательской и журналистский деятельности и о его работе на " Маяке", "Голосе Америки", радио"Свобода".
Встреча пройдет 12 декабря, субботу начиная с 6 часов вечера.

This is an article about Gary's wife, Zina:
results.name: В гости к писателю Гарри Каролинскому

results.description:
Come for a musical trip to the Mideast with the talented Sami Abu Shumays' Zikrayat traditional music and original compositions, that celebrate the diversity of Arab culture. 

                            Check out a sampling of his music at:             https://www.youtube.com/watch?   v=2R60v7M2TLUhttps://app.box.com/shared/u6yygto8lj

SEATING IS LIMITED SO IT IS ADVISABLE TO PRE-PURCHASE YOUR TICKETS ON LINE AT: http://www.rocklandconservatory.org/events 

 TICKET PRICE IS $20 which helps support this wonderful Non-profit organization The Rockland Music Conservatory

If you purchase your tickets on line they will have your name on a list at the door when you arrive.  

Inclement weather cancels so always check the day of an event for possible changes.

DIRECTIONS and PARKING INFO BELOW:

45 South Main Street, Pearl River, NY 10965

From 304 (heading south) 
Turn LEFT onto Central Avenue. Cross the railroad tracks and make 1st RIGHT onto S. Main Street. Go 1 block and pass the Post Office. RCM is ½ block down on the RIGHT.

From 304 (heading north from NJ) 
Turn RIGHT onto Central Avenue. Cross the railroad tracks and make 1st RIGHT onto S. Main Street. Go 1 block and pass the Post Office. RCM is ½ block down on the RIGHT.

From Middletown Road
Turn onto Central Avenue heading toward downtown Pearl River. Continue down the hill into the center of town. At the light at Main Street, turn LEFT. (if you go over the RR tracks, you’ve gone too far) Go 1 block and pass the Post Office. RCM is ½ block down on the RIGHT.

Parking

There is plentiful parking (metered and non-metered) on the street in front of and in the neighborhoods surrounding RCM.  The following generous neighbors have offered to share their parking lots as well:

ALL THE TIME: HARTEL parking lot at the corner of S. Main St. and Jefferson (any spot marked VISITOR)

ONLY ON WEEKENDS: MEHL ELECTRIC (across the street from RCM) Do not park here during the week in the evening as they have employees & trucks who must enter and exit at all times. Thanks!

ONLY ON WEEKENDS: COMMUTER LOT directly in back of school (lots of spaces for Saturday students!)

NOTE:  Please DO NOT park at the Post Office or the driveway next door. Cars parked there will be towed.

All meters in Pearl River take quarters (25 cents per hour)AFTER 6PM METERED PARKING IS FREE

www.orangetown.com/departments/public_safety/parking_and_meter_regulations.php

results.description:
Please join us for a special holiday party and reading on Saturday, December 12, at 7pm at Cuppa Pulp Writers Space in Nanuet, New York. Festive refreshments and brilliant readings will be served!

Guest poet, Nicholas Samaras, who is a past winner of the Yale Younger Poets Award, will read and sign copies of his newest book, American Psalm, World Psalm. All proceeds from book sales will benefit River River Writers Circle. Writers featured in the new issue of River River will also read from their work. We hope to see you there! 

Refreshments generously donated by The Kitchen Table & Bar and Art Cafe Nyack.

<a>This event is funded in part by Poets & Writers with public funds from the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of Governor Andrew Cuomo and the New York State Legislature.</a>
results.name: River River's annual holiday reading with guest poet Nicholas Samaras

results.description:
Leave the kids at home and treat yourself and your significant other to a night on the town! Please join us on December 12, 2015 from 7:00 to 10:00 at Paragon Tap & Table for an evening of food, drinks and good company. The cost is $55 per person, which includes 3 hours of open bar and food (buffet style). For those that do not intend to drink, the price is $45 for food only (prices include tax and tip). It promises to be a great opportunity to mingle with members and their significant others and enjoy the holiday season. Please RSVP by November 20, 2015 so we can give Paragon the head count. Payment may be made via PayPal  (http://www.westfieldwelcomeclub.org/activities/winter-social-tickets/) OR check mailed to:

Westfield Welcome Club
P.O. Box 852
Westfield, NJ 07091 (or drop off to Simone's house--message me if you need the address)

Hope to see you all there!

results.description:
O Brasil Series is presented in collaboration with Cinema Tropical, and organized by guest curator Marcela Goglio. 

One of the main features of Brazil’s impressive recent output of quality cinema is its variety—of genres, voices and styles. Government funding has allowed filmmakers an unprecedented creative freedom, which has resulted in a large share of the market for local movies.


ÚLTIMAS CONVERSAS

New York premiere. Eduardo Coutinho [masked]) was one of the most original voices in the history of Brazilian cinema. His last film is a deceptively simple and arresting portrait of teenage life. A series of conversations with young carioca students about their dreams, troubles and desires, the film was finished posthumously by his partner, Jordana Berg, and by producer João Moreira Salles. “Coutinho didn't have time to put together what would turn out to be his last film," explains Salles. "It’s all about conversations with young people who have their whole life ahead of them… that circumstance makes the poignancy of Last Conversations even greater." 

Dir. Eduardo Coutinho. 2015, 88 mins. Digital projection. Portuguese with English subtitles.

Tickets: $12. Members of the NY Brazilian Portuguese meetup group get a 20% discount at check out. Use the code NYBrazilMeetup to receive it. Click here to purchase yours.

Enjoy the movie,

Aparecida Teixeira
results.name: Movie night: Últimas Conversas (Last Conversations)

results.description:
(***MEN AND WOMEN ARE WELCOME***) 

Take A Risk: SEX! is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 

When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.


Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska and Cynthia Kagoshima

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-dr-kristina-kincaid-tickets-18716768358

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.


Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: Between 6th and 7th Ave, 18th floor
results.name: Take A Risk: SEX! with Dr. Kristina Kincaid

results.description:
Gente Ristorante- Chanukah
Saturday, December 12th
7pm optional drinks, 8pm dinner
153 East 45th (Lexington and 3rd)
$84- 4- courses/ wine pairings, coffee/espresso/ cappuccino, tax and tip.

Our dinner events are open to Single Gourmet members only, we are a 33 year old member only dinner and event company that averages 25 members per dinner. However you can join your first event through meetup and pay online here. http://thesinglegourmet.net/event/gente/

Join us during Chanukah for an Italian and potato latke meal in Midtown with cuisine directly inspired by owner and executive chef Jay B. Mitchell’s hundreds of past visits to Italy. “The trick, I believe,” wrote a reporter for Short and Sweet NYC, “is when combining local produce with unmatchable Italian staples, Gente manages to produce the essence of a ‘local’ Italian dining experience in a neighborhood notorious for grab -and-go commuter clientele”. We start off with an antipasti combo of carcofi alla judea & Heirloom tomatoes with buratta then a pasta combo of pumpkin ravioli and multigrain spaghetti with zucchini & pine nuts paired with a wine tasting of Orvieto Secco (white), then entrée choices of filet of sole al’Italienne or rack of lamb with warm apples & lentils paired with Nero Davola (red) and we end our meal with pastichiera cheese cake or macedonia fruit salad.
results.name: Dinner @ Gente

results.description:
12:12 Women’s New Moon Healing Sanctuary: Embrace the Light & Spirit of the Holidays!

All are welcome to come December 12th for an exciting celebration of healing & illumination featuring Sacred Ceremony, Organic Tea and Snacks, Blissful Dance, and More!

Come join a sacred circle of women where we will enter the gate of 12:12 with greater clarity, self-empowerment, gratitude, and love. This evening will be a community celebration to connect to the divine feminine and the inner wisdom within you!

New Moons are perfect for amplifying new intentions, creating new paths, and releasing old stories that no longer serve your highest and happiest self. The New Moon energy in combination with 12:12 will leave nothing less than magic to occur!

Optional: Feel free to wear a skirt if you are inspired to do so and/or bring any gently used items or clothing to gift away or donate.

The program will include:
• Opening Ceremony
• Healing Shamanic Drum Journeying
• Heart Opening Vegan Chocolate & Tea
• Dancing with satvic music by Kyma Sonix
• Give away table- feel free to bring any gently used items or clothing to share.
• Community LOVE & more!

When: December 12, 2015

Time: Doors open at 6pm. 7pm Ceremony Begins.
Dancing, Sharing, Tarot 9:30-11:00 pm.

Where: Zen House
165 Allen Street NYC
(former Rayuela Restaurant)

Cost: $25 or two for $40 if one brings a friend.

RSVP for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=4VHMG5U24NM6A

RSVP for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=KHBDNTT8WPBSW

Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

Kyma Sonix: New York based DJ. Kundalini Yoga Instructor. Cali grown. Child of Venus. Founder of #SacredSundays. Event Curator for ATMA. www.kymasonix.com

All text, images, and products presented are copyright. Copyright © 2015 Sarah Eve Cardell. All rights reserved.
results.name: 12:12 Women’s New Moon Healing Sanctuary: Embrace the Light & Holiday Spirit!

results.description:
Calling all enthusiasts, last meetup of the year!!  2015 has been a great year for WBEU, we've had a spike in members, more meetups than any year previously, and an awesome base group of repeat members.  This is the end of the year party and we are going all out!!!  We are going to visit a couple WBEU favorites in the LES to end the year.  For those of you interested in some food we will hit up Williamsburg Pizza for a solid slice before the festivities.  Afterwards, we shall pay a visit to the whiskey gods at Whiskey Ward.  Lastly, we shall venture over to Top Hops!  I can think of no better place to end the year!  Here is the approximate schedule, of course I'll post in the meetup as we move to each place.

Williamsburg Pizza 7pm: Broome St & Allen St.

Whiskey Ward 8pm: Rivington St. & Essex St.

Top Hops 10pm: Orchard St. between Delancey & Broome

• The Raffle:  What is this, you ask?!  In the spirit of the holidays and to celebrate a great year we will be raffling off some prizes at the bars.  I shall handpick one beer and one whiskey and there will be an old fashioned names in a hat raffle.  You need to have shown up for one meetup before this event to be able to put your name in the hat.  Other than that, that's it, you could walk away with something tasty to sip over the holidays!!  The whiskey will be raffled off at Whiskey Ward and the beer at Top Hops.  This is Lou and I saying thanks so much for making this a great group!

• The Logistics: We will meet at Williamsburg Pizza at 7 to grab a quick bite before our adventure.  The closest subways stop are Bowery J, Z, Grand B, D, or Delancey F.
results.name: LES Sampler

results.description:
REGISTER FOR FREE TICKETS!

We have an awesome Quiet Clubbing Dance party in lower Manhattan at the Winter Garden at Brookfield Place. This spot is AMAZING! With palm trees covering the dance floor and a lighting display to dance under, it’s one event not to miss!

This event is open to all ages, but we recommend bringing the young ones to the party on Sunday. Oh yea, did we mention this event is FREE!
Untitled-2

Three Live DJs spinning:
Green DJ: Top40 & kids favorites
Red DJ: 80’s, 90’s, 2k
Blue DJ: Hiphop

What’s included:
Quiet Events Headphones
3 Live DJs battling for your attention.

Special Notes:
Tickets are FREE but limited to 500 people
This party is going on rain or shine.
This Party is for all ages
Drinks available outside of the dance floor @ Le District
Arrive early to dine and shop at Brookfield Place before you dance!

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJs with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: FREE Winter Garden Dance Party at Brookfield Place (All Ages)

venue.name: Central Harlem location to be announced

results.description:
It's party time! We're gathering just before the holiday frenzy kicks in to high gear. So why not relax in a beautiful floor through apartment in Central Harlem?

One of our fellow VegOuters, Sergio, is opening his home to us on Saturday evening, December 12.  His apartment is perfect for entertaining.  If the food we bring is anything like the potlucks we had on Thanksgiving and Halloween, then we're sure to be satisfied.  People have been making a wonderful effort lately.

Our Plan:

When you RSVP, please post what you will bring.  This will help us to avoid any duplication or a potluck entirely made up of tree-shaped cookies. Also, the four potato salads come to mind from the last Bryant Park potluck. Yikes!

Bring a vegan dish to share (no meat, poultry, fish, eggs, dairy or honey).

You will receive the address and directions 24 hours ahead.

Accessibility: This is a classic Harlem brownstone with a steep stoop and then stairs to the second floor. If you can manage stairs, we can assist with a manual wheelchair, should you have one.  The closest accessible subway is 125th street B,D,C,A trains.

Subway to 116th street on either the 2,3 or B,C lines.
results.how_to_find_us: Address will be messaged 24 hours prior
results.name: Holiday Potluck!

venue.name: littleBits Store:  A Lab For Creating Inventions Large and Small

results.description:
Hey Bitsters!

What better way to celebrate the launch of the new Star Wars movie than with a family-friendly costume party (so come dressed up)! Join us for an intergalactic night of invention, light saber duels, R2-D2 races and networking at our littleBits store in Soho. We are so excited to welcome you to an evening of Star Wars geekery, drinks, pizza, music and more.

The event is part of a Bit Wars Global Makeathon, taking place in over 50 cities around the world on the weekend of December 11. We encourage you to invent a new gadget for your favorite Star Wars character and bring it to the party. We'll have a community table set up for you to show off your gadgets!

We have limited spots and anticipate the event filling up fast. RSVP now to guarantee yourself a spot, but only if you are 100% sure you can attend. Make sure to say who you plan to dress up as in the comments below!

We understand that things do come up and plans change, so if you are unable to make it, please cancel as soon as possible, so that others have a chance to attend. We can’t wait to see you there!
results.name: Star Wars themed littleBits party @ the littleBits pop-up store in NYC [FREE]

venue.name: Winter Garden Atrium at Brookfield Place

results.description:
REGISTER FOR FREE TICKETS!

We have an awesome Quiet Clubbing Dance party in lower Manhattan at the Winter Garden at Brookfield Place. This spot is AMAZING! With palm trees covering the dance floor and a lighting display to dance under, it’s one event not to miss!

This event is open to all ages, but we recommend bringing the young ones to the party on Sunday. Oh yea, did we mention this event is FREE!
Untitled-2

Three Live DJs spinning:
Green DJ: Top40 & kids favorites
Red DJ: 80’s, 90’s, 2k
Blue DJ: Hiphop

What’s included:
Quiet Events Headphones
3 Live DJs battling for your attention.

Special Notes:
Tickets are FREE but limited to 500 people
This party is going on rain or shine.
This Party is for all ages
Drinks available outside of the dance floor @ Le District
Arrive early to dine and shop at Brookfield Place before you dance!

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJs with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: FREE Winter Garden Dance Party at Brookfield Place (All Ages)

results.description:
This is a repost from a Facebook Event Page, please join the fb page to stay updated on this event:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1049675645064475/1055197491178957/

*****SLEIGH SESSIONS 2015*****

Sleigh Sessions is a group ride through the mean streets of Manhattan, NYC! We'll be bringing cheer to the masses - on a longboard - skateboard - and bike! All are welcome!

Required: Santa suits are becoming very affordable - so get one! If you can't muster up the courage to get a Santa Suit - dress as an Elf - or at least wear a Santa hat! You get the point...

Mike La Manna has set up a longer route to take which includes different Avenues and neighborhoods. And of course photo ops!

NO MORE TOYS: This year we require each person to donate 2 cans of food which will then be donated to the food bank of Clifton, NJ. We are donating the food in honor of our fallen brother Noel Korman and the Shralpers Union!
results.how_to_find_us: Meeting at 106th Street and Central Park West -- 50 W 106th St, New York, New York 10025
results.name: Sleigh Sessions 2015

results.description:
Please join us for an evening of Reiki Healing and Live Music sponsored by Harada Chiropractic, with CRS Healer Reiko Harada and Sony best-selling recording artist Senri Oe. Reiko Harada works as an ACIM-based healer at CRS and as a Usui, Karuna & Litarian Reiki Master / Teacher Spiritual Counselor and ANGEL THERAPY PRACTITIONER (certified by Doreen Virtue, PhD) at Harada Chiropractic and elsewhere. reikiangelichealing.blog.fc2.com

Tickets are $20 cash and include a hot beverage and snack. Reservations can be made via phone[masked] or email [masked].

Senri Oe’s international debut all-jazz album, “Boys Mature Slow,” (PND Records) released in July 2012, has generated many rave reviews from the top music magazines including”Jazziz” and “Down Beat” in NYC. After its release in Japan in Sept. 2012 (Distributer: Village Music), this “Boys Mature Slow” got “The Album of the Year: new star (Nissan presents “Jazz Japan” Awards 2012).

Oe has been active and influential in Japanese music scene as a lyricist, composer and arranger since he debuted in 1983. He extended his talent in the TV and film industry, and went on flourishing as an actor and TV personality as well. Major awards he won are Japan Gold Disc Grand Prix: Best Male Pop Artist 1988 and FNS Pop Music Award: Best song of the Year 1989.

In Jan. 2008, Oe decided to pause his 25 year-long careers in popular music for pursuing jazz and moved to New York studying under Aaron Goldberg, Junior Mance….. Oe graduated from The New School for Jazz and Contemporary Music in May 2012.

Oe is mainly performing at Tomi Jazz monthly, 53rd street, btw 2nd and 3rd avenue. He is also appearing at jazz clubs and venues throughout NYC: Zinc Bar, SOB, Blue Note, NY City Winery…….

Recently, Oe’s 2nd album” Spooky Hotel” (distributed by Village Music) went to the top in the Billboard Japan Jazz Charts and he performed at Tokyo Jazz Festival 2013 (at Tokyo international forum Hall A) with Oe’s big band from NYC and Sheila Jordan (his jazz icon). His 3rd album, “Collective Scribble” was released in Feb of 2015.

http://peaceneverdie.com/
results.how_to_find_us: above Think Coffee (look for the brown door to the right/south of Think and ring the bottom buzzer)

results.description:
WHEN: Saturday, December 12th 2015 (7:30 PM- 12:30 AM) It's perfectly fine if you arrive at 8:00 or after. You don't have to arrive exactly on time.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING FROM OVER 15 DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUPS! THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Nov 28 Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


SO WHAT'S A LOCKBOX PARTY?
The first event of it's kind, A LockBox Party™ is a mixer for single professionals to mingle, win prizes and have an absolute blast! You'll mingle with over 150 other fun singles while sipping cocktails (if you so choose to) and listening to great music at just the right volume for mingling...
WOMEN GET A LOCKBOX
Upon entering the event, every woman will receive a lockbox. Well, we're using the word "lockbox" loosely... Women will receive a vinyl pouch that will be locked shut with a 3 digit combination lock. Inside the lockbox there a 2 prizes (his and hers)...
MEN GET A 3 DIGIT COMBINATION NUMBER
Upon entering, every man will receive a 3 digit combination number that will open one (or a few) of the women's lockboxes. While mingling and having fun, the men will be trying out their combinations on different women's locks. Oh, and women can feel free to approach the men and ask what combination number they have. Once you find the combination that opens the "lockbox" you'll find 2 gifts inside. One for the woman and one for the man. Yes, you both get a prize!
EVERYONE GETS A PRIZE!
There is a prize for everyone attending so ladies, don't give up on finding the combination that opens your lock and men don't give up on finding the lockbox (or multiple lockboxes) that your 3 digit combination number opens. The party runs until 12:30 AM so after you get your prize, keep mingling with other singles, have more cocktails and have fun!


This is event is not overly structured or rigid. You can relax and mingle at your own pace (participate as much or as little as you like. Either way you'll have a good time!)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Nov 28 Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

results.description:
SO WHAT'S A LOCKBOX PARTY? 

The first event of it's kind, A LockBox Party™ is a mixer for single professionals to mingle, win prizes and have an absolute blast! You'll mingle with 100+ other fun singles while sipping cocktails (if you so choose to) and listening to great music at just the right volume for mingling... 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Get tickets here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/lockbox/

How it works:

WOMEN GET A LOCKBOX  
Upon entering the event, every woman will receive a lockbox. We're using the word "lockbox" loosely... Women will receive a vinyl pouch that will be locked shut with a 3 digit combination lock. Inside the lockbox there a 2 prizes (his & hers) 

MEN GET A 3 DIGIT COMBINATION NUMBER 
Upon entering, every man will receive a 3 digit combination number that will open one (or a few) of the women's lockboxes. While mingling and having fun, the men will be trying out their combinations on different women's locks. Oh, and women can feel free to approach the men and ask what combination number they have. 

Once you find the combination that opens the "lockbox" you'll find 2 gifts inside. One for the woman and one for the man. Yes, you both get a prize! EVERYONE GETS A PRIZE! 

MUST PURCHASE TICKET IN ADVANCE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/lockbox/

What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers (8-9pm) 

• Drink Specials

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• 100+ singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s+ 

• Ice Breakers & Prizes 

*MUST PURCHASE TICKET IN ADVANCE ($20) - 

http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/lockbox/

*Price goes up to $30 as the event date gets closer. We recommend getting tickets ASAP to save $ and guarantee your spot. This event will sell out, especially for women. 

• Typically 80% of attendees come alone (20% bring friends) 

• Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts) 

• MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. 100+ SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES. NON ETHNIC SPECIFIC.

PREPAY ONLY - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/lockbox/

group.name: #1 NYC Singles Group: Singles Events, Happy Hours & More!

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 25-35--1m/3f spots left

results.description:
Luke Donforth will call a lively program of contras accompanied by Party of Three!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance with Luke Donforth and Party of Three!

results.name: LockBox Singles Party! (Gifts For Everyone, Light Appetizers, Icebreakers)

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Our Beer Garden Meetups have been smashing times and many of us want another to carry on where we left off at our favorite hydrating stop, The Zeppelin Hall Beer Garden; there is no better place! 

So whether beer, wine, or mixed-drinks, come out to race talk, drink, and be merry! Whether you are a staple at our morning or evening runs, haven't been out for a while, or haven't come to a meetup run yet, this is a great chance to get together. Discuss how and what to do for winter running, or when to start preparation for next year 2016 spring races, RSVP and meet the amazing crazy winter runners.

If you have joined the group and are on the fence about coming out for a run, come out, grab a beer, and ask us any questions you have on how often we run, pace, etc. We have a group of very experienced runners who offer great advice and runners of all shapes, sizes, and speeds so everyone will feel right at home.

Any questions, ask in a comment below... or ask us at the Beer Garden! Prost!
results.how_to_find_us: Usually in the front room, or could be at the last room too. One of us should put a comment of the location when we get better space in the hall. Please wait or look around we will be there.
results.name: DECEMBER BEER GARDEN MEETUP! Saturday December 12, 2015

group.name: Jersey City Road and Trail Running Meetup

results.description:
Get your tickets & details at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/lockbox.html

WHEN: Saturday, December 12th 2015 (7:30 PM- 12:30 AM) It's perfectly fine if you arrive at 8:00 or after. You don't have to arrive exactly on time.
WHERE: Tagine (221 W. 38th St)

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING FROM OVER 15 DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUPS! THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

SO WHAT'S A LOCKBOX PARTY?
The first event of it's kind, A LockBox Party™ is a mixer for single professionals to mingle, win prizes and have an absolute blast! You'll mingle with over 150 other fun singles while sipping cocktails (if you so choose to) and listening to great music at just the right volume for mingling...
WOMEN GET A LOCKBOX
Upon entering the event, every woman will receive a lockbox. Well, we're using the word "lockbox" loosely... Women will receive a vinyl pouch that will be locked shut with a 3 digit combination lock. Inside the lockbox there a 2 prizes (his and hers)...
MEN GET A 3 DIGIT COMBINATION NUMBER
Upon entering, every man will receive a 3 digit combination number that will open one (or a few) of the women's lockboxes. While mingling and having fun, the men will be trying out their combinations on different women's locks. Oh, and women can feel free to approach the men and ask what combination number they have. Once you find the combination that opens the "lockbox" you'll find 2 gifts inside. One for the woman and one for the man. Yes, you both get a prize!
EVERYONE GETS A PRIZE!
There is a prize for everyone attending so ladies, don't give up on finding the combination that opens your lock and men don't give up on finding the lockbox (or multiple lockboxes) that your 3 digit combination number opens. The party runs until 12:30 AM so after you get your prize, keep mingling with other singles, have more cocktails and have fun!

This is event is not overly structured or rigid. You can relax and mingle at your own pace (participate as much or as little as you like. Either way you'll have a good time!)

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door and may sell out for one gender (in our attempt to keep the event gender balanced) so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/lockbox.html

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Prizes For Everyone!
* Drink Specials!
* FREE Appetizers From 8:00 to 9:00
*Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
*Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
*Suggested Age Range: 20s, 30s & 40s Welcome To Attend 

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/lockbox.html

One of the great things about  our events is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/lockbox.html

Upon entering the event, every woman will receive a lockbox. Well, we're using the word "lockbox" loosely... Women will receive a vinyl pouch that will be locked shut with a 3 digit combination lock. Inside the lockbox there a 2 prizes (his and hers)...
MEN GET A 3 DIGIT COMBINATION NUMBER
Upon entering, every man will receive a 3 digit combination number that will open one (or a few) of the women's lockboxes. While mingling and having fun, the men will be trying out their combinations on different women's locks. Oh, and women can feel free to approach the men and ask what combination number they have. Once you find the combination that opens the "lockbox" you'll find 2 gifts inside. One for the woman and one for the man. Yes, you both get a prize!
EVERYONE GETS A PRIZE!
There is a prize for everyone attending so ladies, don't give up on finding the combination that opens your lock and men don't give up on finding the lockbox (or multiple lockboxes) that your 3 digit combination number opens. The party runs until 12:30 AM so after you get your prize, keep mingling with other singles, have more cocktails and have fun!


This is event is not overly structured or rigid. You can relax and mingle at your own pace (participate as much or as little as you like. Either way you'll have a good time!)
