One of the great things about  our events is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/lockbox.html
results.name: LockBox Singles Party! (Gifts For Everyone, Light Appetizers, Icebreakers)

results.description:
Get your tickets & details at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/lockbox.html

WHEN: Saturday, December 12th 2015 (7:30 PM- 12:30 AM) It's perfectly fine if you arrive at 8:00 or after. You don't have to arrive exactly on time.
WHERE: Tagine (221 W. 38th St)

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING FROM OVER 15 DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUPS! THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

SO WHAT'S A LOCKBOX PARTY?
The first event of it's kind, A LockBox Party™ is a mixer for single professionals to mingle, win prizes and have an absolute blast! You'll mingle with over 150 other fun singles while sipping cocktails (if you so choose to) and listening to great music at just the right volume for mingling...
WOMEN GET A LOCKBOX
Upon entering the event, every woman will receive a lockbox. Well, we're using the word "lockbox" loosely... Women will receive a vinyl pouch that will be locked shut with a 3 digit combination lock. Inside the lockbox there a 2 prizes (his and hers)...
MEN GET A 3 DIGIT COMBINATION NUMBER
Upon entering, every man will receive a 3 digit combination number that will open one (or a few) of the women's lockboxes. While mingling and having fun, the men will be trying out their combinations on different women's locks. Oh, and women can feel free to approach the men and ask what combination number they have. Once you find the combination that opens the "lockbox" you'll find 2 gifts inside. One for the woman and one for the man. Yes, you both get a prize!
EVERYONE GETS A PRIZE!
There is a prize for everyone attending so ladies, don't give up on finding the combination that opens your lock and men don't give up on finding the lockbox (or multiple lockboxes) that your 3 digit combination number opens. The party runs until 12:30 AM so after you get your prize, keep mingling with other singles, have more cocktails and have fun!

This is event is not overly structured or rigid. You can relax and mingle at your own pace (participate as much or as little as you like. Either way you'll have a good time!)

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door and may sell out for one gender (in our attempt to keep the event gender balanced) so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/lockbox.html

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Prizes For Everyone!
* Drink Specials!
* FREE Appetizers From 8:00 to 9:00
*Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
*Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
*Suggested Age Range: 20s, 30s & 40s Welcome To Attend 

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/lockbox.html

One of the great things about  our events is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/lockbox.html

results.description:
Mix, Mingle and be Merry! Join 100+ members for our last mix & match singles mingle of the year! This mixer is a fun way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience!   

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.  

PREPAY ONLY ($15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer) 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Dec-12-2015_at_0800PM

Here is how it works:

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature: 

• Free Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink specials

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Food menu available 

• Music played at conversational levels

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No Tix Sold At Door). Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Dec-12-2015_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 100+ members attending. MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Dec-12-2015_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided
results.name: Merry Mix & Match Singles Mingle (Apps, Drink Specials, Icebreakers) Prepay Only

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the  8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you  NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you  EXPERIENCED DANCERS , there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor

(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes choice of free class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 4 then 'CALL' on the intercom*
results.how_to_find_us: Ask desk to direct you to your Organizers: Lori & Cindi
results.name: "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party at Club 412

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$15 prepay only

Pre-Pay here https://nysnmixmatch.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

results.name: Singles Mix & Match Happy Hour - Over 60 pre-paid

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by over a dozen different Singles groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$15 prepay only

Pre-Pay here https://nysnmixmatch.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.
results.name: Singles Mix, Mingle & Happy Hour - 20's to 40's Singles

THIS IS A MULTI-GROUP EVENT.

results.description:
Come celebrate Sea Shepherd Conservation Society NYC Chapter's five year anniversary at a special holiday edition of S'more Protection for the Oceans 2016, with special guest, Sea Shepherd founder Captain Paul Watson (via Skype).

This year, we will be at the new V-Spot Organic in Manhattan. Like the past five years of S'more Protection for the Oceans, there will be all you can eat s'mores, made with Sweet and Sara marshmallows, plus other sweets from local bakeries. As always, you will have your chance to win amazing prizes in our raffle of eco-friendly jewelry, gifts, and other items. We will be selling official Sea Shepherd merchandise, talking about our past campaigns, and talking about how you can get involved in defending, conserving, and protecting all marine wildlife.

Sea Shepherd Conservation Society is an international non-profit, marine wildlife conservation organization. Our mission is to end the destruction of habitat and slaughter of wildlife in the world's oceans in order to conserve and protect ecosystems and species by using innovative direct-action tactics to investigate, document, and take action when necessary to expose and confront illegal activities on the high seas.

General admission tickets are $20.

VIP tickets are $35 and include a gift bag containing vintage Sea Shepherd gear.

Buy tickets: http://seashepherd.org/smores

If you cannot make it to the event, you can still support our campaigns here: https://my.seashepherd.org/?pid=879
results.name: S'more Protection for the Oceans 2015

Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - Trying something new.


Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.
results.how_to_find_us: Park is right off of Kent Ave + N 10th St. - (L) Bedford Ave, or (G) Nassau Ave

The Empire Steppers of New York proudly present a

CARLOS AND BENDETTA STEPPIN' WEEKEND


DECEMBER 11 - 13, 2015

Get ready! The crowd favorites are coming to town. Known for their great steppin' style and intricate combinations, Carlos and Bendetta have been competing for years in the steppin' game and will bring all that they know to New York to share with us.

Saturday, December 12, 2015 


1pm - 3pm Stepping Workshop  - Ripley Grier Studio, 520 8th Avenue, New York, NY. Improve your stepping technique, learn how to trio, and get your Walk on the right way. Workshop $20 (pay at the door).


8pm - 1am - Dinner Dance at the Steam House in Mount Vernon, NY

Dine on delicious food while you party in a great atmosphere. This party is for everyone, bring your family and friends out for a great evening of dinner and dancing for the holiday season. We will get our step on and have music for everyone's taste. Event is $25 and includes dinner if you purchase your ticket in advance. $30 at the door.

For more information, to purchase tickets or to schedule a private on Sunday, contact Dolores at [masked] or[masked]-7129. To purchase tickets in New Jersey contact Michelle Blue Harper at[masked]-1722.


Get ready to step your game up with Carlos and Bendetta!

Secret Loft and Brooklyn Wildlife presents: 


The craziest Chrismukkahkwanza party you will attend this season. Expect mistletoe, libations, reindeer games, fake snow, decorations, and a lot of Holiday Cheer. Leave the GRINCH at home (unless you will actually wear a Grinch costume)…

Bring your Christmas Bells, your tannenbaum, your evil St. Nick costume, your freaky elf consume.. and def your ugly sweaters. 

Photobooth with SANTA.. 

DJ's, live music, and some gifts for the most naughty/nice revelers. 

Spiced eggnog and other refreshments available.


Ugly sweater contest w/ champagne prize

Live music by:


Honi Harlow (burlesque)


Lilly Wolf (synth pop)


Crimdella (hip hop)


Paco the G Train Bandit (hip hop)


Shane MauX (hip hop)


Stonehenge Parnhashnakovsky (hip hop)


Others TBA

DJ Que Cee on the 1's and 2's


Photobooth with SANTA.. 

DJ's, live music, and some gifts for the most naughty/nice revelers. 

Spiced eggnog and other refreshments available.

Ugly sweater contest w/ champagne prize

21+ 
Starts at 9pm 
$5 early, $10 late

results.description:
Sat Dec 12 - PMJAMNITES Live Music Showcase PMJ is being held on a Saturday due to a private event conflict schedule.
Featured artist for the night:


7pm - 10 pm / Red Pick Music School
--------------------------------------------------------
Exclusive event for Red Pick Music Student performances with family and friends. Solo and group performances , Hosted by RED PICK Music Teacher - Bilgehan Tuncer


The Regular PMJamnites will begin at 10pm, with live band Forget the Whale.


10:30 pm - 11:30 pm / Forget the Whale
---------------------------------------------------------------
Forget the Whale, a four piece hailing primarily from Jersey City, includes members Alishia Taiping (lead vocals, bass) Dan Pieraccini (bass, keys, vocals), Peter Durning (guitar, harmonica) and AJ Zienowicz (drums, vocals).Forget the Whale has, a ‘sound’ is not one of them. It’s not that they have no sound: blues, rock, alternative, R&B, country, funk and nu-metal all become ingredients for Forget the Whale’s veritable witches’ brew. “Forget the Whale is the band to see,” was one auspicious comment that emerged from their debut showcase at Rolf’s Restaurant and Pub (Warren, NJ) in August of 2014. Since then, the four have taken their show on both banks of the Hudson, filling notable venues like The Bitter End in the Village and Brooklyn’s Matchless Bar in New York .
Venue: Dorrian's, 555 Washington Blvd, Jersey City, NJ

Free Entry with RSVP here or on Facebook. RSVP by Friday Dec 11 on meetup or RSVP on our Facebook page.


More info : https://www.facebook.com/events/1628326164079781/


Follow us on Facebook: PMJamnites
Instagram / Twitter @Playmusician


====================================

PMJAMNITES
----------------------

is an event held regularly at Dorrian's to attract & showcase local talent and create an artistically social event. Artists pre-sign up to perform and are delegated a slot to perform . Designated Artists are featured and showcased .

PMJAMNITES LIVE MUSIC  begins at 9:00 pm thru 12:00 am

PLAYMUSICIAN

-----------------------
For more Info / news / pics / videos Visit :- Facebook.com/PMJAMNITES

PlayMusician provides a platform for artists, both upcoming and established, to showcase their talent, ranging from singer /songwriters , photographers, comediens, dancers, solo artists, spoken-word/poetry, full bands and more..

We promote local artists and musicians by creating musical events with eclectic themes and showcasing them. Seasoned artists are matched with up and coming artists.

We provide a comfortable, laid back venue with the intention of being a place where people can come together and enjoy local artists, and eventually becoming a staple in the community.

An artist’s passion is what we hope to support and encourage. It’s an artist community or family that we hope to grow through our events, website, social media and personal networking.

We help local businesses such as bars/restaurants become music venues .
Playmusician has been an artist bedrock since 2010.

WWW.FACEBOOK.COM/PMJAMNITES
WWW.PLAYMUSICIAN.COM/

ARTS . COMMUNITY . EVENTS

Facebook ADD : "playmusician"
Please "Like" playmusician/PMJAMNITES on facebook.
results.name: PMJAMNITES - 9pm ONWARDS / DORRIANS , JC

results.description:
http://privegroupticket.com/ssantacon

On Saturday December 12th, 2015, Privé Group and Wolface Entertainment presents the Annual “Sexy SantaCon After Party” held at The Leonora in Manhattan and hosted by the finest adult entertainment star Jayden Jaymes. Join us to keep celebrating the SantaCon tradition and for a great night of music and friends. 

http://privegroupticket.com/ssantacon

http://privegroupticket.com/ssantacon

Born and raised in Los Angeles, Jayden Michelle Jaymes has grown into one of the most successful models in the USA. She partnered up with Penthouse early in her career giving birth to one of the greatest TV shows that the magazine has produced. 

In 2013 she moved to NYC to further her career and now she has become incredibly popular in both coasts. We have the honor to have Jayden Jaymes hosting our event. 

For those die hard fans we give you the opportunity to meet Jayden prior to the event so be on the look out for those meet & greet tickets. 

For the rest of you, come enjoy the biggest after party of the famed SantaCon! If you didn’t have enough during the day, those wearing hats or Santa gear will be able to take advantage of some drink specials. 

Get your sexy on and come along!
results.name: Sexy SantaCon Afterparty

Friends,

results.description:
Our friends from CT invited NY-NoJ's Young Members to join their holiday hike in Kent. We plan to hike a six-mile portion of the Appalachian Trail and we’ll kick off the hike with a steep, rocky and leaf littered ascent to Fuller Mountain. The hike continues with rolling terrain on a rocky ridge that offers views of the Housatonic Valley. We’ll continue on the trail until we reach Caleb’s Peak, which is where we’ll break for lunch. We’ll then continue north on the Appalachian Trail until we descend the steep eastern shoulder of Caleb’s Peak via switchbacks to the ground-level and then we'll ascend to the top of St. John’s Ledges, which offers great views of the Valley. After the hike, we will meet with another AMC hiking group for dinner at Kent Pizza Garden at 4:00pm. We’ll then stroll through Kent to view lighted holiday decorations. We should be back in NYC around 8:00pm.

Registration:

If you’d like to join, please email Jae at [masked]. The NY-NoJ group will be capped at 12-people.

Transportation:

We’ll carpool to Kent, CT and back. The leader will pick up hikers at a convenient location in Manhattan at 7:30am. Exact details will be emailed to registrants. Expect to contribute $15-$20 for rental, toll and gas.

Note:

Bring plenty of water, snack, lunch and wear appropriate layering clothing. We’ll cancel in the event of inclement weather.
results.name: Young Members - Holiday Celebration and Hike with CT Chapter

venue.name: Ramapo Mountain State Forest Lower Parking Lot

results.description:
Let's start the day right with a brisk hike!


[masked], [masked] are the exact GPS Coordinates for the trail head.  The lower lot is technically right across the street from 64 Skyline Drive address.

Faster hike.  7 ish miles, with about a 900 ft elevation gain

We will meet at the LOWER lot of skyline drive in Oakland at 7:00am. This will be approximately a 2 - 3 hour hike.

We will take the blue trail to Ramapo Lake and left on Lake Shore Drive Carriage Road around the lake to a brief meetup with the Cannonball trail but headed to orange.  Once on orange we will cross over the pipeline and head to overlook view points and then follow the orange on a beautiful loop back to the pipeline.  We'll then head up the pipeline to the top and make a right on the white trail that leads us to some nice views.


We will walk through the Van Slyke Castle. http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/">http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/</a>;  and descend down most likely we'll take the white back to lake shore road with a probable detour through an unmarked shortcut.  Once on lake shore we can run, jog or walk back to the dam where we'll get some pics and hang out a bit before descending blue back to the parking lot.


This route may change depending on group so please have a map or gps.

http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf"></a>" class="linkified">http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf;

--------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers. 

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.
results.name: Skyline Drive Ramapo Park (NJ) - Fast Pace

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.name: Touch Rugby in the Park
Sunday soccer  - (Advanced players only)

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

NEW CLASS STARTS TODAY

This is pool session one for new students starting their diving course.

Your Journey to Adventure starts today. After a brief presentation we will gear up and get started in the pool.

If you have not yet enrolled, please contact the Dive Center to get started [masked]

RSVP required

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must: 
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6

CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

"Instructors": Kelley Scharf, Andre R.

"Facility": 1-877-SCUBA-USA",

"Agency" : SDI" 

Others": Pablo M. Jay K.

Sign and date at bottom

Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
Приглашаем на маршрут с красивыми видами. Недалеко от NYC

Пройдем по Appalachian Trail. С высоты Bellvale Mountain посмотрим на Greenwood Lake. 

Вам понадобятся:

- ботинки

- вода

Координаты парковки не совсем точные. Пожалуйста, используйте описание!

Парковка В ЛЕСУ около Greenwood Lake Marina!!!!!


Поверните в ЛЕС!!!!!!!!!!

--------------------------------------------------------

This is one of the most spectacular hikes in the New Jersey-New York metropolitan area. Although it begins with a fairly strenuous 600-foot climb, the rest of the hike does not involve any major elevation changes. There are, however, many short, steep ups and downs, some of which require you to use your hands as well as your feet.

Map: Sterling Forest Trail
GPS:[masked], [masked]

Distance : 7 miles

Difficulty: Moderate

You need:

- hiking boots

-water

Directions:

To park for this hike travel on Route 17A from Warwick to Greenwood Lake. At the bottom of the hill stay right on Route 210 through the village of Greenwood Lake. Route 210 travels along the west shore of the lake and heads toward New Jersey. Watch for a sign that says "Welcome to New Milford Township". Just before the sign turn up the driveway to the trailhead parking.

-------------------------------

Take I-287 to Exit 57 and continue on Skyline Drive to its western end at Greenwood Lake Turnpike (County Route 511) in Ringwood. Turn right and proceed for 8.2 miles to an intersection with Lakeside Road. Turn right and follow Lakeside Road (still designated County Route 511) for 2.4 miles to the Greenwood Lake Marina, just south of the New Jersey-New York boundary. Turn left and park on the left side of the dirt access road, west of Lakeside Road. Do not, under any circumstances, park on the private property of the Greenwood Lake Marina, on the east side of Lakeside Road.

--------------------------------

When you sign up with this group for any of the events you have read and understand the following:

If you join us for hiking (or any other event), understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. It is your responsibility to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on this trip signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Please, review safety information

http://www.meetup.com/Brodyaga/files/

-----------------------------------

Будем очень рады выпить с Вами по бокалу пива ПОСЛЕ маршрута :-)
На маршруте алкоголь абсолютно неприемлем.
---------------------------

results.description:
Due to an overwhelming amount of entries during the past week, the Fat Ass Trail Mix-up 30K & 50K scheduled for December 13 at Alley Pond Park is now officially CLOSED.  No more entries will be accepted.  We are greatly sorry for this discouraging news and inconvenience.  Thank you. 


The 2nd running of the Fat Ass Trail Mix-up will be held on Sunday, December 13 at Alley Pond Park starting at 9:00 AM. This event will be the final stage of the New York Ultra Running (NYUR) Grand Prix Series and could determine the GP winners for 2015. You can enter by mail or on this page through Ultra Signup (with no added fee). The event will be two races in one: a 30-kilometer and a 50-kilometer but not separate. There only will be one start, and if you do go on to 50K, you still will be recorded with an official time and place for 30K. You DO NOT have to declare what distance (30K or 50K) you are running.


If you ran the event last year, there have been a few changes. The Start & Finish will be by the Alley Field House on Winchester Blvd. not the Picnic area. Hence, we will be able to use the Field House (instead of tents) for indoor activities like for pre-race registration, post-race refreshments and award distributions. The course has also slightly changed. The loop is longer.


The race loop has been divided into two sections. The “morning” loop and the “afternoon” loop. The former will be four circuits of 4.66-miles to equate to 30K. This loop is a combination of 60% paved park paths and 40% trail. When 30K is completed, you then will only need to run 4 more circuits but without the trail portion plus some added distance to complete 50K. That loop will be around 2¾ miles. There will be an aid station at the trail entrance (and exit), and a race volunteer will direct you on your 5th loop. All entries by December 9 will receive a colorful crew neck sweat shirt with the “Fat Ass” logo. All finishing awards will display a fat ass figurine and something more distinctive for those completing 50K.


A full Information Sheet and manual Entry Form can be downloaded on the NYUR Site. If you register on-line on Ultra Signup select either the 50K or 30K, but you can change your mind when you finish the 1st four loops.

Please assist with race planning by entering as soon as you can. Thanks.
results.name: BUS Fat Ass Trail Mix-up

results.description:
Lets Catch the MTA "Vintage Special" a train consisting of eight cars from the 1930s through the 1970's and ride history to the Lower East Side for some exploring of  key destinations including , Russ n Daughters , Economy Candy , Las Venus, Vintage Holiday finds and lunch at famous Katz's Deli

Meet at the Mineola LIRR Station by 9:15 AM and we will catch the 9:31 to Jamaica . we will be standing by the ticket machines ..... Or meet us at the overpass walk of Jamaica Station by the News Stand at 9:45 -10:05.....  We will then take the E train to Queens Plaza

It is here we will catch the Nostalgia Train for its trip on the M line to 2nd Ave and the Lower East Side ...

Here ....there is much history to explore with planned visits to Economy Candy , Vintage and Top recommended stores with Lunch at Katz Deli

Bring Cash as CC's are not accepted at Katz's  ...All subways including the Nostalgia train are just the cost of a $2.75 Metro card..  Dress appropriate for what could be a cold day....Gloves etc...  Walking is limited to a 4 - 5 square block area..  there is No charge for joining us ..... :)

 The cars, which were ordered for the Independent Subway System (IND), were the first subway cars to be identified by their contract numbers, hence the R1/9 designations. R1/9 cars, known as ““City-Cars,” have rattan seats, ceiling fans, incandescent light bulbs, and roll signs for passenger information. Their design of more doors that were also wider and faster, plus increased standing capacity to accommodate crowds, served as the model of modern subway cars, and their dimensions are identical to the latest R160 cars. They were retired from service in 1977.

VINTAGE FLEET HIGHLIGHTS:

Subway Car No. 100: Manufactured by American Car & Foundry, this R1-type car was the first car in the initial order of 300 placed in service for the opening of the IND subway.

Subway Car No. 484: Part of a 500-car order of R4 cars manufactured by American Car & Foundry. In 1946, this car received a retrofit of bulls-eye lighting and a public address system.

Subway Car No. 1575: Originally manufactured as an R7, this car was sent to the American Car & Foundry factory and rebuilt as prototype of the next generation R10 subway car.

Subway Car No. 6095: In 1925, the Brooklyn-Manhattan Transit Corporation (BMT) introduced a three-car articulated unit called the D-Type Triplex. The design meant passengers could walk from one car to another in the unit through an enclosed passageway. They carried more passengers and had fewer moving parts, making them efficient and easier to maintain.
results.name: Ride the MTA's Vintage Nostalgia Subway Train to Lower East Side History n Eats

results.description:
Since we had fun on the last hike, lets do another local one in Harriman St Park and increase the mileage. We will hike a loop around Silvermine Lake and Turkey Hill Lake.  From the Silvermine Lake parking lot head west towards the picnic area where you will find the yellow blazes of the Menomine Trail.

Please read the description below for full details:

http://gonehikin.blogspot.com/2010/11/harriman-state-park-ny-silvermine-lake.html

Trail Description: 12 miles

[  0.00]  West through picnic area on yellow-blazed Menamine Trail
[  1.50]  Right on teal-blazed Long Path
[  4.10]  Straight at intersection with red square on white Popolopen Gorge Trail
[  4.40]  Torrey memorial
[  5.00]  Left on unmarked woods road
[  5.40]  Straight on red square on what Polopopen Gorge Trail
[  6.00]  Turkey Hill Lake; right on white-blazed Anthony Wayne Trail
[  7.00]  Right on 1779 Trail
[  8.50]  Right on white-blazed Appalachian Trail/red circle on white Ramapo-Dunderberg Trail
[10.40]  Right on yellow-blazed Menomine Trail
[11.90]  Silvermine Lake parking lot

Trailhead GPS Coordinates:[masked],[masked]

Driving Directions:

Take N.J. Route 17 north to the New York State Thruway and take the first exit, Exit 15A (Sloatsburg). Turn left at the bottom of the ramp onto N.Y. Route 17 north, and continue through the Village of Sloatsburg. About half a mile past the village, turn right at a temporary traffic light, cross the railroad tracks, and continue along Washington Avenue for 0.5 mile to a T-intersection with Seven Lakes Drive. Turn left, passing under the Thruway, and continue along Seven Lakes Drive for about 12 miles to the Silvermine Picnic Area, on the right side of the road (the Silvermine Picnic Area is 2.1 miles beyond Tiorati Circle). Park in the large parking area near the entrance (a parking fee is charged on weekends in the summer).


</a><a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_JpNJOnokf_c/TO-w1KzwnDI/AAAAAAAACLk/qThnC3ba2fo/s1600/P1010216+parking+lot+start+of+trail.jpg">
results.name: Silvermine Lake to Turkey Hill Lake Loop @ Harriman (12 Miles - Intermediate)

ADMISSION PRICE: $11. Pay directly to Nick at the event.

DESCRIPTION:


Whether you want to play competitively, hit around, or even just check out the hot guys and girls, you've come to the right place. I will try to host the badminton events on bi-weekly basis in order to provide you with an badminton experience where you can get your daily exercise in, improve at the game of badminton, and socialize with other fellow badminton-ers, all at the same time!

After the badminton event, we will have lunch together at Flushing.


To have a good play experience, we will put a cap of  8 on the attendee.
Please only RSVP when you are sure you will show up.

WEAR:
Sport cloth and sneaker.

BRING:
Badminton racquets and birdies, bottles of water, towel and clothes to change.
PS.If you don't have a badminton racquet, you can rent one at the center for $4 per day and $20 deposit.

LOCATION:
New York Badminton Center,[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 ( enter 34th Ave from College Point Blvd )
New York Badminton Center (NYBC) is designated badminton facility with 6 international tournament standard Badminton floor mats on top of 3″ high wood floor elevation for maximum shock absorbing and pressure reduction to knees and ankles.  Center also equipped with Table Tennis, Weights room, kids room, and spacious resting area, large bathrooms. Center opens 7 days all year around. It offers the convenience for players to play on any of the days they prefer. Center is close to public transportation (about 10 mins walking), street parking is also available.   

For more info about NY Badminton Center, check the link in the reference section below. 


TRANSPORTATION:
Subway: #7 train to Main St. Station, 10-13 min walk.



REFERENCE LINK:

• http://newyorkbadmintoncenter.com/

DISCLAIMER:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer

END

Purchase tickets wherever you'd like... http://www.stubhub.com/new-york-jets-tickets-new-york-jets-east-rutherford-metlife-stadium-12-13-2015/event/9298559/

Arrive early to tailgate with us 9:30am. Bring some beers/food to share, we'll have some food, but probably not enough to go around.

We will post what parking lot we are at when we arrive. you can try to park near us, or if not, just head on over. You need a parking pass to park at the stadium, so carpooling is encouraged.you must buy the parking pass in advance, or else they will park you a mile away and you'll have to take a shuttle. http://www.stubhub.com/new-york-jets-tickets-parking-passes-only-titans-at-jets-east-rutherford-metlife-stadium-parking-lots-12-13-2015/event/9299514/

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
(***MEN AND WOMEN ARE WELCOME***) 

Meeting Your Dark Attraction And Awakening To Your Divine Nature
AN EXPLORATION OF FANTASIES, SEX AND LOVE

with Dr. Kristina Kincaid

Scuba Divers do an in depth exploration, Rock Climbers do it against the wall, Rockstars do it loud and Politicians do it to everyone. What exactly is this thing we do called sex and why are so obsessed with it? What makes it so pleasurable, titillating, frightening and shameful? Most of us think the other is satisfied, while we feel frustrated in our own desire and longing.

The primary processes of sexuality are energetic patterns created in our childhood, which are then mediated through the body. Most of us are not even aware of these energetic habits, such as the difference between being separate or merged or even our own preferences and those of our partners. Unencumbered from such habits, sex can become fresh, alive and open, an art form, a physical prayer, naked, unafraid and raw. Beyond self union, lies a greater union, a total orgasm with the whole, with Source itself.

This day long journey will be an exploration of how we can gain a conscious choosing over what and how our sexual energy moves. From pleasure to sharing, to heightening the spiritual embodiment of your sexuality, we will be in conscious exploration and discovery of these energies in you and how they affect your relationships.

The Awakened Sexuality Project is for participants who are longing for a deep spiritual journey and a strong willingness to venture and play where angels fear to tread. We will be working in the deep unconscious, uncovering where we turn away from some of our greatest gifts by delving into what has been deemed unspeakable and taboo. Through exploration of sexual fantasies, sexual constellation work, untamed passions, conscious play, body work, breath work, movement, intimacy, connection and respectful service to each other, we can come home to ourselves through a deep honoring of our gorgeous, unique and individual ways of loving.

When: Sunday Dec 13th, 2015, 10:00AM ~ 5:00 PM
Where: Institute of Core Energetics,
150 West 28th street, suite 1803, New York

Admission: $150 before Nov 22nd, 2015, $175 after

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sexual-fantasies-meeting-your-dark-attraction-awakening-to-love-tickets-19152986097

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup


Dr. Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

Questions?﻿ 
Call Kristina (917)[masked]


For future events for WOMEN ONLY check:http://www.meetup.com/Sex-And-Spirit/
results.name: Sexual Fantasies: Meeting Your Dark Attraction

results.description:
This series will explore a sacred text first developed in 5th century India known as the Lam Rim, or Gradual Path. During these sessions we will investigate a system of reflection on contemplative life and human development. Primary tools of meditation-based change, discursive learning, analytic reflection and focused contemplation will be examined as means to cultivate reliable states of compassion and equanimity, and to radically reduce suffering associated with anxiety and depression. Together we will learn about the relevance of this ancient spiritual text for addressing contemporary forms of stress and discontent while increasing our general well-being.

Dr. Pilar Jennings, a long- time practitioner of Tibetan and Vipassana Buddhism, is also a psychoanalyst who incorporates Buddhist teaching in her clinical practice. She earned a doctorate in Psychiatry and Religion from Union Theological Seminary and currently teaches courses though the Center for the Study of Science and Religion at Columbia University. She is also the author of Mixing Minds: The Power of Relationship in Psychoanalysis and Buddhism.

FYI, she is one of my favorite lecturers at All Soul's, I highly recommend her.

As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. This is about running trails and having fun! If you can’t run 13 miles and can only run 6, no worries! 

When:  10:18 am.

Via public transit: Take the 9:36 am Metro North (New Haven Line) train from Grand Central to Mamaroneck. Train arrives at 10:18 am. Travel time 42 minutes.

If you are driving: Put 1 Station Plaza, Mamaroneck, NY 10543 in your GPS.

Bag Drop/Etc: There is always a bush or a pile of leaves to stash your stuff in, just make sure everything important is on you while you run. Sometimes BTR members who own cars show up at this location.

results.description:
Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my  class!

WELCOME TO FALL YOGA! 

As Summer officially draws to an end, we look forward to a process of  reaping the harvest and letting go.  Fall is a time of transition and it is evident everywhere around us.  After the glorious celebration of summer, the trees and shrubs are undressing in preparation for the winter, the air is crisping, and the wind is whispering coming of the winter tides.  Although this may leave us feeling slightly down, the possibility to strip down to a quiet essence of being and and savor the simplicity is an opportunity for introspection.  Come slow and quiet down with us in a practice to balance the Vata dosha and learn how you can best take care of yourself this season....  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.  

Extra mats and blocks are limited, kindly bring yours if you have them.


*To offset Meetup Organizer's fees, a suggested donation between $7-10 will be greatly appreciated*

Thank you and please do post any questions.  I hope to see you soon! 

Jennifer ( 500 Hour Yoga Alliance Registered  Teacher)

results.description:
No hiking experience necessary!  Please come join in a morning stroll on Highline Park. If you wish to spend the weekend, several of us are staying at:

Hostel International

You are on your own for reservations.  One of our members recommended the hostel. Their website reservations are problematic. Get their phone number from their website and call them instead...

http://www.hiusa.org/new-york/new-york/new-york-city. It's clean and has a good west side location near Central Park.  


Please do not use the "no" rsvp function unless you need to cancel from a "yes". This is a standard preference for all Connecticut Hiking Alliance Meetups. Other Meetup groups may have a different preference.


http://www.thehighline.org

The High Line is an elevated freight rail line transformed into a public park on Manhattan’s West Side. It is owned by the City of New York, and maintained and operated by Friends of the High Line.

Founded in 1999 by community residents, Friends of the High Line fought for the High Line’s preservation and transformation at a time when the historic structure was under the threat of demolition. It is now the non-profit conservancy working with the New York City Department of Parks & Recreation to make sure the High Line is maintained as an extraordinary public space for all visitors to enjoy. In addition to overseeing maintenance, operations, and public programming for the park, Friends of the High Line works to raise the essential private funds to support more than 90 percent of the park’s annual operating budget, and to advocate for the transformation of the High Line at the Rail Yards, the third and final section of the historic structure, which runs between West 30th and West 34th Streets.

After the stroll, please join me for our usual Apres-"hike" at a local  establishment.

Legal Stuff: By clicking on "Yes" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

Please join us for today's Winter Solstice Musical Celebration. Join pianist/vocalist Lauren Hooker celebrating this year’s Winter Solstice with song, native American flute music and African Djembe call and response. A time for reflection as well as group participation.

LAUREN HOOKER – BIO

Lauren Hooker is known throughout the Metropolitan area as a jazz vocalist, pianist, songwriter and lyricist, as well as an acclaimed music and events producer via an arts coalition she founded, and a storyteller via her arts in education company: Musical Legends.  With numerous radio and television appearances and three cd’s to her credit, she performs regularly with her quartet and as a solo artist. As an educator, she currently teaches piano in her home studio and as a teaching artist via Arts Horizons. Much more than just a singer or a musician, she has lived the life of an artist, going from one important project to another and uplifting each area of her life with her creativity, wit and sensitivity. For more info visit:www.laurenhooker.com

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Chuck Debrovner presides 

Are children colorblind? Is nine years old too young to discuss race? How do students understand concepts about race and ethnicity? Last year Ethical Culture Fieldston School launched Conversations About Race for 3-5th grade students.  This program was created in order to provide opportunities to discuss race and racial identity in affinity group settings. This talk will review some of the research and thinking that prompted its creation.  

Mariama Richards serves as the Director of Progressive and Multicultural Education at Ethical Culture Fieldston School. At ECFS Mariama is charged with supporting professional development, monitoring the scope and sequence of curriculum, and supervising equity and justice initiatives pre-k through 12.  As a member of the senior administrative team, Mariama works to ensure that the mission of the school remains a central consideration throughout every aspect of the school community. 

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
COME JOIN US FOR A FAST PACED INTERMEDIATE BUSHWHACK HIKE AS WE EXPLORE 2 PEAKS IN THE NORTHERN REGION OF THE CATSKILLS INCLUDING VLY & BEARPEN MOUNTAINS. BOTH MOUNTAINS ARE SAID TO HAVE HERD PATHS. BEARPEN IS EASY TO FOLLOW AND VLY CAN BE MORE DIFFICULT. PLEASE NOTE THAT BUSHWHACK HIKES ARE NOT IDEAL FOR BEGINNERS! YOU CAN EXPECT THIS TRIP TO BE ABOUT 6.5 MILES. PLEASE WEAR BRIGHT COLORS SO THAT YOU ARE VISIBLE TO HUNTERS SHOULD WE ENCOUNTER ANY.

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING LINK AS IT INCLUDES USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING THE HIKE AND PARKING INSTRUCTIONS!

http://www.catskillmountaineer.com/BWF-vlybearpen.html


WE WILL MEET AT 1259 County Road 3, Fleischmanns, NY


DIRECTIONS TO TRAIL HEAD FROM NEW YORK STATE THRUWAY (Easist, not the shortest):

GPS Coordinates to DEC Parking Lot: N[masked] W[masked] - Elevation is approximately 2,275 feet Take New York State Thruway to Exit 19 (Kingston). Take a right out of the NYS Thruway toll booths onto Rt 28. Go approximately 31.7 miles west on Rt 28 Take a RIGHT into Fleischmanns near bottom of hill. Go approximately 1/4 mile. Take a RIGHT onto Lake Street (by Citgo gas station). Go appoximately 4 miles - Stay LEFT at Y on Rt 3. Go approximately 3 miles - Stay RIGHT at Johnson Hollow Road. The asphalt road will end in about 1 mile and turn into a dirt road. Stop here. Continue past one of the land owners personal signs that states that the public road is a private road. Park on the RIGHT side of the road - Do not park in the snowplow turnaround in the Winter. GPS: N[masked] W[masked] 

NOTES ABOUT THIS HIKE

This hike is located on the very western edge of Greene County. The hike is outside of the blue line of the Catskill Mountain Park. This is a quick way to the top of vly and bearpen mountain. There are quite a few view points, and the views from Bearpen mountain are spectacular. Vly Mountain does not have views. This hike is also one of the easier hikes in the Catskill Mountains. There are numerous trails to the summit of Bearpen Mountain. Bearpen Mountain used to be a downhill ski center. Vly Mountain is a bushwhack hike. There is a herd path to the summit. The herd path can be difficult to follow during certain times of the year. Other times it is easy to follow.

This is the shortest way to the top of vly and bearpen mountain. The road from Rt 3 from Fleischmanns is the favored route by those who want the shortest hike to the top.

There is NO registration box. This is a wild forest, so you can find snowmobiles running around in the Winter. But, we never see many, and the few we see break the trail for us. Bearpen Wild Forest does get more snow then the rest of the Catskill Mountains.

Vly Mountain can be climbed from three common routes. The route we will take is from Rt 3 from Fleischmanns. This route is the shortest and easist route to the top of Vly Mountain. It is about 1.78 miles to the top. Most people use this route. The difficult part of this route is the parking. You cannot park in the snowplow turnaround, but you can park on the shoulder of the road on the other side of the mountain.

The road up to the summit is a nice easy incline that runs pretty steady. It is about 1 mile long. When you get to the summit, there is a Hunter's Cabin. The road is wide enough for a truck, and can be used by the public. Once at the pass, you will find the herd path on the right side of the road. It is just past the DEC Wild Forest sign. The climb up to Vly Mountain is moderate or difficult in ability. Nothing terrible. It is easy to fall off the trail, so you do have to be careful certain times of the year. Other times of the year, the path is quite well defined and easy to follow. About 3/4 of the way up the mountain there is a limited view. Once on top there is no view. Once you are done, hike back down to Rt 3 to the pass by the Hunter's Cabin.

Now, walk past the front porch of the Hunter's Cabin. This trail will lead you to Bearpen Mountain. At the trail junction, take a LEFT. Climb uphill along the steeper trail. You will come to a switchback. About 250' past the switchback is a new (2010) snowmobile trail. It is marked with NYS DEC snowmobile trail marker. You can follow this trail for about a 1/2 mile. After a 1/2 mile, there is a faint herd trail on the right. You can take this herd trail for a short cut. Or, you can follow the snowmobile trail to the end. It will come to another snowmobile trail. You then will take a LEFT. You will come to the summit of Bearpen Mountain. Once you are done you can reverse your course back to your car.

There are numerous great views from the summit of vly and bearpen mountain. Take the time to find most of them. Most of the views are spectacular. This mountain is a loved by snowshoers and cross-crountry skiers for good hiking and great views. Some find it quite magical.


DISTANCE: Approximately 6.5 miles

HIKING PACE: up to 2 mph

ESTIMATED HIKE TIME: up to 4-5 hours

DIFFICULTY: Intermediate with bushwhacking

CURRENT WEATHER FORECAST: Cloudy with a high of 53 degrees


RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Headlamp with spare batteries - Lowe's has an Energizer 200 Lumen headlamp for only $19.97

• Shoes with good grip - preferably with ankle support

• A Medium Pack

• Related maps, a Compass or GPS, Enough Water for entire day, Snacks, First Aid, etc.

• Windbreaker, warm layers, hat, gloves, etc.

• Gaiters

• Hiking Poles




RELATED MAPS:

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference - Catskills Trails Map Set

"BUSHWHACKS" are hikes that leave maintained trails through pure wilderness.  Please make sure you are confident in your ability to hike and navigate through wild forest without trails in case your fearless leader should get hurt and you need to go for help (unlikely - lol).  A Map & Compass are REQUIRED. GPS is also recommended, but it is not a substitute for a map, compass and the skills to use them effectively.  Safety glasses or goggles might also be a good idea to keep branches from whipping you in the eye. 


Catskill Hiking maximum group size limitations.

• A group size limit of 12 people for day hiking off-trail or in wilderness areas is in place. Any group larger than 12 must split up (by no less than 1 mile) into smaller, self-sufficient groups that satisfy the size requirement. These groups shall not congregate into one large group at trail junctions, rest stops, lunch breaks, etc.

• In all other areas of the Catskills a group size limit of 20 is in place. Groups larger than 20 must split up (by no less than 1 mile) into smaller, self-sufficient groups that satisfy the size requirement. These groups shall not congregate into one large group at trail junctions, rest stops, lunch breaks, etc.


 NYC HIKING & OUTDOOR ADVENTURE GROUP LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The NYC Hiking & Outdoor Adventure Group does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.
