results.description:
We will be reading George, by Alex Gino

BE WHO YOU ARE.

When people look at George, they think they see a boy. But she knows she's not a boy. She knows she's a girl.

George thinks she'll have to keep this a secret forever. Then her teacher announces that their class play is going to be Charlotte's Web. George really, really, REALLY wants to play Charlotte. But the teacher says she can't even try out for the part . . . because she's a boy. With the help of her best friend, Kelly, George comes up with a plan. Not just so she can be Charlotte -- but so everyone can know who she is, once and for all.

NY Times Review:'
Prepare yourself, Alex Gino: You’ll be receiving lots of feedback when readers discover your timely, touching novel.
School librarians will run to you at conferences, thanking you for writing a story that speaks to students like George. Irate parents will leave one-star reviews on Amazon, claiming your book has an agenda. And there will be children — you know, the actual intended audience for “George” — who will send you an email, politely demanding a sequel.
You can’t blame them for asking. The memorable central character of “George” is unlike almost any protagonist out there — even if others in the story are stock characters of middle-grade books. (A harried single mom, a macho older brother, a sassy best girlfriend — archetypes, I hasten to add, I’ve relied on in my own novels.)
But “George” stands out for one contemporary twist: a fourth-grade production of “Charlotte’s Web” in which George dreams of playing Charlotte, the female spider, rather than Wilbur, the male pig. It’s not for political reasons; Charlotte is simply the role to which George most relates. With refreshingly little fanfare, Gino uses the “herself” pronoun to describe how George sees, well, herself — despite a birth certificate that says otherwise.
“George” may be the most right-now book imaginable. How do you talk to children about Caitlyn Jenner? Give them “George” (and watch “I Am Cait” together). Also, trust that when you tell a contemporary child that some people are born into a body they don’t identify with, most will blink, say, “O.K., cool,” and ask what’s for dinner.
Gino beautifully describes how George thinks about holding the ladder for her best friend, Kelly, after Kelly gets cast in the high-flying role George wants: She “would be Charlotte’s Charlotte, deeply hidden in the shadows.” Elsewhere, Gino uses escalating variations on an everyday word — “Oh,” then “Ohhh,” then “Ohhhhhhhhh” — to brilliantly depict the dawning way George’s older brother reacts to learning that his little bro is actually his kid sis. These moments are drawn with elegant restraint, even if other aspects of the book — like how George’s mom watches soap operas and George’s brother refers to “dirty magazines” — feel dated.
Using the theater as a backdrop, however, is both age-old and inspired. If outcasts escape into the theater in order to “be” other people, the opposite is also the case: Theater is the only place some kids can be themselves. The “understudy must go on” theme is deployed to lovely effect as George steps into the arachnid role she was born to play.
Gino’s choice of “Charlotte’s Web” resonates for another reason: Anyone who thinks children won’t believe that a boy knows he’s really a girl need only pick up “Charlotte” to be reminded that a barnful of talking animals never confused anyone.
After reading “George,” I pulled out my own dog-eared edition of E.B. White’s beloved novel and read this line: “Wilbur felt queer to be outside his fence, with nothing between him and the big world.” It brought to mind the ending of “George”: Kelly lets Melissa (George’s name for herself) ransack her wardrobe to get dolled up for a girls’ day on the town. But unlike Wilbur, Melissa is thrilled to venture outside her fence, where she feels like her truest self.

results.description:
Is lying ethical? We are surrounded by falsehoods, exaggerations, denial, and sarcasm; that affect our judgment and shape our actions for better and worse. We must first learn what is a lie, how are they used and viewed in society, and why do we lie. Together we will explore lying and try to find the truest, most honest answer.

Emily Newman is the Communications Coordinator of the American Ethical Union, Secretary of the National Ethical Service at the United Nations, and a member of the Future of Ethical Societies (FES). She grew up in Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture, and is a member there and at the New York Society for Ethical Culture.

results.description:
Join the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture (RYSEC),Congregation Tehillah and Jews for Racial and Economic Justice (JFREJ) for a Community Teach-In about the Right to Know Act, a legislative package currently being considered by the New York City Council. The Right to Know Act aims to increase police accountability, respect and transparency and protect the rights of all New Yorkers.

Come together with community members to ​engage in a discussion about what true safety for all New Yorkers could look like. Learn about how the Right to Know Act is a powerful tool for working to end discriminatory and abusive policing, and how you can take action to help pass it into New York City law. Light snacks will be served.

Parking is available for this event in the lot at the Fieldston/Ethical Culture School across Manhattan College Parkway.

Our regular Ethics for Children program will be held 11 am to noon in the downstairs office.  Parents, you are welcome to come upstairs for an informal conversation with RYSEC Leader Jone Lewis from 11 to 11:30, and you’re welcome to stay for the main event 11:30 – 1:30 pm.  We’ll update this announcement later with news about how we’ll handle child care during the program.

For more information: 

http://www.rysec.org/event/teach-in-police-accountability 


https://www.eventbrite.com/e/riverdale-community-teach-in-the-right-to-know-act-tickets-19586562937
results.how_to_find_us: Directions on website or call the office during the week.
results.name: Teach-In on Police Accountability

Join us for an intergenerational celebration as we “return to the light” – creating our own musical instruments and making much merriment as we join other musicians in a musical tribute to winter…..and the wonderful exchange of darkness and light.

Materials will be provided but please feel free to bring your instruments….homemade or otherwise. There will be meditation, music, singing…..maybe even dancing – and we’ll be making it up as we go along….. there will even be STARLIGHT!!

Join us for a wonderful sharing of community – Potluck lunch to follow!!

results.description:
OK boys and girls , 

It's that time of year again  our annual toy drive . I know this time year money can be tight  , but please try to think of all the  kids that will be waiting for santa this year  with little hope of getting a present . we re all so fortunate to have  nice things  .So  lets try to give   some children  a happy christmas and that warm feeling that santa  loves them  . Remember when you were a young one ..the magic of christmas seemed to be the best feeling in the world . Well   we try every year to give to these children a merry christmas  .. here is how we hope you will come out and help .. this event is a very short one on time  ....But a Big ONE on LOVE . We will meet up on sunday morning to share  a cup of coffee at starbucks in  bronxville    you can either bring an unwrapped toy  or bring money to buy a toy  ! after we are done with our coffee we will walk around the corner to the TOYS FOR TOTS DROP BOX LOCATION (VALUE DRUGS  BRONXVILLE)   Once we get there we will all put our toys in the box   & if we have cash donations to buy toys we will shop for them in this store and add to box . This  has been a great event in the past and we always get nice pictures with the store mangers to add to the festive fun . so please  these kids need  , hats  mittens, scarfs,  toys   , small makeup kits  , or hair accessories  kits   kids are from infant to late teens .  If you can  help brighten a childs  christmas I hope you will join me

results.description:
The foundational argument of liberation theology is that God’s allegiance is to the oppressed and disinherited of every community. The very notion of God—whether in biblical theology or in radical social politics—is conceived as a politically mindful and active being who lends support and active resistance against all dehumanizing forces. But what material proof do the oppressed have of such a politically conscious force? Perhaps traditional notions of God as “good,” as “moral,” as “loving” are actually only human attributes projected onto God with no evidence that these qualities can be traced to a divine activity actually present in the world. These sessions will present some of the foundational work in black liberation theology of Professor James Cone in the context of the critique of the philosopher William R. Jones. In what sense is it possible to speak meaningfully of God as moral or good or liberating?

Jamall Andrew Calloway is a doctoral candidate in theology at Union Theological Seminary with a principal focus on black liberation theology. A native of Oakland, California, Jamall graduated summa cum laude with a BA from Tougaloo College in Jackson, Mississippi, where he wrote a thesis on W.E.B. DuBois. In 2013 he earned a Master of Divinity degree from the Yale Divinity School and has served for the past three summers as minister of the Congregational Church in Mount Washington, Massachusetts.


FYI, speaker is very good and we had a very interesting Q&A after the first talk. Highly recommend!
results.how_to_find_us: I will be in standing in back of room....I look a lot like my photo!
results.name: God of the Oppressed: Black Liberation Theology

results.description:
Folks, 
Inviting volunteers to join me at the St Xaviers Church Welcome Kithcen on Sunday to serve over 1000 meals to the poor and homeless provided by St Xaviers Pantry.

This is based on the values that we would treat everyone equal,trustworthy, with dignity without any discrimination. We also want to be socially inclusive, including everyone with their preferences, culture and celebrate diversity. We will serve vegetarian dishes. The Soup Kitchen is dependent on volunteers to help work towards sustaining these values our community. If you are interested in being a volunteer, rsvp through this page. You don't have to be particularly skillful, we believe that if you have the passion, that's all that's needed :)


Soup Kitchen provides the aprons, gloves, hairnets. (one can wear their own baseball hat). Long hair need to be tied back unless it all fit in the hair net. We work with you, show you what to do. Please wear something comfortable.

Type of help could vary from coordinating the line, serving meals, Removing empty plates from the table or general helping out. 

Location -

 Church of St. Francis Xavier (Basement Hall)

46 W. 16th Street (Between 6th and 5th Avenue), New York, NY

Time -

11:30 - 3:30 ( You are required to stay till the end)

I will put my number on the meetup wall once we get close to the date. Members might get different responsibilities but will try to work as a group.
results.name: Vounteer At St Xavier's Church Welcome Kitchen - Feed the Homeless, Good Karma!

results.description:
Here is the Schedule and guidelines of where we will be, feel free to come and go as you please or jump in at any time! You will find us at each spot, just look for the lime green umbrella at each place. 


11:30 Grand Central, meet at information booth, then head to 42nd street


12:30 – 1:30 Lunch in Bryant Park.  Bring bagged brown lunch or there are restaurants and food vendors if you want to buy lunch. We will be sitting on aluminum benches enjoying our lunch

1:30 to 3:00: Inside Bryant Park is Winter Village and vendor shopping. Walk around and enjoy the shopping and scenery.  

3:30-4:30 Rockefeller Center, and St Patrick’s Cathedral.  49th and 5th. Gets dark at 4pm so come and see the tree, go ice skating and just hang out and enjoy.

4:30 wherever you are head to McFadden’s for dinner at 5:00

5:00 McFadden’s Restaurant, 42nd and 2nd

Going home:

·  7:22 pm gets into Southeast at 8:59 pm

·  7:51 pm gets into Southeast at 9:28 pm

The following is a list of things to do on 42nd street heading toward Hudson River

·  New York City Public Library, corner of 5th and 42nd.

·  Bryant Park, Winter Village

·  Time Square

·  Madame Tussaudos

·  Port Authority

·  Off Broadway Theaters

·  Pier 83, The Intrepid

There was such an overwhelming amount of people that wanted to visit NYC around the holiday's so have decided to plan another trip! We will be meeting at Grand Central at 11:30 am. Come by car, train or plane to Grand Central. Anyone wishing to leave from the Southeast train, we are taking the 9:40 am train which will bring us into Grand Central at 11:09. If not you can meet at the information booth so look for the meetup balloons at 11:30. We will walk around, shop, go to Rockefeller Center to see the Tree (we will have a snack while at Rockefeller Center so bring a bag lunch to enjoy and hold us over till dinner), Times Square (Maybe the naked cowboy might still be there, if he is he will be very, very cold!), Central Park, Museums or whatever you want to do. We may split up (or not) and then meet at a local diner for dinner.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the information booth, look for our lime green umbrella!
results.name: NYC  for the Holiday's

results.description:
Ho ho ho and Happy Holidays! It's time once again for our Photos with Santa and Secret Santa Gift Exchange!

Our favorite "Man in Red", Santa, will be offering the *best seat in the house*, for all good NNJPE Pugs (and some not-so-good ones that just think they are)! Why bother dreaming about sugar plums and treats, when you can bark at Santa directly?!?

The *Pug Shot* Photos with Santa to be taken at this event will be offered at a cost of $5.00 for each 4x6 inch photo or 2 for $8.00; revenue generated will be distributed as donations to Coming Home Rescue, Rockaway, NJ, while "Angel Tree" donations will be given to RBARI (Ramapo Bergen Animal Rescue), and Hi Tor Animal Shelter, Rockland County, NY. (Payment is to be made directly to Best Friends the day of the event.) BTW; just to let everyone know...Best Friends is a mere few seconds North of the Montvale, NJ border in the town of Chestnut Ridge, NY; it's closer than it sounds...:)

Along with the photo session, we will be hosting our fun-filled Secret Santa event! Anyone wishing to participate in this event is asked to bring a new, wrapped doggie-related item (or items) valued at approximately $15.00. The item(s) should be something of which can be utilized either by a dog or a dog/Pug lover, so the possibilities are endless! The gifts will then be tagged with numbered tickets, and will then be distributed via a drawing in which each participating member will "win" the gift with the matching number on his/her ticket stub. If you have two Pugs (or more!), bring two gifts (or more!) and you can draw for that many gifts!

Of course, your participation in either of these sessions is purely optional; you and your Pug can join us simply for the indoor, off-leash playtime; the choice is yours. Finally; any food or beverage contributions are appreciated, as this will be a fee-free event and our last meetup of the year. Let's celebrate the splendor of the season and the last few days of 2015 with one gala Pug Party; we hope to see you there!

***UPDATE! No proof of vaccination will be necessary for our group, which will, in turn, allow any Pug who has their basic Rabies shot to attend. (We will be the only group utilizing the playroom at our scheduled time, so Best Friends is forgoing their boarding vaccination policy.) WOO HOO! The one change to our utilizing the playroom, however, is that there will be a nominal $25.00 per hour charge for use of the room (which is very reasonable!). With this in mind, I am asking all attendees to chip in for the room expenses, which should be no more than $2.00-$2.50 per person (based upon the number of attendees).  This amount can be paid the day of the event. Note that I have changed the start time of the event to 11:30 AM, as the Photos with Santa session will follow AFTER our playroom time. (This time slot might be subjected to some "minor tweaking" as we get closer to the day of the event...thanks in advance for your understanding and patience!).

Happy Holidays to Everyone and Everypug!

Ellen, along with our friends at Best Friends!
results.name: 10th Annual NNJPE Photos with Santa and Secret Santa Gift Exchange!

results.description:
http://www.cooperhewitt.org/events/current-exhibitions/provocations-the-architecture-and-design-of-heatherwick-studio/


Ready for a nice day out for the whole family? Head to Central Park, then pop out on <a>91st street</a> to visit the Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum (http://www.cooperhewitt.org). Remember to get tickets online and save yourself $2 a ticket. 

There's a really fun exhibition on the 3rd floor: “PROVOCATIONS: THE ARCHITECTURE AND DESIGN OF HEATHERWICK STUDIO”. You may remember the studio from projects such as the Cauldron for the London 2012 Olympics or the Rolling Bridge near Paddington Station in the same lovely metropolis. Each model fascinates with elegance, simplicity and fitting for purpose - basically, a whole new approach to architecture and design! 

The experience is brought into the 21st century with newly installed touch screen tables and pens that allow you to create your own designs or investigate existing objects, and save them for future review. No age restriction on doodling and visualizing 3D creations. Don't forget to visit the museum shop. You may be surprised by finding ordinary objects at extraordinary prices there.

Address:

2 East 91st Street 

(between 5th and Madison Avenues)


New York, New York 10128

Directions:

http://www.cooperhewitt.org/visit/getting-here/
results.name: PROVOCATIONS: THE ARCHITECTURE AND DESIGN OF HEATHERWICK STUDIO

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 9:45AM (2 hours before the start time)


• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.


Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club or activities.

results.description:
Acoustic Guitar Lessons II for Beginners - DECEMBER SESSIONS
Four 90-Minute Sessions Held on 4 consecutive Saturdays in December. [Dec 5, 12, 19, and 26]


The December Series continues where we have left off at the end of November and is open only to the participants who completed the 4-week Series in November .  


WHAT YOU WILL LEARN:
In this workshop you will learn to READ NOTES, CHORDS and PLAY SONGS you know and love.  And what you learn can be applied to Rock, Blues, Folk, Country, Jazz, Classical or any other type of music the student is interested in playing.

Monthly Four-Week Cycles
In this workshop, a specific set of concepts will be covered over a period of 4-week.  Each monthly, 4-week period will be closed to people who did not attend the 1st session of the month.  This allow the group to continue to progress through the lesson material and avoid the need to review all that came before each time a new person joins the group. There will be three to four monthly, 4-week cycles before the first cycle is repeated


WHAT TO BRING:
• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Also bring a three-ring binder and a pencil

COST:  The cost of this session is $12.00, which must be paid when you RSVP.
results.name: Acoustic Guitar II for Beginners--December­

Two things to know:
1.If people are late, we will wait until 12:15 and then start the tour. To catch up, call or text me at 718.340.8610.

Many restaurants don't let incomplete parties sit, which means an entire group would have to wait for one or two people coming late. results.description:
ISLAM AND ATHEISM / MUHAMMAD SYED / EX-MUSLIMS OF NORTH AMERICA / NYC ATHEISTS BRUNCH/SPEAKER: DECEMBER 13, 2015 (SUNDAY) 12 NOON 

--------------------------------------------------------------

SUBJECT: ISLAM AND ATHEISM


SPEAKER: MUHAMMAD SYED / FOUNDER: EX-MUSLIMS OF NORTH AMERICA 


Like much of the Western world, a tide of disbelief is rising in most Muslim countries and communities as well. The emergence of ISIS has added more fuel to those questioning their religion. Muhammad Syed talks about the need to support secularists, atheists and free thinkers. He will also be discussing common misconceptions within Muslim communities about Islamic history and scripture.

Muhammad Syed is a human rights activist, writer, speaker and community organizer. He is the founder and President of Ex-Muslims of North America (EXMNA), the first Ex-Muslim advocacy and community building organization on the continent.

Muhammad has been a human rights activist for the past decade, with a focus on efforts to normalize religious dissent and promote acceptance of secularism in Muslim communities.  

Muhammad has appeared on BBC, NPR, SiriusXM Insight and his work with EXMNA has been covered by the New York Times, National Post and Al-Jazeera among others.

He can be reached via email: [masked] and Twitter @MoTheAtheist. 

 You can read more about EXMNA at www.exmna.org.

------------------------------------


LOCATION: The Press Box Restaurant (2nd Floor) 932 Second Avenue Street (bet. 49th & 50th Sts.).

COST: BRUNCH, $20, includes selection of buffet entrees, salad, one soft drink, coffee, tax and tip.

===================================
results.how_to_find_us: 2ND FLOOR
results.name: ISLAM AND ATHEISM  / MUHAMMAD SYED / NYCA BRUNCH & SPEAKER: 12/13 (SUN)- 12 NOON

results.description:
Are you interested in reducing your stress, pampering yourself or developing a more harmonious connection with your body-mind-spirit? If yes, then join us for a mini Well-Being Session @ The Quest Bookshop Psychic Fair on Sunday December 13th, 2015 from 12:00 pm to 5:00 pm. 

Ursula Biala and Carol Ann Knight will be conducting the well-being sessions which may be comprised of the following modalities: energetic/vibrational healing, sound healing, relaxation techniques, prayer, meditation, spiritual mentoring, hypnosis, Neuro-linguistic Programming (NLP), Bio-Acoustics Biology, a friendly listening ear, etc.

A well-being session is offered as a complimentary service to anyone who purchases a reading at the psychic fair. They can also be obtained via donation. The well-being sessions will be offered on a first-come first-served basis.

Ursula Biala have been passionately pursuing since 2009 ascension, self mastery, and esoteric studies programs, and have made it her life long purpose. While pursuing her esoteric studies along with her full time work, she has learned  to embrace spirituality as an integral part of her life, creating a powerful and transformative experience. She brings this versatile awareness to her spiritual mentoring sessions. Ursula participated for four years as an active minister, church services manager, and served as a Treasurer on the Board of the Spiritualist Church of NYC.  She is also a certified Reiki Master, Intuitive Consultant, and a Seance Conductor. Ursula is a member of the Theosophical Society in America, Spiritual Bliss NYC, and Gaiaville LLC, a nonprofit organization dedicated to creating a sustainable spiritual living. Ursula has a degree in Economics and has spent her career working in Information Technology/Finance.

Carol Ann Knight is the President and Founder of Surrender To Change, a boutique educational and consulting firm dedicated to the evolution of consciousness and performance mastery. She assists individuals, groups and organizations with Transformational Performance - shifting fundamentally who they perceived themselves to be in relation to the situation that contains them so that they can take consistent action to achieve their desired outcomes and goals. A large component of Carol Ann's work is centered around self-awareness and the management of the cognitive-emotional state for this lies at the foundation of strategic decision-making, behavioral flexibility, effective communication and overall performance mastery.

Carol Ann employs a variety of tools in her consulting practice some of which include the MythoSelf Process, Neuro-linguistic Programming (NLP), hypnosis and various esoteric healing modalities. She is a strong proponent of utilizing sound to help support the optimal performance of the body, and to invoke and transform consciousness. Carol Ann has a degree in Mathematics from Cornell University, and has spent several years working in the healthcare consulting field. 

Adress: 242 E 53rd St, New York, NY 10022. Time: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

For more details about the psychic fair and tickets, please visit  www.QuestBookshop.com or call (212) 758-5521.
results.name: Well-Being Sessions @ The Quest Bookshop Psychic Fair

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

Featuring:

results.description:
Looking for a way to do good for your community and have fun at the same time? Come to the Box Party!

At the Ethical Society winter festival we are once again going to be filling gift boxes for men and women living in Lifting Up Westchester shelters. This meet up is to prepare for that event by wrapping the gift boxes and sorting and preparing donations -- and to enjoy festive yet secular winter holiday music and root beer floats while we work.

Requested donations include new hats, gloves, scarves, socks, and underwear (including long underwear and undershirts), along with travel size toiletries, toothbrushes, toothpaste, razors, shaving cream, and deodorant. Small gift items like notecards, decks of cards or other small games, puzzle books, paperbacks (gently used OK) will also go into the boxes. We do make a small number of gift boxes for women, and some for teens, but THE PRIMARY NEED IS FOR MEN'S ITEMS.

Also please bring empty shoe boxes, and wrapping paper, scissors and tape to share for the day. Hint: mark scissors and tape with your name -- try using an address label -- so you can go home with what you bring.
results.name: Wrap boxes and sort donations for the Box Party

results.description:
FUTSAL ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time is 12pm and will run until 2:30pm. 


Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING


We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 


Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                       ~~~~@🔸☢🎱⚽️⚖⚽️🎱☢🔸@~~~~

                                    🔹🔶🔷🔵📛🔵🔷🔶🔹

FUTSAL DOMINGOS POR LA TARDE

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Comenzamos a las 12pm y jugamos hasta las 2:30pm


Se juega sobre piso de gimnasio asi que usen zapatos de "indoor"

No hay porteros, asi que NO SE PUEDE PORTEREAR


Se jugaran partidos de 10 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Barridas estan Absolutamente Prohibidas

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

Eso es todo. Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.

results.description:
What are 'Reindeer Games' exactly?  I have no idea.  But we'll play lots of regular games!  If anyone's looking for Christmas present ideas, you might get some good ones here.  Plus have a few drinks with good people. 

Note on the day:  It'll be on a Sunday this time because December Saturdays are usually busy for people. 

Suggested Price of Admission

For $3, the Impact Network can educate a student in Zambia for a month.  With that in mind, I'm going to suggest everyone who comes chip in $3.  What do you get for your money?  Me, my sparkling smile and a pile of games to play with for hours.  And with any luck, they'll be spinning vinyl records.  So come, have a beer, meet good people, listen to some funky music and play great games for a good good cause.  I challenge you to find a better deal for three bucks! 

           Four people build a miniature city in Medina

What are we going to play?  

I will have at least one new one on tap: "The Hare and Tortise."  Truth is, it's a kids game.  But it is a really fun, easy racing game.  Each animal in the race (more than just the two from the title) has a special way of moving.  You get secretly assigned one and play cards to move that animal.  First one across the finish line wins!  

Otherwise it'll be the usual fare of games like Medina,  Nuns on the Run, Avalon, Steam Park, Coup...  We'll play relatively simple modern board games that have a quick rules explanation and play in less than an hour.  

What, no Sorry or Pictionary? 

Board and card games have changed, grown and evolved so much over the past decade or two that they have become wonderful art forms in their own right.  They tell stories and provide new situations for engaging each other in ways that party games or old classics can't.  These modern games wouldn't exist if games like Clue and Taboo hadn't paved the way.  But give the next-gen games a shot and you'll see why I'm so much more excited about new games! 

If you're really curious about what I might bring, probe the nerdy depths of my collection and visit my Board Game Geek page.  The bar does have a nice copy of Catan on hand as well.

           Build your own amusement park in Steam Park

I'm barely getting out of bed when this is starting! 

I know that noon on a Sunday is a bit early for people--I get it, believe me--but as long as you show up by 4 (or even 5) you should be able to get some gaming in. 

Skylark is a great bar in Park Slope in its own right.  But they are so board game friendly I just had to move our little meetup there.  They have some good bar food but are also open to bringing food as long as we clean up.

Negotiate for the best stock price with up to 11 people in Panic on Wall Street

My phone number is listed near the top of this posting if you have any questions day-of.  And with that we'll see you there!  Or else...

           Point guns at each other in Ca$h 'n Gun$
results.how_to_find_us: At the tables in the back.  516 314-0228
results.name: Gameday--Reindeer Games

results.description:
Updated October 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

FALL (Sep - Nov)

As the city cools down we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on weekdays and Morningside Park for weekends.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th & Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th & Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End) 
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

Damien 
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).
results.why: It's fun and you like it...

I'll be setting up a tutorial for people who'd be interested in learning how to play Dice Masters. There will be some basic decks provided for people to try out and play. So no purchase is necessary. Though there will be starters and such available if you do want to get your own set. It's a deck building game similar to Dominion, Legendary or Qwarriors that employs the use of character dice. With a Marvel and DC theme. It's a quick and fun game.

There will also be a Netrunner gathering around the same time if that's a game you enjoy or want to try out as well.

results.description:
Sunday afternoon.

"Angle the deflector shield while I make the calculations for the jump to light speed" to a galaxy far, far away as we battle the dark side and use the force to explore the movie that started it all...

STAR WARS  (a new hope)

Whether you're a casual movie fan or seasoned cinephile, this workshop is a fun opportunity to learn more about what goes into the craft of moviemaking.

We'll take a look under the cinematic hood and see how the motion picture engine runs by discussing how the following crafts are woven together to create the power of movies: Screenwriting - Blueprint for a Movie
Acting - Breathing Life into Characters
Production Design - Sets, Costumes, Props
Camera & Lighting - Directing Visual Stories
Editing - Putting the Puzzle Together

Everyone should watch the preselected movie in advance. During the workshop, the group watches various selected scenes from the chosen flick and we dissect and discuss each scene.

The Movie Appreciation Workshop is held in the screening room of the always fun Videology Bar and Cinema in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Drinking and eating during the workshop are encouraged.

Several trivia questions about the selected movie are asked throughout each workshop. The winner gets a FREE drink ticket!

Explore movies you love, learn terminology and gain insight into the creative filmmaking process. Join other cinema enthusiasts for an entertaining and enlightening lecture/ conversation about the magic that is the movies!

For those interested, check out the Star Wars script here: http://www.imsdb.com/scripts/Star-Wars-A-New-Hope.html
results.name: Movie Appreciation Workshop:  The Craft Behind Movie Magic in STAR WARS

results.description:
There are SO many unexpectedly beautiful, intriguing places in the east 30s and 40s  in Manhattan: stunning architectural details; unusual displays, exotic stores, and art galleries, including a wonderful exhibition of tranquil paintings at Scandinavia House (pay what you wish); an elegant indoor crafts fair; a "Christmas village" at Bryant Park; holiday train show at Grand Central; and "A Writer's Christmas (Dickens and more) plus "100 years of the Picture Collection" at the 42nd St. library. We'll start by taking a short ride to Midtown on a vintage subway train from the 1930s, with wicker seats, overhead fans, real straps for straphangers, and vintage ads, conductors, and possibly jazz bands


PLEASE READ THE DETAILS BELOW, SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED:

DISTANCE: About 3 miles

PACE: MODERATE NOT SLOW. IF YOU WANT TO WALK SLOWLY, THIS IS NOT THE RIGHT EVENT FOR YOU. 

LUNCH: Bring your own or buy it at the new Urbanspace Vanderbilt food court next to Grand Central, featuring a wide range of creative, relatively inexpensive vendors: http://urbanspacevanderbilt.com/ (Scroll down a bit.) We'll probably start eating around 2:30 PM. 

COST: Subway fare; pay what you wish at Scandinavia House; whatever you pay for lunch; and $2 for me, in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee.

ENDING TIME: Around 5:30 PM, but you can leave earlier, of course.

TRANSPORTATION: F train to 2nd Ave. For more details, consult mta.tripplanner.org, Google Transit (maps.google.com/landing/transit/index.html) and/or a subway map, since those sites do not always list the ideal routes. Also check mta.info/weekender for weekend service changes.

WAITING LIST: Sign up and be patient, no matter how many are waiting. Long wait lists have totally disappeared because of cancellations, especially at the last minute. As a courtesy to others waiting for a spot, please do not sign up unless you intend to go, rather than just as a placeholder in case nothing better turns up.
results.how_to_find_us: IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHICH IS THE FRONT END OR THE UPTOWN PLATFORM, ASK SOMEONE! I'll be wearing a red cap
results.name: Vintage subway ride plus beauty in Midtown

results.description:
Give yourself a gift and join 50 other Meetup members in seeing the hottest new Broadway show of the holiday season! The reviews have been great and shows have been selling out! We have less than 5 tickets left for 12/13 - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/schoolofrock/

We will meet for the pre-mingle (1pm) at a local bar/pub near the theater, where we will hand out the show tickets. 

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to purchase ticket, closer to event date.  It will start at 1pm and we'll leave at 2:30 so we have enough time to settle into our seats for the 3pm show. The group will be sitting together in the rear Mezz.

Food and drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $97.50

Must Prepay to attend. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. 

Get your tickets ASAP at this link - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/schoolofrock/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2faNeO2S5M

About the Show -

The musical follows Dewey Finn, a failed, wannabe rock star who decides to earn a few extra bucks by posing as a substitute teacher at a prestigious prep school. Completely disinterested in academic work, Dewey decides to create his own curriculum, turning his class into a guitar-shredding, bass-slapping, mind-blowing rock band. 

The stage musical is produced by Andrew Lloyd Webber, who has composed 14 new songs to create a score, which also features all the original songs from the movie. SCHOOL OF ROCK, with its sensational live kids’ rock band, is a loving testimony to the transforming power of music. No one can stop the School of Rock!

Get Tickets Here - 

http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/schoolofrock/
results.name: Broadway's New Hit Musical 'School Of Rock' w/ Pre-Mingle (Prepay Only)

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Most of you who have met me know that I am an artist, and I'd like to invite you all to stop by and see my latest series, "Strata":

The Strata series came about as the result of an idea to work with pen & ink on layered tracing paper. By superimposing layer upon layer of the tracing paper, it is possible to achieve a measure of dimensionality.

The name strata—the plural of stratum—refers to the layers of tracing paper, but also to the layers of meaning behind the series itself, and each of the individual pieces of the series. For strata can also mean road.

In this second sense then, each piece is a metaphor for a road: a road taken, or a possible road to take. Through the use of just pen & ink and the layering of the tracing paper, not only dimensionality is achieved, but also directionality, as well as a rich reservoir of meaning, which will be different for each viewer depending on their interpretation of the lines.
results.name: Open House/Open Studio

results.description:
Be apart of the littleBits + Star Wars Global Makeathon! A challenge from littleBits to the whole world! Join us at MacInspires to create, learn and compete!

From littleBits:
We challenge you and your community to invent a new gadget for your favorite Star Wars character, then film a video recreating your favorite scene, starring them and their new creation. There will be a number of categories to participate in-- more to come when we launch on November 19.

The grand prize winner will receive a trip to the new Star Wars theme park at Disney World (opening next year) in Orlando, FL. The finalists will receive littleBits gift cards, movie tickets and custom swagggg.

So! We'll have tons of littleBits, lots of arts and crafts, a green screen, iMovie on a bunch of computers, video cameras for us to use and more! Let's do this!
results.name: Larchmont Makers & littleBits Meetup! Star Wars Edition!

results.description:
Let's meet up at Prospect Park at 1pm sharp, sunset is at 4:30pm. I have a few locations that we will walk to as a group. I ask everyone to be on time as we have models with us and a bunch of photographers. The closest Subway which is about a 15 minute walk to location is the 15th St - Prospect Park F and G trains. But depends on where you are coming from. 


We will meet at the entrance to the park from 16th Street and Prospect Park Southwest Street. If you type in or copy and paste these coordinates to google maps you will see where we are: <a>[masked], [masked]</a>

Please bring props, costumes or just yourself. We will have models with a couple choices of clothes. I'm more than happy to help anyone who is new to photography or shooting conceptual work and share with you the way I work from concept to shooting. Just have a knowledge of how your camera works and a passion to create and we will make some awesome work. Donations are very much appreciated since I have to pay all the dues for this group. I think it's fair to ask for $5 per event but if you can't afford it please join us anyway!


We will have models and I'll post pictures here as I confirm them. If you or anyone you know would like to model please have them contact me at [masked]
results.name: Conceptual Photography Meetup at Prospect Park

results.description:
Join us for a full Sunday of social Wikipedia editing with the AfroCROWD initiative at Brooklyn Public Library (drop-in any time!), during which we will create, update, and improve Wikipedia articles on Black films and filmmakers.  


Help write your digital world history!


Afro Free Culture Crowdsourcing Wikimedia (AfroCROWD) is a new initiative which seeks to increase the number of people of African Descent actively editing Wikipedia. Become a part of the Wikimedia and free knowledge, culture and software movements and help close the multicultural and gender gaps in Wikipedia. Visit us at www.afrocrowd.org to find out more. 


Beginners welcome. 


All languages welcome including English, Spanish, Haitian Creole, French, Yoruba and others. Wikipedia comes in 285 languages and you are welcome to edit it in any of them or translate from one language to another.

Light Refreshments will be available.


We have about 30 laptops available. So we don't run out, bring your own if you can or are driving. This is not a requirement. 

Page on Wikipedia:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Meetup/NYC/AfroCrowd/12-2015-Film-BPL
results.how_to_find_us: Information Commons Room
results.name: Black Film Editathon: AfroCROWD @ Brooklyn Public Library

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where fellow Python developers and learners can come and asks questions and/or code with some company! This event is free. 


Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

results.description:
It's show time!

Invite friends and family for this event, it will be a blast!

Tickets for this show are $5 before the day of and $10 at the door.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+, no kids will be allowed in the venue even if the parents are with them, I'm sorry.

Show starts at 2pm, that's when your friends and family should arrive. If they are traveling with you please ask them to wait at the bar upstairs the or take a little walk in the neighborhood and come back by 2pm when the show starts, thank you!

If you are playing you must be there by 1pm to set up and sound check.

There is a bar at the venue and plenty of restaurants and cool spots for food before or after the show.

Wear funky clothes! Yes, bell bottoms and star shaped sun glasses are a must!

There is a $30 show fee to each member of the ensemble.

Let's groove it!
results.name: Funk and Christmas Show Day at Arlene's Grocery!

results.description:
Joaquin must have a little bit of Sam Champion in him because he just gave me the weather report for this weekend and it's supposed to be nice! With that in mind, he recommended we go to a beer garden this weekend, so I contacted our friends at the Well in Bushwick and they will have the garden open!

So, hop on the L train to the Montrose stop and come out to the Well. They have awesome beers and it should be a nice day. If by chance it's cool, they have a pretty big space inside, too.

See you there!

Cheers,
Bill
results.name: Let's drink beer at a beer garden!

group.name: New York City Gay Craft Beer Lovers

results.description:
Due in part to low turnout I am providing the option to play one of the Pathfinder Adventure Card Games in lieu of a tabletop role-playing...until we have 5 (including me) "YES" RSVPs

As far as the table top RPG campaign:

1) Player characters start off at 5th level (same stat buying system as I have already established).

2) Races: Core Rulebook Races ONLY!

3) Hit Points: Level 1 max and half+1 thereafter

4) Party must have some sort of balanced synergy (ie: DPS, Tank, Healer, Nuke..etc.

5) #4 being said, please have a few varying character concepts (different party roles) and on this, Sunday 9/6, we'll spend the first  hour or two together; hashing out the character concepts and building a "balanced" party. In addition to actually playing.

6) Remember, you're playing a "living and breathing character" and not just a bunch of stats. 

7) Limited Creation Feats (only Scroll and Brewing Potions)

Very Basic Backstory:

- Like in most fantasy Anime the plethora of "real world" human races are all represented on the continent.

- Your character is a member of a "Family" (no actual relationships needed) of "Monster" hunters (in this case Monster can mean Undead, Demon, Magic Beast...etc).

- The country you're in is undergoing severe social changes and there are citizens whom have been mysteriously missing and the local gov't doesn't seem to be doing much about it. 

- Arcane magic is viewed superstitiously and magic items are a bit rarer than typical western fantasy campaigns.

Permissible Pathfinder Source Material:
1) Core Rulebook
2) Advance Class Guide
3) Advanced Race Guide (to be a non-core race first you need to roll a natural 20 prior to character creation)
4) Advanced Player's Guide
5) Occult Adventures
6) Pathfinder Unchained
7) Ultimate Combat
8) Ultimate Magic
9) The Inner Sea World Guide
10) Ultimate Campaign

The following may or may not have material for character creation but I'm listing all Pathfinder soft-bounds I own:

1) Advanced Class Origins
2) Alchemy Manual
3) Animal Archive
4) Blood of Angels (see # 3 Advanced Race Guide)
5) Blood of the Night (ditto)
6) Princes of Darkness
7) Lords of Chaos
8) Horsemen of the Apocalypse
9) Champions of Purity
10) Chronicle of the Righteous
11) Cities of Golarion
12) Classic Treasure Revisted
13) Demon Hunter's Handbook
14) Dungeon's of Golarion
15) Faiths & Philosphies
16) Halflings of Golarion
17) Humans of Golarion
18) Inner Sea Combat
19) Inner Sea Primer
20) Knights of the Inner Sea
21) Melee Tactics Toolbook
22) Occult Mysteries
23) Paths of Prestige
24) Ranged Tactics Toolbox
25) Technology Guide
26) Tombs of Golarion
27) Towns of the Inner Sea
28) Undead Revisted
29) Undead Slayer's Handbook
30) Undead Unleashed
31) Dragon Empire Gazeteer
32) Dragon Empires Primer

COMMON COURTESY:

a) Please be on time...it's not fair to those that show up on time and having them wait. Consistent tardiness shall result in removal. 

b) During the actual adventure please do not use it as Pathfinder library time and read through source material that doesn't directly pertain to the adventure at hand.

c) If you do in fact RSVP, please be 100% certain that you are available to play this day and time.  Space is limited and so is the RSVP list.  Don't simply take and hold a place if you're truly not certain. Repeat offenders shall be removed and banished to the Bog of Eternal Stench!!!
results.name: Pathfinder Something

group.name: Pathfinder RPG Group of Northern New Jersey (adults 25yrs+)

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

Update as of[masked]:

"Model Spotlight: Implied Shoot w/Louise Ann - Dec. 13"

We're back with our popular Model Spotlight shoots and this month we have a new model to the group, Louise Ann. Louise Ann is of Italian and Greek decent and has been published in various glamour and urban magazines, as well as calendars. We're happy to have her join our group and look forward to having her become a regular.

About Model Spotlight shoots:

With this type of shoot there will be one model. (Limited smaller group than our bigger shoots) It could be a traveling model, one of our member favorites or a model with a unique concept. These shoots are designed to be more intricate as far as lighting scheme, concepts and free form. (The freedom to adjust lighting, sets, add props and make the look your own with plenty of time to do so.) We will have a basic starting point for the look but you are encouraged to experiment. (I will be on hand to help where needed.)

About this Shoot:

We have three looks planned. (with a possible 4th pending time) First look will be a more Fashion inspired/edgy implied look. (Topless implied. Possible outdoor look pending weather which is supposed to be in 60's this Sunday.) Second look will be a nude implied Christmas theme. (Nude Implied with sheets, santa hat or props.) Third look will be implied bodyscapes with a Christmas inspired rhinestone twist. Fourth possible look is implied with ribbons and bow wrapped around body and strategically placed on private parts, pinup style. 

RSVP:

For new members: Please take the time to read the info below about how the Meetup is organized and how the shooting parameters are setup so you know what to expect at the shoot. 

NEW: Please take a moment to read the new Deposit info below in the Policy and Disclaimers section. From here on in, we have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. This will ensure that we have the minimum amount of RSVP to actually hold the Meetup. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit. Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page.

Total Cost: $80

Deposit: $30 (Paypal)

(Balance due at time of shoot: $50, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.)

(PDF version, Non-Commercial Model Release provided to email registered upon check-in.)

Model: 

Louise Ann:

(Photo Credits: NandoPro)

Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the models beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]
results.name: Model Spotlight: Implied Shoot w/Louise Ann - Dec. 13

Dear Dharma Friends,

We will be holding a moving and sitting meditation followed by a Dharma talk on the 6-Paramitas.

1:00 - 2:00 Sitting/moving meditation 

2:00 - 3:00 Lecture 

The lecture will be given by teacher Harry Miller.  Harry  studied  with  Master  Sheng  Yen  for  over  30  years.  He  was  editor  of  the  Chan  Newsletter  for  over  10  years,  is  a  frequent  contributor  to  Chan  Magazine,  and  a  lecturer  at  Chan  Meditation  Center (CMC).  He  is  a  board  member  of  Dharma  Drum  Retreat  Center  and  a  member  of  the  Dharma  Teachers  in  Training  at  CMC.  He  holds  a  B.A  in  French  and  English  literature  from  Sarah  Lawrence,  and  an  M.A.  in  Chinese  Literature  and  M.Phil.  in  Comparative  Literature  from  Columbia  University.

Look forward to seeing everyone,

_/|\_

Organizer

------------------------------------------------------

Dharma Drum Mountain Buddhist Association is an orthodox Zen/Chan international organization.  Their New York area affiliates info are the following links: <<a>www. chancenter.org</a>> <www.dharmadrumretreat.org>

The map of the area

results.description:
December 13, 2015

Final Exam

Registration for next year Exam of 1st Degree Students (Come prepared with your own paper and pens/pencils to take exam) Yule Briefing

$25 in person/$27 via paypal - If you paid online PLEASE bring your receipt to class.

WFT Academy of Pagan Studies (WFTAPS) offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Making A BOS, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more.
What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.
Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now NEW! launching in 2013 online classes which will have our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment. Students can join this blog as long as they have registered at WFTAPS for classes
The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!
We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.
We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished thus far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Academy and do hope that after reading this, you will decide to join us as at the Academy as a Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.
We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

F train to York St.

Come experience the Healing Power of Sound & Vibration from a range of wonderful instruments in a circle designed to open our hearts, relax our minds, and inspire our spirits. Utilizing Native American Flute, Celtic Harp, Singing Bowls, Didgeridoo and Shaman Drums & more! 

Sound Healing helps to:

• Relieve Stress 

• Calm Emotions

• Clear Your Thoughts

• Deepen Self Awareness

• Enhance Well Being

• Strengthen The Immune System 

• Enhance Your Connection To Your Purpose

Sage Logan: is a trained Musician and Composer. He was raised with family practices of African American folk magic known as Rootwork. He is also a Shamanic Practitioner, and has learned sacred ceremonies, and healing techniques first hand from indigenous healers, from the Lakota & Cherokee traditions, healers from Peru & Ecuador, the Maori of New Zealand, South African Sangoma’s & many more. Sage is an organizer, of the NY Shamanic Circle, NYC’s eldest Shamanic non-profit organization.

For Question Please Email [masked]

Dress comfortably for meditation, movement and relaxation. Please bring a notebook & pen, bandanna & water to drink. Musicians please feel free to bring and instrument with you to join in, meditative Instruments are especially welcome!

results.description:
Joining us this Sunday for our monthly Miracles in Manhattan lecture by Jon Mundy will be the wonderful Chris Lauretig. Chris Lauretig, with Rev. Tony Snef, is co-creator of Out of the Matrix, a program created in Ohio that uses counseling, mind-training, and multimedia to bring peace to at-risk and emotionally disturbed youth and adults. He will be discussing what this willingness looks like and how to heal the mind in order to gain the clarity and joy of Living the Guided Life. Yasuko and I know Chris personally and can both say that he is one of the most engaging spiritual speakers we have ever met. You won't want to miss him! 

Love,

Chris Pelham, Meetup Organizer

Chris Lauretig
Out of the Matrix
http://www.outofthematrix.org

Jon will lecture on Ch. 25 of the A Course in Miracles Textbook and then turn the mic over to Chris. And as usual, we will be offering walk-in Healing Clinic beforehand, by donation, from 12 – 1 pm.

The “suggested donation” is $20 per person.
More or Less, Contribute what you can
“No one is turned away who cannot pay.”
If you can do more than $20 thank you.
If less is more comfortable for you that is fine.
We do, however, request your registering in advance
contact [masked] or call[masked]
Pre-registration is appreciated (but walk-ins are welcome)
so we can prepare name tags for you.
It’s fun getting to know other ACIM students
without repeatedly asking folks their name.
If you’re new please leave your street address and email. We file everything in the computer by zip code.
No need to send emails to Florida if I’m speaking in NYC.
results.name: ACIM Class with Jon Mundy & Chris Lauretig, author of Living the Guided Life

results.description:
We are one flesh. Why not dance it?

Healing begins from the inside out. JourneyDance is a blend of improvisational theater, dance, yoga, guided movement meditations with the intention to feel and heal. Movement creates magic and when the body is allowed to express feelings and safe space is created for emotions to flow, we are able to embrace our imperfections celebrate our strengths while opening our hearts and setting our souls free. Sometimes we dance on our own, other times we dance with the group or a partner, always we dance supported by the JourneyDance Facilitator in a safe healing space. No mirrors or judgment, we do not subscribe to social codes that hold hold us back.

All are welcome at JourneyDance with Jeanine, both genders, all sizes, ages, races, spiritualities, sexual orientations... we are dancing diversity. Segregation breeds ignorance. Let's integrate not only our chakras, but our dancing, healing, community with friends of all races, sizes, sexual orientations both genders. Dance the peace you want to see and be. GENERAL STUDIO INQUIRIES PLEASE EMAIL:
[masked]
What people are saying about JourneyDance with Jeanine:

Journey Dance with you and the group last night was awesome. My work day (days) and personal life being so stressful lately, I knew I needed something other than my private practice to 'loosen up,' free my mind, and remember my own magical self. So when I chose to attend and take the journey you guided us through: dancing with the gifts of the solar plexus chakra, among all the other goodies we explore, it was the best thing I could have done. I felt 1000% better afterwards. You have the unique ability to create a beautiful welcoming space - and play great music - so I can feel safe to surrender, really, actually work through "stuff," connect with other awesome people where we've 'got each other's backs,' and have fun! Thank you Jeanine!

Love & Gratitude,

~Nechama, NY, NY

I really wanted to tell you how much I enjoy you as a facilitator and coach. You bring a level of authenticity that shines through and puts me, for one, at ease. I have been trying to pinpoint what is is exactly and how its different from other people I have met or worked with - cause I think its awesome and I wanted to communicate to you so you can keep doing it BUT I feel like you bring your youness and its working! So a big YAY of support to you!~ Alina Tsirkin NY, NY
results.name: JourneyDance with Jeanine at Pure Yoga West

results.description:
<a href="http://photos1.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/5/a/d/e/highres_64103262.jpeg"></a>

Hi Everyone,


Our first 1-day Tournament of the season is here!! RSVP while there are spots available!!

Get plenty of touches on the ball and a chance to win 1st. place championship medals!

See details below:

How long will the Tournament last?

Approximately 3.5  hours depending on the amount of teams registered.

What are the rules and level of play?

- 7vs7 (includes the goalkeeper). All teams will have 2 to 3 substitutes.

- CO-ED (no minimum girls required on field)

- 6'x12' size goals.

- Level is intermediate to advance. If you played at a college level or similar, you would be considered Advanced.

- No slide tackles.

-Only turf shoes, indoor shoes or running sneakers.

-3 points for a win, 1 for a tie and 0 for a loss. The teams in the Final Round games are decided by points, goal difference then goals scored.

-We'll keep track of scores. The goals are full size, so if you are a goalkeeper please let us know. Otherwise, teammates will rotate being goalkeeper.

-Everyone will be randomly placed on a team. If you would like to be placed with a particular team, please let us know in the comment section when you rsvp on the top right corner; we will try to accommodate everyone. Also, if you would like to bring your own team, please RSVP for you+9 and pay the total via paypal.

How do I join?
There are 2 ways to join:

1. The first way to join is as a free agent. To join as a free agent please rsvp on this page and we will place you on a team. If you would like to be placed with a friend on the same team, please let us know. We will try to accommodate everyone :)

2. The second way to join is as a team. If you would like to register your team please rsvp on this page for you+ 9 guests and pay the total amount via paypal.

How will the tourney work?

- We are looking to register 3 to 4 teams. The format varies depending on the amount of teams registered. See this link for the format: Tournament Formats

What's included?
- Hired referees
- Permit fees
- Tournament and website administration

- Medals for 1st place winners

What are the prizes?

- Easch player in the winning team receives medals and gains bragging rights :)

What should you bring?

-Please use cleats or turf shoes and lots of water.

-A white t-shirt, a red t-shirt and a blue t-shirt.

What is the refund policy?

Field Location:Click here for: Field Location Map.To see an aerial view of the field on Bing Maps: Aerial Map

DirectionsYou can get to Randall's Island by car, bus, walking or biking. Here is the link to the directions: Directions to Randall's Island

The best ways to get there are:

-Taking the A,C,D, 4,5 or 6 train to 125th st stop and walking or biking east over the RFK Bridge.

-Also, taking the M35 bus from the NW corner of 125th Street and Lexington Ave.

If you have any questions about getting there please e-mail or all us at[masked]

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Fee:Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.


Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for the next game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!


Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :).

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
