results.description:
Hello!  So for December let's venture abroad and read something from China's bestselling science fiction author:


From Barnes & Noble:

"The Three-Body Problem is the first chance for English-speaking readers to experience this multiple award winning phenomenon from China's most beloved science fiction author, Liu Cixin.

Set against the backdrop of China's Cultural Revolution, a secret military project sends signals into space to establish contact with aliens. An alien civilization on the brink of destruction captures the signal and plans to invade Earth. Meanwhile, on Earth, different camps start forming, planning to either welcome the superior beings and help them take over a world seen as corrupt, or to fight against the invasion. The result is a science fiction masterpiece of enormous scope and vision."

We talked a little about this at the last group- normally we only read books that are available in paperback, but this is currently only in hardcover, but I'm pretty excited to read this. However it is available in both Kindle and Nook versions and also audio.   Fair warning-- the Kindle and Nook versions are a bit pricey ($12.99).   The Amazon hardcover is $15.59 and B&N is $15.74.


LOCATION
We will be meeting at the Citigroup Atrium.

There is an entrance at 53rd and Lexington Avenue off of the 53rd and Lex subway stop. You have to go down the steps; the subway station will be on your right and the Atrium will be straight in front of you. The doors are labelled.   

There is a Barnes and Noble (with a Starbucks inside) located on the next level up at 54th and 3rd. If you enter through the B&N, you will need to go through B&N (up a few steps from the entrance), past the NOOK display to the glass doors and down the escalator to the Atrium.

There is free wi-fi in the Citigroup Atrium. There are also free public restrooms. Please let me know if you have any questions about the location.

It's probably more fun if you read/finish the book.  But if you don’t, you are still welcome to come. But there will be spoilers!

WHERE TO BUY
The book is available in hardcover and digital, including Kindle at Amazon</a> and a <a href="http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/the-three-body-problem-cixin-liu/1119317099?ean=9780765377067">Nook at Barnes & Noble.


IMPORTANT RSVP POLICY
If you RSVP and find you cannot make it, please change your RSVP so that we are not waiting for you. Please change it no less than two hours before the scheduled meeting time. If you RSVP and do not show, you will have to pay $10 when you attend your next event. This is to prevent those on the waiting list from missing out on an event.   

The RSVP policy is the same as for the general meetup. Please see the entire policy here:  http://www.meetup.com/NYSciFi-Fantasy/pages/Membership_Policy/
results.name: SciFi Book Club: The Three-Body Problem by Cixin Liu

All **first time writers like me are welcome! Let's discuss what does creativity means to you and how you draw inspiration when you begin a project/venture.

**First time writers, huh? We are all first time writers as every poem is new and you're the one bringing it to life for the first time!

"I am so fresh in soul and spirit that life gushes and bubbles around me in a thousand springs."
from Robert Schumann

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Note meeting place is in front of Whole Foods mid block- OUTSIDE NOT IN THE CAFE!

MEETUP TIME IS 2:00PM - 15 MINUTES EARLIER THAN THE ORIGINAL TIME!

Happy Holidays!!   Four Sundays in December the MTA will once again be running the nostalgia train on the "M" line.  Join us for a group outing to celebrate our subway system without which New York would not be New York! We'll cover the subway's history and impact on the City's growth and we'll make time for you to share your favorite real life subway story or movie scene.

Here's a link to the full schedule for December:

http://web.mta.info/metrocard/promos/RideVintage/RideVintageSubwayBus2015.htm


If you haven't done this before you will love the old subway cars, the vintage ads and he shocked expressions from the unsuspecting tourists when the train rolls into each station.

If you dare dress in 1920's -1970's attire.   Optional outing afterwards will be a visit to a speakeasy for some holiday cheer.  We will meet at 2:15 on the uptown platform near the 2nd Avenue entrance.  Note train departure time from 2nd Avenue (uptown platform) is 2:30pm.  We'll make a few trips finishing by 5:00pm. 

 I will have a sign in case you are new. Note if you arrive in the area extra early, the nearby Whole Foods at 85 East Houston (near Bowery) has an upstairs cafe.

From the MTA website:  "Once again this holiday season, the MTA will offer nostalgia lovers the opportunity to the ride back into the past with rides on vintage buses and subway trains. There’s no better way to get around while doing your holiday shopping! Dating back to the early part of last century, the Nostalgia Train is made up of subway cars in service along the lettered lines between the early1930s to the mid-1970s. Equipped with ceiling fans, padded seats and incandescent light bulbs, the R/1 through R/9 cars served the IND and later some BMT lines. Customers will have the opportunity to hop on board as it operates along the Sixth Avenue  Line."
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd Avenue (Houston Street) station of the F train, going uptown.  Meet on the platform closest to the front of the train - 2nd Avenue Entrance.  I will have a sign should there be a lot of people around.
results.name: Riding the Nostalgia Train and Enjoying NYC Subway History!

results.description: This is a psychological thriller that has burned up the bestseller charts and keeps growing into phenomenon status, with a film adaptation in the works. "I've been following her for the past few days. I know where she buys her groceries, where she works. I don't know the color of her eyes or what they look like when she's scared. But I will." One night, Mia Dennett enters a bar to meet her on-again, off-again boyfriend. But when he doesn't show, she unwisely leaves with an enigmatic stranger. At first Colin Thatcher seems like a safe one-night stand. But following Colin home will turn out to be the worst mistake of Mia's life. When Colin decides to hide Mia in a secluded cabin in rural Minnesota instead of delivering her to his employers, Mia's mother, Eve, and detective Gabe Hoffman will stop at nothing to find them. But no one could have predicted the emotional entanglements that eventually cause this family's world to shatter. An addictively suspenseful and tautly written thriller, The Good Girl is a propulsive debut that reveals how even in the perfect family, nothing is as it seems.
results.name: "The Good Girl," by Mary Kubica

results.description:
Hey everyone!

First off, let's answer some big questions everyone's been asking:

Q: Is this group dead or alive?


A: As you can see...WE'RE STILL ALIVE!

Q: Awesome…but what happened to our spring/summer Meetups this year?


A: We quietly took a bit of an unplanned, first-ever sabbatical over the last several months due to (of all things) global warming.


In short, this tough decision was largely done for the safety of our snort-nosed pals - read more about the reasons why in a recent reply I made on our discussion forum here:


http://www.meetup.com/newyorkbostonterrier/messages/boards/thread/49092914#[masked]  

Q: Well, TLDR...why didn't we do them indoors at Animal Haven?


A: In short, due to logistics (again, see discussion link above) - and as I've learned recently, their air conditioning in the playroom was broken and remained so for much of the summer, so it wouldn't have even been an option anyway.

Q: It's December, and by now we'd be into our second winter indoor Meetup at Animal Haven - and we didn't even do one in November…why?


A: Animal Haven as we've known and loved it for so many years is no more.


They've moved a couple of blocks down the street into a brand new, smaller, LEED-certified facility - read more about it here:


http://www.animalhavenshelter.org/site/PageServer?pagename=Moving


This is great…except for one thing:


It now has a play space that's 1/4th the size of the their old one.

Sadly, this now presents a few BIG problems for us - which I hope you guys can help us out with:

- Put simply, we're a victim of our own success. We have one of the largest pet owner groups on Meetup.com in NYC. However, we simply cannot do indoor Meetups in a space that size.


- We've been looking into new venues like privately-owned doggie daycare places, and so far, none I've seen have a play space of comparable size, or are open to the notion of accommodating 30-40 dogs and their owners showing up at once (at least in Manhattan, where we try to remain centrally-based for everyone).


- From a "business standpoint", this is kind of a big deal in another way:

A small portion of the proceeds from our winter Meetups have historically funded the group for the remainder of the year, the rest was donated to Animal Haven - any new space we find would need to be both economical and still amenable to sharing any income so we can pay our twice-yearly Meetup.com group subscription, which increased this year due to our group's size to $180/year.


- To be perfectly honest, this has all taken us and many other NYC dog Meetup organizers completely by surprise.


Animal Haven has been our go-to indoor venue since the group was founded in 2006, and frankly, we hadn't thought of any other options, because we never needed to. They've essentially been woven into our DNA from the start, and gave us no early indication or warning they had plans to move until we approached them several weeks ago to schedule this winter's Meetups. Regardless, they've otherwise been good to us over the years, and we wish them the best of luck with their mission in their new space!

Soooo…for the first time, we're now needing to turn to you, and asking for your ideas to help keep our group alive.

If you know of a venue in the city that can meet our needs - doggie daycare, private residence, a business with a large, safe, well-appointed space with dog-friendly owners, etc. - PLEASE get in touch ASAP, so we can check into it, and hopefully get us back on track for the winter sooner rather than later. 

(End of explanation/apology/support plea section...now, as for the more immediate future, and that aforementioned global warming thing, back to our regularly scheduled program...)

Perhaps you've noticed it's a little hot out for December, huh? 


Not only did we globally have the hottest spring, summer, and fall on record, NYC may see the warmest days in December history this weekend.


Normally, this could be seen as a bad thing, but right now for us under the circumstances - it's AWESOME…so to celebrate, and make up for lost time a little bit, we'll have not one but TWO Meetups this weekend!


#1 will be at the Stuyvesant Dog Run just a few blocks east of Union Square on Saturday, #2 will be uptown at Teddy's Run next to the American Museum of Natural History at 79th and Columbus Avenue.


RSVPs are obviously not required since we're outdoors, but would be greatly appreciated so we can get an idea of who's coming.

Normally this would be considered very short notice, which we apologize profusely for, but I wanted to ensure the forecasts would be good - so let's enjoy this gift of fall-like temps while we can.

Happy Holidays to all!

-Scott
Fearless Leader/Alpha Doggie Organizer
NYC Boston Terrier Meetup Group
results.name: December Double Outdoor/Global Warming Meetup (#2 of 2 this weekend!)

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cDDdeHtrxfA

In this spoof of McCarthy-era paranoia and 1950s wholesomeness, the characters and plot are drawn from the popular Parker Brothers board game of the same name. On a dark and stormy night in 1954, six individuals with ties to Washington are assembled for a dinner party at the swanky mansion of one Mr. Boddy (Lee Ving). Boddy's butler, Wadsworth (Tim Curry), assigns each guest a colorful name: Mr. Green (Michael McKean), Col. Mustard (Martin Mull), Mrs. Peacock (Eileen Brennan), Professor Plum (Christopher Lloyd), Miss Scarlet (Lesley Ann Warren), and Mrs. White (Madeline Kahn). Two additional servants, the Cook (Kellye Nakahara) and Yvette, the maid (Colleen Camp), assist Wadsworth as he informs the guests that they have been gathered to meet the man who has been blackmailing them: Mr. Boddy. When Boddy turns up dead, however, the guests must try to figure out who killed him so they can protect their own reputations and keep the body count from growing. Three separate endings were filmed for Clue and shown in different theaters; all three are collected for the video edition. Although the film is set in the 1950s, the original Clue game was actually devised by Anthony Pratt, a clerk in Leeds, England, to pass the time during World War II air-raid drills. First released in 1946 under the name Cluedo by British manufacturer Waddington's, Clue was renamed and released in the U.S. in 1949. Today, Clue/Cluedo is marketed in 70 countries around the world and has been adapted into a British game show and an off-Broadway musical.


Get your free tickets here: 

http://svatheatre.com/events/clue-a-30th-anniversary-screening-in-35mm-film/

Please join us for December 2015's Book of the Month, "Year of Yes: How to Dance It Out, Stand in the Sun, and Be Your Own Person" by Shonda Rhimes. Please come with a spirit of fellowship, a point of view, and an open mind.


***Book Synopsis***
This poignant, intimate, and hilarious memoir explores Shonda’s life before her Year of Yes—from her nerdy, book-loving childhood creating imaginary friends to her devotion to creating television characters who reflected the world she saw around her (like Cristina Yang, whose ultimate goal wasn’t marriage, and Cyrus Beene, who is a Republican and gay). And it chronicles her life after her Year of Yes had begun—when Shonda forced herself out of the house and onto the stage, appearing on Jimmy Kimmel Live, and giving the Dartmouth Commencement speech; when she learned to say yes to her health, yes to play and she stepped out of the shadows and into the sun; when she learned to explore, empower, applaud, and love her truest self. Yes.

***Where to Find the Book***

Amazon

Brooklyn Public Library

Hue-Man Bookstore

New York Public Library

Queens Library

results.description:
I saw this at TFANA TREMENDOUS!!!!!!!!

Q&A with Julie Taymor after screening!

“Visionary director Julie Taymor is a thrilling painter of theatre” - Time Out New York

“A deliriously beautiful, deeply magical staging” - Newsday

“The director who redefined spectacle on Broadway… has now given New York a Midsummer Night’s Dream that doesn’t so much reach for the heavens as roll around in them, with joyous but calculated abandon… For Ms. Taymor, the sky is not the limit. It’s a supple canvas to be stretched and bent to the whims of the imagination. Her eye-popping take on the canon’s most enchanted comedy… confirms Ms. Taymor’s reputation as the cosmic P. T. Barnum of contemporary stagecraft… This Dream exists… as a glittering necklace of breathtaking moments… [and] when the moments are this beautiful, they take root in your mind and assume lives of their own. Don’t be surprised when they start showing up in your own dreams. The ingeniously mixed music of Elliot Goldenthal ranges from anxious jazz riffs to sustained, ethereal lullabies.” - Ben Brantley - The New York Times

Presenting Julie Taymor’s much heralded and sold-out production of A Midsummer Night’s Dream, filmed at Theatre For A New Audience, Polonsky Shakespeare Center in Brooklyn, New York in 2014. Taymor is the creative force behind such productions as The Magic Flute (Metropolitan Opera), Across the Universe,Frida, and of course the highest grossing Broadway musical of all time, The Lion King.  

Of all Shakespeare's plays, A Midsummer Night's Dream is the most phantasmagorical, featuring fairies, spells, and hallucinatory lovers. Julie Taymor turns out a production that's visually breathtaking, funny, sexy and darkly poetic. With cinematography by Rodrigo Prieto (Argo, Frida) and music by Academy Award-winning composer Elliot Goldenthal, this is an immersive, inventive cinematic experience that was filmed during the show’s highly acclaimed inaugural run. The feats of visual imagination are ingenious and plentiful, but beating at the centre of the film is an emotionally moving take on the deeper human aspects of this beloved tale.
results.name: Julie Taymor's Midsummer Night's Dream

results.description:
Felipe Galindo

"New York Stories" 

Opening Reception: Sunday December 13 from 2-5pm. We are meeting at 3:15PM

92 Orchard Street, New York NY 10002

Located between Delancey & Broome Street

<a>[masked]</a>

 [masked]

After this we will visit other galleries in the area and then perhaps have an early dinner in Chinatown.

Sarina

 The Mark Miller gallery is pleased to present "New York Stories" by renowned artist Felipe Galindo, a series of works created on disposable objects and sketches of New York City life, created during the past three decades.

Guided by the graphic qualities of throwaway materials (milk cartons, shopping bags, Chinese food containers, to name a few,) Galindo's work makes humorous commentaries on everyday life and comments on today’s consumer society while celebrating life in the artist’s adopted city.

Galindo’s work gives new life to the debris of our market economy and creates unique works of art inspired by the beauty and complexity of castaway objects.

Felipe Galindo (aka Feggo) is a fine artist, illustrator, cartoonist and independent animator. His drawings have appeared in The New Yorker, Mad Magazine, INXart, Narrative, The New York Times, The International Herald Tribune, Newsday, The Wall Street Journal, Reader’s Digest, Nickelodeon, Barron's and others worldwide.

Galindo has held numerous individual exhibitions in the United States and abroad. He has received grants from the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, the Puffin Foundation, National Association of Latino Arts and Culture, the Northern Manhattan Arts Alliance, Latino Public Broadcasting, the New York Council for the Arts, and the US/Mexico Fund for Culture of the Rockefeller Foundation. Additional awards include: United Nations Correspondents Association, Ministry of Tourism, Turkey, Porto Cartoon Festival, Greek Ministry of Culture, Zagreb International Cartoons, Knokke-Heist Humor Fest, Belgium, San Antonio Cine Festival, etc.

He is the creator of the celebrated project Manhatitlan, which includes works on paper, animations, and the newly released book Manhatitlan, Mexican and American Cultures Intertwined.
results.name: Sun Dec 13 @3:15 PM LES Art Galleries

This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3:30-6pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking?

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers?

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life.

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.

Hope to see you there!

Steve

results.description:
Happy Holidays from us to you this 2015 Season! Come on out for a fun little gifting & swapping get-together immediately following our regularly scheduled monthly meeting. Here’s the concept: bring a book wrapped and ribboned, and receive one wrapped and ribboned.

What should I bring? One of your favorite titles you've read in the past year or two, not featured by our group during that time. One that particularly stuck out to you, satisfied your literary cravings better than you expected, and left that indelible mark on your mind or heart or both. 

Any other criteria? Well, the only particular suggestion would be to bring a fiction book valued at between $10 and $25. Other than that, it can be hard or soft, old or new, long or short, a prize winner or a hidden gem. 

So, what happens? Everyone who comes will bring their one gift-wrapped book. We’ll put them all into one big bag and toss ‘em around a bit. We’ll then have a box with numbered slips. After everyone pulls a number, we’ll start with whoever picks the number one, and then we’ll proceed on down the numerical line. Then the best part: we all unwrap at the same time. You can chat with the person who picked your book, or they can keep mum, it’s all up to you guys. Swapping will be allowed—for example, if you already own the book—so we hope there’ll be no hurt feelings among the gifters. 

Is there a catch? What would life be without those endearing catches we all know and love *wink*. Once you have your book, you promise to talk briefly about it at our January meeting. You won’t have to do it alone necessarily: your gifter can talk about it too, and anyone else who has read your particular title. 

Any other questions? No? Good! Hope to see you here to spread some Holiday cheer!
results.name: Holiday Book Grab Bag

results.description:
Learn how to ‘tap’ your way to a happier and more fulfilling life using Emotional Freedom Techniques. EFT is a simple yet incredibly effective method of self healing that can be used to immediately reduce anxiety, stress, and other emotions that stand in our way of living in a place of optimum well-being and personal peace. Together we will work on individual and collective issues of concern. The more of us who tap together in a group format, the more benefit can be received by all.

At this meetup we will continue exploring the nature of our mind and emotions and learn how to identify ‘stories’ we tell about ourselves that contribute to any sense of personal 'Not-OKness'. Then we can release the charge these stories carry with EFT and increase our personal Emotional Freedom!


One of the special features of our Meetup is that we demonstrate how we have unconscious blocks to happiness and Emotional Freedom. Using Energetic Rescripting Process (ERP), a technique that borrows from Kinesiology and EFT, we locate the nature of these blocks and remove them.


Even from the demos we do in our Meetups people get back to me with remarkable stories of how things in their life are shifting for the better!


Registration for this meeting is required. Please RSVP to say 'I'm Coming'. A $10 donation is suggested. 


All are welcome (adults 17 and up who are emotionally comfortable in group settings), although space is limited..

Those new to EFT are asked to review the ample amount of EFT resources posted (listed under to MORE/FILES tab of this meetup site). Click here to read a primer about using EFT.

You can also find instructional videos and more info posted on our new Emotional Freedom Facebook page:
http://www.facebook.com/EFTforEmotionalFreedom


Being already somewhat familiar with EFT will help to minimize our time explaining why we are tapping and saying these strange things, and maximize our time sharing from our personal experiences and using our techniques to release the emotions that no longer serve our well being.
results.name: Special Sunday EFT Meetup Group

He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. It's here again! The Holiday of the dramatic sister, the obnoxious brother and his matching outfit wife and all the other crazy relatives you love best from a distance. It's the long lines of shopping for gifts that someone will  re-gift or exchange. The hours frustration of flying, driving to your home town just to sit on Aunt Bertha's couch. 

   But if you're looking forward to this, be my guest!

Well this party is for the no nonsense (new) or everyday New Yorker. Wine, Single people and great conversations.  No more getting stuck under the mistletoe with your cousin's weird neighbor. No more witnessing crazy temper tantrums from your three year old nephew. Come sit with the cool people. The ones who'd rather have a nice glass of wine. But until you have to do the dreadful duty like me this holiday - Let's have a social event

Join us for:

There is nothing better than a great excuse to enjoy wine with friends. We plan to spend an amazing Easy-Sunday with great conversation and friends. Sit back and have a little Wine, Bruschetta & Charcuterie. 

Looking forward to this one


Olisa

results.description:
TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop・TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座


What's going on?

JCAG offers TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) and TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) workshops for all of you interested in preparing for the tests. The TOEFL tests and measures the ability to use English at the university level, and the TOEIC tests and measures the ability to use English in an international business environment.


(Details)


- TOEIC sessions are held once a month on the first Sunday, and the remaining Sundays are devoted to the TOEFL. This week, we are focusing on the listening aspect of the TOEFL test.


- The lessons focus on all the aspects of the tests (reading, writing, listening, and speaking) as well as other aspects such as pronunciation and composition ability in a focused yet fun and productive environment.

When & Where:

Date: Every other Sunday from 4:30pm-7:00pm

Location: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

Cost: These sessions are free of charge, but there is a suggested donation of $5 that will help to cover the cost of the printing materials.

To RSVP, email us at:　 [masked]


If you have any questions, please feel free to email us.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

 ****NOTE*****

1.) This event is run by JCAG organizers who are following a lesson plan that is prepared in advance, so we ask that native English speakers be aware of this when participating. 

2.) Due to the fact that the organizers dedicating their time to help with the event, we ask that people be considerate in terms of the time. Sessions will be cancelled in the event that students do not show up within 40 minutes of the start time.

皆様、

多くの方々のご希望や期待に応じて、我々JCAGはいよいよTOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)・TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) 対策の講座を開催致します。TOEFLは、英語圏の高等教育機関が入学希望者の外国語としての英語力を判定するための試験で、TOEICは英語によるコミュニケーション能力を検定するための試験です。


(内容)
レッスンはテスト(読解、ライティング、聴解、会話)に基づき集中したものになります。
又は発音、作文の強化等にも集中し、楽しみながら、効率的な環境でテストに励めるように指導致します。


日時と場所:


日時:日曜日の午後4時半～7時 (二週間ごとに二時間単位で行います)

場所: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

費用: イベントのご参加は無料ですが教材の出費を緩和致しますため、$5の推奨ドネーション額をお支払い下さい。

ご予約は以下まで: （予約なしでもご参加ＯＫです）
[masked]

ご質問のある方はメールまでお問い合わせください。

皆様のお越しをお待ちしております。

results.description:
Hi Peñistas!

It's time for our end-of-year 2015 Holiday Party!

After the match on Sunday, Quinn's has offered to cater our holiday get-together at 4:30 downstairs in the back area of the bar. Details are as follows:

* Price: $30 per person (CASH ONLY - payment that same day, wrist-bands will be issued)

* Catering will start at 4:30pm through 7:30pm.

* Buffet-style food will be served - selections from the standard Quinn's menu.

* 4 beer choices and 1 cider beverage - selections TBD.

There will also be a raffle of some Quinn's, Peña & RM goodies, with the proceeds being donated to amazing charity causes. The details about the fundraiser will be updated later in the week.

For now, the most important thing: 

Quinn's needs a HEAD-COUNT of us ASAP for them to plan the arrangements accordingly - so PLEASE PLEASE RSVP as soon as possible!

Hope you all can make it, enjoy some yummy Quinn's fare, an end-of-year drink or two (or three), and wish each other well as we close the books on this 2015!

Cheers and Happy Holidays!!!

** FUNDRAISER / RAFFLE UPDATE ** 

In the spirit of true Madridismo, every year for Christmas, the Peña Madridista NYC gets involved with a few charities to show solidarity to those in need around the world. During our Holiday party, we will be raffling off some fun prizes directly from the stores of Bernabeu in Madrid, giftcards to our headquarters Quinn’s Bar & Grill, and donations from our partners at Upper90 Soccer Store. All of the money collected will be donated to two charity organizations that our NYC Peñistas directly work with. These organizations are very worthy of our help so please be as generous as possible when buying raffle tickets! Raffles will cost $5 each, $10 for 3, and $20 for 10.  If you are unable to attend the Holiday party and would like to make a donation to these amazing charities, send an email to [masked] and we will tell you how to do so.  You can read all about both organizations and their upcoming projects below... Thank you so much for your anticipated generosity and I look forward to seeing you at the party Sunday!

FEIH: The Foundation for Education in Honduras

A year ago, our Peñista Ramiro Ocasio and Jon Henes (a partner at the law firm Kirkland & Ellis) started their very own foundation: The Foundation for Education in Honduras. The focus and mission of FEIH is to provide the underprivileged children of Honduras with a quality education they deserve. FEIH is now in the process of building their first school! The organization has made a commitment with Clinton Global Initiative to build 5 schools in 3 years. With the help of the entire FEIH Team, which a few of our members are a part of, the organization broke ground in October. The construction is almost complete and they will inaugurate the Santiago Morales School on January 16th, 2016. FEIH is now looking to now collect $5,000 to purchase backpacks and school supplies for the students in the community. With as little as $35, a child will receive a backpack filled with an entire year of school supplies and a PenPal letter from students in the NYC area. Check out their website www.feih.org and learn how your donation impacts the underprivileged children of the poor rural communities in El Progreso, Honduras. You can also support by liking them on Facebook: The Foundation for Education in Honduras, and following them on Instagram & Twitter: @feihonduras.

The Downtown United Soccer Club (DUSC)

The mission of DUSC is to educate, train and inspire underpriveleged soccer players of all ages and abilities in a positive, respectful, supportive environment.  To foster a community that reflects the diversity of New York City in which children can develop a lifelong love for the beautiful game and realize their full potential as both players and people.  

Our raffle donations will be directly helping their scholarship program, as many children cannot afford to pay for their soccer programs. You can read more about their programs here: http://www.dusc.net/pages/index.php/about/organization

Let's get together and talk about poly, our poly lives, support each other in dealing with poly issues, and above all, have fun. We meet between 5:00 and 7:00 If enough folks are interested, we can continue the discussion after the meeting over dinner at a nearby restaurant. Potluck snacks are welcome. We ask a donation of $5 to help cover room rental costs, but no one is turned away because they can't afford it. We want you there more than we want the money.

Note that this meetup is announced here and in several other places, and people sometimes come without signing up, so the signup list bears little resemblance to the actual attendance. All poly, poly curious, and poly friendly people are welcome regardless of sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, race, or any of the other things some groups use to discriminate.

results.description:
Join us as we continue our THRONES Countdown to Season 6!

We start with all of Season 1 and go straight through to the end of Season 5. Guess what? By the time we finish all five seasons together it will be time for Season 6!!! Yay! We can socialize  from 5PM to 5:30PM, then we begin the show at 5:30 promptly. A short intermission for reactions, then the second show. We have to clear out by 8PM.


This week we have:


Episode 7 "A Man Without Honor"

Episode 6 "The Prince of Winterfell"


All are welcome. If you have never watched Game of Thrones before and want to see what all the fuss is about, come on in and be enlightened. If you are a full fledged Maester trying to survive the Long Night between seasons come join us and watch the marvelous series again while vicariously enjoying the newbies reactions to the Game of Thrones.

NOTE- Newbies must identify themselves so us Maesters will have notice that you are there so we turn off MST3000 level of commentary!


This is a NEWBIE friendly event so our usual rules do not apply. Please no spoilers about the show or books in this newbie friendly environment (including this comment section). Anything already watched by the group as part of the Countdown is fair game to discuss by all, but no discussing the resolutions of things in the presence of our newbies. (Maesters will have their own anything goes events and time after the show). Newbies are of course welcome to theorize and forecast, but those of us who actually know "shall not pass" the information!


You can BYOF (bring your own food) and BYOB (bring your own beer and/or other drinks). There is a 7/11 on 33rd and Madison, a Wendys and a Smashburger and $1 Pizza on 33rd and 5th, and a Chipotle on 31st and Park (and other eats nearby too).
results.name: Game of Thrones Series Recap- Season 2 Episodes 7 & 8

results.description:
Dyker Heights is a residential neighborhood in the southwest corner of the borough of Brooklyn in New York City, US. It houses some of the most extravagant Christmas light displays in the country that are mostly done professionally. They involve over-the-top Lights, large inflatable Christmas decorations, and motorized holiday displays. It is a place the must be seen during the holiday season and is fun for the entire family. It also presents an unmatched opportunity for photographers to get great holiday lightnings and decorations pictures taken. It is also presents challenging conditions for night photography which makes taking pictures there even more exciting.

We recently covered all the principles for taking great holiday decorations pictures at night time. This trip is to practice what we learned in the studio. I will be available throughout the trip to assist in getting each team member taking memorable pictures.

For those reasons, only those that attended the "Introduction to Night Photography Class" can register for this field trip. I am also limiting the number of participants to five including me. Therefore, I will be able to provide transportation from Astoria to Dyker Heights and back in my car which can accommodate five people. The reservation will be on first come-first served basis. I allow members that do not make the cut to sign to a waiting list. If I get more than thee on the waiting list, and will repeat the trip with them at a later date.

Bottled water will be available during the trip.
results.name: Field Trip - Dyker Heights Holiday Lights Photo Shoot.

results.description:
Get tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online)

Social Painting Night: Paint, Drink, Make New Friends!

WHERE: Social Bar & Lounge - 795 8th Avenue (between 48th & 49th St) New York, NY 10019
WHEN: Sunday, December 13th 2015: 5:00 PM - 7:30 PM

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online)

* THIS IS NOT AN ASIAN SPECIFIC EVENT.

Social Painting Night: Paint, Drink, Make New Friends!

WHERE: Social Bar & Lounge - 795 8th Avenue (between 48th & 49th St) New York, NY 10019
WHEN: Sunday, December 13th 2015: 5:00 PM - 7:30 PM

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.


This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

results.description:
Interested in a more practical hands-on understanding of the Kabbalah and specifically the Sephiroth? Come join us for our introductory and planning meeting for a new study group.  

We will be using "The Qabalah Workbook for Magicians: A Guide to the Sephiroth" by Anita Kraft  <a>(http://www.amazon.com/The-Qabalah-Workbook-Magicians-Sephiroth/dp/1578635357</a>;

) as our guide to a more thorough understanding of the Sephiroth of the Tree of Life along with other classic Kabbalah texts.   

During this meeting we will begin to review the Qabalah. We will also use this meeting to assign leaders for our upcoming workings.  
  If you cannot make this meeting, please reach out to indicate your interest in this study group so we can coordinate attendees as participation will be closed to group members only after the initial gatherings. 

To RSVP for this event and receive directions, please email

[masked]


Admission: $10

<a href="mailto:[masked]"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: To RSVP for this event and recieve directions, please email tahutilodge@tahutilodge.org

It seems pretty fun to me, hope other people are interested!!

For more info and to sign up: https://goo.gl/hQYkqj

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

For December, we will discuss Giovanni's Room by James Baldwin, a classic LGBT work of literature.

From Goodreads: "Baldwin's haunting and controversial second novel is his most sustained treatment of sexuality, and a classic of gay literature. In a 1950s Paris swarming with expatriates and characterized by dangerous liaisons and hidden violence, an American finds himself unable to repress his impulses, despite his determination to live the conventional life he envisions for himself. After meeting and proposing to a young woman, he falls into a lengthy affair with an Italian bartender and is confounded and tortured by his sexual identity as he oscillates between the two." Hope you can make it. :) Look forward to meeting and discussing the book. For any comments, questions, etc. please email me (Tanmoy) at [masked]

Many thanks,
Tanmoy
results.name: Discuss "Giovanni's Room" by James Baldwin

results.description:
Experience this new gathering by our guest presenters at Neolyth - Anjelica and Aurelian. Both highly accomplished holistic healers, traveling all the way from Seattle, WA, they are worth your while and notice! You can trust their expertise and intuition. This time - they are taking you on a journey through your past lives with Quantum Healing Hypnosis Technique.

Quantum Healing Hypnosis Technique (QHHT) is Dolores Cannon's method of hypnosis, which involves inducing an individual into the Somnambulistic state of trance through visualization. Past Life Regression is the first component of Dolores' QHHT technique and involves the individual being regressed and guided through an appropriate past life from the first scene they first view, throughout the various periods of the life and eventually through to the death scene.

The Subconscious will select what past life to show the individual and they will be guided through it by the QHHT practitioner conducting the session. The past life the Subconscious chooses to show an individual is always relevant to the current life the individual is living now and it is not uncommon for multiple Past Lives to be shown during a single session. The QHHT practitioner will navigate an individual through a Past Life using a series of questions to help determine the time period and social setting of the life.

What is The Subconscious?

Dolores' Definition
The Subconscious that was contacted by Dolores and the practitioners of her QHHT technique is the polar opposite to the subconscious referred to by psychologists and conventional medical professionals. During her early years as a hypnotherapist, Dolores became aware that through her unique technique of induction she was contacting and communicating with a portion of an individual's consciousness that was indeed a part of them, yet lay far above the level of their conscious mind, which is the part of ourselves we are aware of and use to interact with others on a personal level.The Subconscious is a suitable label given the context of Dolores' work; however, religions and spiritual teachers alike have attempted to identify and label this larger part of ourselves throughout history using a variety of different labels: the Higher Self, the Oversoul, Christ Consciousness, Higher Consciousness, the Universal Mind and Oneness. The Subconscious had stated to Dolores that it does not care what we call it, it simply "Is" and is willing to work with those with a pure heart and true intent.
results.name: "Quantum Healing Hypnosis Technique"

results.description:
We're changing December meet-up to a Sunday. Fig 19 is an awesome place with great reasonably priced drinks. The staff will work to create an original cocktail to pair with the book. Plus we have an awesome space reserved for us. Hope to see you there.


His Master's Voice

This is a densely philosophical first contact story about an effort by scientists to decode, translate and understand an extraterrestrial transmission. The novel critically approaches humanity's intelligence and intentions in deciphering and truly comprehending a message from outer space.

Ardberg Uigeadail

We think an Ardberg is perfect given that they are the first distillery to send a whisky in space. 

Uigeadail derives from the Scotch Gaelic for 'Dark and Mysterious Place' and is named for the Loch from whence Ardbeg draws its waters. Jim Murray's 2009 World Whisky of the Year, this cask-strength bottle exudes breathtaking balance.


The flavour is initially sweet, revealing fruit cake and treacle. This is followed by barbecued or honey roast food with the slightest hint of olives.


Fig 19

Secreted behind an art gallery and directly above sister establishment Home Sweet Home, Fig. 19 is a speakeasy. 

Fig 19 can feel like a drawing room, with dark woods, taxidermy, countless candles, and beaded chandeliers.
results.name: His Master's Voice + Ardberg Uigeadail

results.description:
Photo Credit: Jazzville, NJ member, Maurice Jefferson

Robin's Nest in Linden is truly one of the friendliest venues we've ever been to. Walk in once and you're part of the family.

Plus, it doesn't hurt that the open jam session lets everyone join in the fun. Musicians and vocalists are invited to get on stage and join the band for a few songs.

Over the years, we've had members grace us with their talents and it's always fun to see someone you know join the band for a few numbers.

There is no cover and the food is excellent, so bring an appetite!

Your GPS is not misleading you

Robin's Nest is in a very residential area. Most first-timers think their GPS is taking them the wrong way. Just continue to follow it. Once you get to the club, it's very visible amongst all the houses.

A Note About Parking

It's a small lot and double parking is common. If you are on a time schedule, it's best to park on the street so you don't get blocked in.

The area around the club is very safe and there is plenty of space on the surrounding streets.

How To Find Us

Robin's Nest is a cozy little place, so you shouldn't have any trouble locating us, but if this is your first time joining the group, you might not recognize us right away.

Here are three easy ways to find us:

• look for the Jazzville, NJ Meetup sign: http://bit.ly/zBZxVL

• look for me: http://bit.ly/zP11QP

• ask at the bar for the "Jazzville, NJ Meetup" group

Don't be shy! Come introduce yourself and partake in the music and merryment!

peace and jazz,

D.A.
results.why: Robin's Nest is the place to be on Sunday evenings! If you're a singer or musician, you can join the band on stage. If you're not, just get ready to be blown away by the talent!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the door or the bar for the Jazzville Meetup group or look for the Meetup sign.
results.name: Second Sundays: Cool Jazz Open Jam @ Robin's Nest, Linden

results.description:
Directions:

CILK119 is located in the garret of the Rockland County times building, at the corner of First and Main in Nanuet, NY. (Our entrance has been compared to the office door of a private eye–cool!) Fear not, we’re up here and we’ve fixed the place up nice! Our neighbors are Dr. Fessel, a podiatrist; Clarkstown Coins; Murielle’s Beauty Salon; Estrella’s Cafe; Village Sensations, a head shop; Ecualimo; and Maveli Indian grocery. Behind us is Diamond Jim’s, a pool hall. Detailed driving directions below. Find the door marked “119″ (one in front, one in back) and come on up!

From Upstate New York: NYS Thruway 287 toward Tappan Zee Bridge. Take Exit 14 to Spring Valley/Rte 59. At the light, turn left. Proceed east on NY State Route 59 to Main St./Middletown Rd. Turn right at the light. Proceed about 1/4 mile south on Main St./Middletown Rd. We are located in the Rockland County Times building, which will be on your right, at the corner of First St. Parking is available on the street, behind the building, and at the Rand office building, also on the right on the corner of Main/First.

From NYC/Palisades Parkway: Take Exit 8W, Route 59 West toward Nanuet. Proceed west on NY State Route 59 to Main St./Middletown Rd. Turn left at the light. Proceed about 1/4 mile south on Main St./Middletown Rd. We are located in the Rockland County Times building, which will be on your right, at the corner of First St. Parking is available on the street, behind the building, and at the Rand office building, also on the right on the corner of Main/First.

From Westchester/Tappan Zee Bridge: Take NYS Thruway 287/87 toward Albany. Take Exit 14 to Spring Valley/Rte 59. At the light, turn left. Proceed east on NY State Route 59 to Main St./Middletown Rd. Turn right at the light. Proceed about 1/4 mile south on Main St./Middletown Rd. We are located in the Rockland County Times building, which will be on your right, at the corner of First St. Parking is available on the street, behind the building, and at the Rand office building, also on the right on the corner of Main/First.

From New Jersey: Take the Garden State Parkway north to the NYS Thruway toward the Tappan Zee Bridge. Take the first exit, 14 to Spring Valley/Rte 59. At the light, turn left. Proceed east on NY State Route 59 to Main St./Middletown Rd. Turn right at the light. Proceed about 1/4 mile south on Main St./Middletown Rd. We are located in the Rockland County Times building, which will be on your right, at the corner of First St. Parking is available on the street, behind the building, and at the Rand office building, also on the right on the corner of Main/First.

results.description:
Gage Dekker still blames himself for the car accident that claimed the lives of his first wife and young son. Then he meets Anna, who understands grief all too well. Within a year, Gage and Anna are married, his career is thriving, and both feel ready to become parents once more. 

After a heartbreaking miscarriage, they begin the long adoption process, until fate brings Lily into their lives. Young, pregnant, and homeless, Lily agrees to give her baby to Gage and Anna in exchange for financial support. It's the perfect arrangement for everyone. Seeing his wife's happiness and optimism for their new life and child, Gage begins to feel a sense of hope he thought he'd lost forever.


But something isn't right once Lily enters their lives. At work and at home, Gage is being sabotaged, first in subtle ways, then things take a more sinister turn. Every attempt he makes to uncover the truth only drives a wedge between him and Anna. Even as he's propelled toward an unthinkable choice to save his marriage and his job, Gage discovers that the most chilling revelations are still to come. . .

It's the final PPV of the calendar year and we're once again ready to finish out another successful year of WWE viewing parties at McHale's Bar.

I'd like to encourage you all to be as festive as you like this Sunday, ugly sweaters etc are all welcome. Let's enjoy our one WWE PPV day of the holiday season in style and make this a great night!

The Intuition Circle is held the 2nd Sunday of Each Month!

At each monthly Intuition Circle we will explore different aspects of Intuitive development, aspects like:

results.description: Celestial, cosmic, oceanic, otherworldly … words can’t really describe the experience of a gong meditation. Without a doubt, this event is a trip to the heavens, the depths and back. The sound of the gong creates an opportunity for deep and soulful relaxation, regenerating our parasympathetic system. As the gong dissolves energetic blockages, many old beliefs, patterns, habits or even physical issues that no longer serve us may come to the surface for release. The gong truly works on the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual level! Come travel to the stars with our Mother Tesla Gong and clear a path to hearing our heart’s truth, the song of our authentic self and the calling of our true intuition.

A joint production of the Teaching Studios of Art® and Jerry's Palette Shop

After a year long hiatus, our famous Drink and Draw event is back. This time, it's in Manhattan, not Bushwick. Jerry's Palette Shop has generously offered to partner with us to help make this a top notch event, right in their store in Union Square. They have built the entire interior of the store on wheels, so it can be cleared wide open for a large event.


Teaching Studios Director Rob Zeller will MC, running it exactly as he did in Bushwick.


Great Model, Great tunes, and BYOB

Our model for the evening will be Anne Catherine. One of the best in her profession, this is an evening you will not want to miss.



Figure Drawing from the live model, a mix of short poses and a long pose for those who would like a more finished drawing.

Sunday Dec 13, 2014, 7:00 PM To 10:00 PM


Where:Jerry's International Palette Shop
111 4th Ave
New York, NY 10003
Right off Union Square


Cost:$15 per person


Limited to 40 artists, first come, first served.
Spots go on sale at 6:45pm

We will begin with a few short poses, and then have one long pose that lasts for the rest of the night. This artistic event is for creative types who enjoy working from the live model. This session is totally uninstructed.No painting, only drawing. Otherwise, do your own thing.No photography allowed.

results.description:
"Tuning the mind, body, and soul"-Gaynor

The sound and silence meditation group meets every Sunday. The meditation begins with 30 min. of  toning*, 30 minutes of silent meditation, In the last 10 min. there is time for a brief discussion, questions, or sharing.


According to Gaynor (1999, p. [masked]), "Sounds enters the healing equation from several different directions: It may alter cellular functions through energetic effects; it may entrain biological systems to function more homeostatically; it may becalm the mind and therefore the body; or it may have emotional effects, which influence neurotransmitters and neuropeptides, which in turn help regulate the immune system-the healer within. Music is organized sound that has potent emotional effects and stimulates memories, associations, and highly developed  psychological states with clear impact on our healing systems."

 Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

We look forward to seeing you at the next scheduled meet-up!Please e-mail me at [masked] if you have any questions or concerns.
results.name: Sound and Silence Meditation

results.description:
Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

St James Gate is a very casual Irish Pub.  Grab a seat at the bar or you can sit at a table to eat and drink.

Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish

New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Nov 15, 2015-Jan 10, 2016
Sun
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:
November 29
December 20
December 27
  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=633176138</a>

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125383<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294">

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

5v5 indoor gym soccer

With a smaller field and fewer players on a team, the quick-paced indoor soccer game helps players keep in shape and sharpen skills during the cold winter months. 

Why play with us:

Teammates are highly supportive & everyone gets involved in play.Play is at a good level, but not too competitive. No rough playing is ever tolerated.It's a friendly & diverse group. Meet new people and make new friends.   Share a laugh, conversation, and talk about your favorite soccer player. It's a fun workout indoors. We sometimes go out after our games.

Play according to your own schedule! Frequency of games make it simple. Unlike soccer leagues, there is no commitment for a season.

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. Looked like everyone got to meet new people which is the best part of this meetup. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

This weeks lineup included: Host: Ashley Morris (MTV), Phil Hanley (Tonight Show), Gregory K (Orange is the new black), Sam Morril (Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central), Jared Freid (MTV), and Headliner Jon Laster! and who knows pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.

results.description:
Ok folks, it's that day again (one week earlier than usual because of the upcoming holidays)- the day you all get to have a great time being being horrible people with a rousing game of Cards Against Humanity. Because so many of you enjoy it, we decided it was best to give you monthly recurring opportunities to be horrible. I'm sure we're doing a great service providing a safe outlet for these urges.

We'll be playing at The Uncommons, a tabletop gaming cafe. If by any chance Cards Against Humanity isn't your thing, they literally have a menu of dozens of games for you to enjoy, along with more typical menus for things like food and drink. For the small fee of $5 plus tax, all of these things will be available to you for the entire evening (The games, not the food and drink).

So come out and enjoy the guilty pleasure of being acceptably horrible with a card game, or play another game and sit in quiet judgment of the rest of us (both options have their appeal). Either way, join us for some fun games and good company this weekend.
results.name: Cards Against Humanity

10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
<a>Data Science and Analytics in Context </a>


While this isn't a traditional meetup, we thought our followers might be interested. 


Learn the foundations of statistical thinking, the power of machine learning, and enabling technologies for data science.


Data science is revolutionizing our world. In the Data Science and Analytics XSeries you will learn how statistics plays a central role, explore the principles of machine learning and importance of algorithms, and discuss enabling technologies including the rapidly growing Internet of Things.


You should take this XSeries if you are seeking career advancement, want to understand what data science might do for your enterprise, or are just interested in learning how data is transforming society.

First course | Starts December 14th, 2015 (5 weeks)

Statistical Thinking for Data Science and Analytics

Learn how statistics plays a central role in the data science approach.

What you'll learn


• Data collection, analysis and inference

• Relationship between variables

• Types of association

• Conditional probability

• Bayes’ Rule

• Goals of data visualization

• Statistical comparisons that underlie data graphics

• How Bayesian inference is used to combine sources of information

• Identify situations where Bayesian modeling can be useful


Click Here For Promotional Video Introduction

For additional upcoming events, such as our Northeast Big Data Innovation Hub workshop on December 16th, 2015: See Here

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: http://tunein.com/radio/soundbox-radio-s154205
results.name: Send us your latest house set to contribute to our weekly radio show!

results.description:
This is an open co-working day for you to bring your own JavaScript project and hang out. 

Bring: 

Your JS project and your own computer setup. Don't forget your power supply!

Who should attend:

If you're a JavaScript Engineer and you work from home or have the option to work remote, come join us for a change of scenery and good company. We'll hang out. 

Agenda:

11:00 AM - 6:00 PM - Show up anytime, just let us know when to expect you. 

At some point we'll likely step out for lunch nearby. We'll leave a note / sign so you can find us.

Please note that this is an open co-working space, so there may be some noise from other people. 

Hosts:

Jovena, Will and/or Evelyn will be there to greet you and welcome you.

Host:

Rise is generously offering space in their new coworking space. 

Rise New York is a collaborative co-working community shaping the future of commerce and fintech by helping startups and entrepreneurs connect, co-create, and scale innovation. In partnership with Barclays, we listen, nurture, and oxygenate through our international network of Rise hubs. Rise New York also houses a world-class event space and is home to the U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars.

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = 

NY JavaScript expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf Code of Conduct.

Due to limited seating, RSVPs for our events are $3-15. There are no refunds or transfers. Proceeds go to ScriptEd, a charity to increase code literacy among NYC youth at under-resourced schools.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email us at [masked].

We are looking for passionate volunteers to join our Help Network team in New York City!

VOLUNTEERS:

Do you have an hour a week or more to spend with a disabled or elderly individual? Many times disabled and elderly communities struggle with isolation, which directly leads to struggles with mental health and physical health. Can you be the bright light in someone's week just by simply spending an hour chatting, playing games, doing light chores or errands – just simply being there?

If so, please fill out this form:

https://helpnetworkusa.wufoo.com/forms/the-help-network-nyc-volunteer-intake-form/

Please note that all volunteers must pay the $16 fee for a background check. We require all of our volunteers to go through a background check in order to ensure our clients’ safety.

Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:
