results.description:
The Pricing of the Illiquidity Factor's Systematic Risk

Yakov Amihud

Seminar Program

5:45pm Registration
6:00pm Seminar
7:30pm Reception

Abstract

We present a liquidity factor IML, the return on illiquid-minus-liquid stock portfolios. The IML, adjusted for the common risk factors, measures the illiquidity premium whose annual alpha is about 4% over the period 1950-2012. I then test whether the systematic risk (β) of IML is priced in a multi-factor CAPM. The model allows for a conditional β of IML that rises with observable funding illiquidity and adverse market conditions. The conditional IML β is positively and significantly priced, and remains so after controlling for the beta of illiquidity shocks.



Biography

Yakov Amihud

is Ira Rennert Professor of Entrepreneurial Finance at the Stern School of Business, New York University.  He is the coauthor of

Market Liquidity: Asset Pricing, Risk and Crises

(Cambridge University Press, 2013). His research focuses on the effects of asset liquidity on value and expected return, and on the design and evaluation of securities markets' trading methods. On these topics, Amihud has done consulting work for the NYSE, AMEX, CBOE, CBOT, and other securities markets. He has published more than seventy research articles in professional journals and in books, and edited and co-edited five books on topics such as LBOs, bank M&As, international finance, and securities market design. His research also includes the evaluation of corporate financial policies, mergers and acquisitions, initial public offerings, objectives of corporate managers, dividend policy, and law and finance.


Disclaimer

This a joint IAQF/Thalesians seminar, and not an instructional program of New York University.
results.name: (NY) - Yakov Amihud - The Pricing of the Illiquidity Factor's Systematic Risk

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

results.description:
Microsoft’s Technology & Civic Engagement team has invited us to their shiny New York headquarters at 11 Times Square to see how they collaboratively address the most pressing community challenges through the creation, deployment, and evangelism of civic technology. We'll learn what civic technology is, how it's driving innovation, and bringing government and citizens together to tackle social and political issues.


We’ll also hear from a lineup of other organizations using technology for civic life and social impact, and learn how CUNY students can get involved in the work of civic technology.

Microsoft is generously providing light snacks and beverages.

Note: If you RSVP yes to attend this meetup please include your last name on your profile page so that Microsoft security receives an accurate attendee list. Microsoft security is tight so you may not be allowed up if your full name is not on the list. 

Evening Schedule:

6:00pm - arrive, snacks

6:15pm - presentations/demos 

8:00pm - network, snacks

8:30pm - ends

Our lineup will include:  

- Matt Stempeck & John Farmer, Microsoft NY, Technology & Civic Innovation team 

- Gale Brewer, Manhattan Borough President 

- Jeanne Brooks, DataKind 

- 2 CUNY Civic Innovation Fellows 


- Claire Fontaine, Data & Society 

- Noelle Francois, Heat Seek NYC 

- David Goldstein, Collective Decision Engines  


- Noel Hidalgo, BetaNYC 

- Andrew Hoppin, NuCivic 


- David Moore, OpenCongress 

- Liam Wright, True Interaction 

- Deanna Zandt, Lux Digital

results.description:
Please join us for HealthTech Women Annual Holiday Party.  Meet new people in the healthcare community, and hear from guest speaker, Neeta M. Shah, MD, FACP, Health and Wellness Expert, as she talks about "New Year, New You"! 


This will be a great topic of discussion as we all gear up and prepare for a successful 2016. 

There's limited seating so be sure to register right away!   We hope to see you there.

Program:

6:00 pm - 7:00 pm.    Registration and Networking 

7:00 pm - 8:00 pm     Guest Speaker, Dr. Neeta M. Shah, MD, FACP with Q and A

8:00 pm - 8:30 pm     Ending Notes

About Dr. Neeta Shah:  
Dr. Neeta Shah is on a mission to raise consciousness on women's health. One of the "Top 50 Most Influential Women in New York".  Dr. Shah believes in empowering individuals by educating them through community outreach. She is a frequent local and national lecturer to health professionals and lay public (corporations, churches, schools and correctional facilities) on various women’s health issues, healthy lifestyles and complementary medicine.

Dr. Shah served most recently as Vice President for Community Services for The Katz Institute for Women’s Health.  She is an internist who is a member and leader of numerous professional and peer affiliations (statewide and nationally) that provide her with a platform to effect change and develop policies that directly benefit the communities and healthcare consumers of Long Island and the New York Metropolitan area.
results.name: HealthTech Women Annual Holiday Party with a guest speaker

results.description:
It's that time of year again!  Let's get together and celebrate with some food and drinks!  The venue has a new name as well as a facelift (a bit brighter lighting too!) but they still have the same nice staff and good food.  We will have the same private party room as last year - on the ground floor, back on the right.

Cost per person is $25, which includes unlimited appetizers and one free drink.  You can bring cash the night of the party (or at any upcoming meetup, if you like), or you can Paypal me in advance.  Deadline for Paypal is Wednesday, December 9 - please message me if you need my email address for this.

If you would like to participate in the gift exchange, please bring a wrapped gift (around $20 price range) to the party.  We will draw numbers to see who gets first pick.  :)

Please do RSVP as soon as you can, even if you are paying the night of the party, as I need to let the venue know how many are coming.

Looking forward to seeing you all there!  :)

results.description:
Hello QSers!

Our next meetup is December 14th. Come share your self-tracking methods, results, and insights with the group.

6:00 - 7:00 pm DEMO HOUR

Come demo your gadget, app, or project and share with others in our "science fair for adults."

Want to participate in Demo Hour? Let us know when you RSVP or fill out this form for Demo Hour BY DEC 1st: http://goo.gl/forms/30cIcmN0e9

7:00 - 8:00 pm SHOW&TELL TALKS


This is our main event of the evening. We keep the length of presentations to 5 minutes followed by 5 minutes for Q&A. If you have slides to show, feel free but it's not required. Giving a Show&Tell talk and our three prime questions.

If you'd like to give a personal talk on self-tracking or self-experimentation, please let us know when you RSVP or fill out this form BY DEC 1st: http://goo.gl/forms/7O9hkUTXpJ

8:00 - 8:30 pm Catching Up With Friends 


Talk to the speakers, chat with new and old friends, ask other people what they're tracking, and generally hang out and have a great time.

QS SPONSORS: OUR THANKS TO STARTUP HEALTH & WEWORK 

We use meetup donations to pay for professional video recording, incidental venue costs, and awesome refreshments. If you or your company are interested in sponsoring NY Quantified Self, or hosting a future meetup at your office, please let us know.

We hope to see you on Dec 14th.

Steve, Patrick, Andrew, Peter, Konstantin, and Evan

- - - 
Steve Dean 
@sgdean

Patrick Whitaker 
@wemakebadghosts

Andrew Paulus 
@andrewcpaulus

Peter Chislett 
@chislett

Konstantin Augemberg 
@measuredme

Evan Creem 
NY QS Videographer

results.description:
After many requests, I am thrilled to finally announce a weekly study group of A Course in Miracles in Westchester!

A Course in Miracles is a guide to personal and spiritual transformation. It is based on the belief that we have two thoughts systems, one based on fear and separation from the Divine and another one based on love and oneness with the Divine. The Course is designed to help us become increasingly aware of the LOVE that is already present within us to let go all of the fearful thoughts and beliefs that we hold. Students of all levels are welcome. We will start with chapter I and we will study a few of the early lessons in the Workbook. Class is free, but suggested donation is $10 since both Lyna and Café 72 are lovingly donating the time and space. ABSOLUTELY no outside food or drink are allowed. We hope to see you on Monday to experience miraculous shifts from fear to love!

Enter “The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares” aka the World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Bitcoin Trading Pit!

But their travel plans are interrupted. They meet a rather troublesome elf named Danis and agree to travel with him. But this alliance lasts less than a full day and night when Danis attempts to pilfer the mage's spellbook. He's exiled from the group...so to speak.

results.description:
If you are new to Entity Framework, Microsoft’s framework for integrating data access into your .NET applications, this is the place to start. You will gain an understanding of what EF is for, how it works, where it belongs in your software architecture, and how to get it there. You’ll gain hands on experience with the basics of using EF from designing a simple model to interacting with that to persist data from your application. In addition to getting developers started with EF and prepared to learn and take advantage of more advanced techniques, this course will provide managers with the info they need to help them with decision making when planning a development stack. We’ll be using Visual Studio 2015 and .NET 4.6 for demos.

About the Author:  Julie Lerman has been programming and mentoring other developers for over 25 years and brings a wealth of experience and knowledge to share with Pluralsight subscribers. She is the leading independent authority on the Entity Framework and has been using and teaching EF since its inception. You may be familiar with her highly acclaimed series of "Programming Entity Framework" books, including the Code First and DbContext editions. Julie is well known in the .NET community as a Microsoft MVP, ASPInsider, and conference speaker around the world and she has authored the monthly MSDN Magazine Data Points column since 2010. Pluralsight brought Julie on as an author in 2010, and since then she has created many courses on Entity Framework as well as introductory courses on Domain-Driven Design and Unit Testing.

Julie lives in Vermont where she has run the Vermont.NET User Group since 2002. You can follow Julie's blog and other industry activities at thedatafarm.com and keep track of her every thought on twitter at @julielerman.
results.name: Getting Started with Entity Framework 6 Week 1 of 3

Expect a lively discussion to include an open Q&A with attendees and moderated by Metis Chief Data Scientist, Dr. Deborah Berebichez. 

Panelists include Abhijit Bose, Head of Data Science (Digital) at JPMorgan Chase, Bryan Reinero, US Developer Advocate at MongoDB, Inc., Aashish Srinivas, Software Engineer at Meetup, and Dorothy Kucar, Senior Software Engineer at RocketFuel and Metis Instructor. 

Enjoy pizza and drinks as the panelists explore the function and importance of Hadoop & Spark, the work-horses of distributed computing in the business world today.

Happy Holidays WSSL members!

If you've never shot with us before, please read the entire description below and register as soon as possible if you would like to join us this month as the range background check takes 5-7 days. We love new shooters, so come check us out and learn to shoot!

Have you always wanted to learn how to handle a firearm but didn't know where to start? Or do you have some (or a lot) of experience with guns but don't know where to shoot in the city? Then come join us for WSSL's monthly .22 rifle shoot!  Learn safe and responsible shooting skills with a group of fun and friendly ladies at the Westside Rifle and Pistol Range on November 16th. 


If you want to shoot with WSSL this December and you've never joined us before, please read the entire event description and start your registration process with Westside ASAP! 


Feel free to bring friends! (Remind them to register in advance!) All levels are welcome (never shot, beginners, intermediate, advanced). We will have some fun shooting drills, too! This meetup is limited to women, but we do have  co-ed shoots sporadically throughout the year, so keep posted!

Register here at least five days in advance: here: http://www.westsidepistolrange.com/registration.php?referral=WSSL&glemail=rsvp@nycwssl.org 

You will receive a "transaction ID" by e-mail from the Range. Please bring this with you and a photo ID.

Price: $35 (plus tax) to the range. You can pay the range after the event: cash, check or charge. This fee includes classroom safety instruction, private instruction on the firing line, rental of a .22 rifle, one box of ammo (additional ammo is available from WSSL while supplies last; please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo) and eye/ear protection. We also ask that you please donate $5 (or whatever you feel like donating) to WSSL directly to help cover our operating costs like our website fees, locker rental at the range, etc.

Come at 6:15 PM for the club business meeting and help us plan activities -- we have some great excursions in mind -- or join us from 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM for the shooting.

FIRST TIME SHOOTERS (First time shooting with us/Westside):

When you arrive at the Range on WSSL night pick up your brown ID card at the office. (Bring your transaction ID in case your brown ID card has not been prepared.) You will sign in using the Range ID number on your brown ID card every time you attend WSSL. 
You will also need to bring other ID with you to check in on WSSL night. 

RETURNING SHOOTERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
Use the Range ID number on your brown card to sign in when you arrive on WSSL night. 


WESTSIDE RANGE MEMBERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
On WSSL night sign in using your Range membership number. Range members do not pay the $35 WSSL fee, and WSSL will provide ammo while supplies last (please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo). 

ALL SHOOTERS:

If you've registered, but find that you can't attend, please e-mail Lauren at [masked] As soon as poosible so we have an accurate headcount for the Range. 
If you have to cancel at the last minute please call the Range directly at [masked] or [masked]-9448.

results.description:
Full title: Machine Learning in Trading: Implementing Deep Neural Networks for Financial Market Prediction on the Intel Xeon Phi

We invite you to our 2015 Thalesians LDN Xmas seminar & dinner by Matthew Dixon on "Implementing Deep Neural Networks for Financial Market Prediction on the Intel Xeon Phi" followed by dinner at La Tasca in Canary Wharf

Presentation at 6.30pm, Dinner at 7.30pm

On Arrival - A Glass of Sangría Tradicional

To Start - Tabla Espanola (to share) - Traditional Spanish cured meats with mixed olives, Manchego cheese, bread and oil.

Tapas Selection 

Christmas Albóndigas (Madrid) - Turkey & pork meatballs, in a rich, sherry and cranberry sauce.
Pulpo Gratin Y Queso GF (Galicia) - A medley of potatoes and octopus baked in a creamy lobster sauce and gratinated with Manchego cheese.
Pollo Marbella GF (Malaga) - Chicken breast, cooked with chorizo in a white wine & cream sauce.
La Tasca House Green Salad GF V (Navarra)
Patatas Bravas con Alioli (España) - Fried potato, with spicy tomato sauce and roasted garlic mayonnaise.

Choose from:
Paella de Carne GF (Valencia) - With chicken breast and chorizo.
OR
Paella Verduras GF V (Valencia) - With seasonal vegetables.

To finish - Churros - Doughnut twists, served with fresh strawberries and marshmallows, plus a rich chocolate sauce

Abstract:

Deep neural networks (DNN) have demonstrated their power in areas such as vision (think Google image search) and speech recognition (think Siri). Some financial firms are beginning to apply these techniques to market data and other information important for trading and investing. But training DNNs (that is, setting them to work to develop models) is extremely compute intensive. In this talk, Matthew will describe a DNN model for predicting price movements from time series data, then explain techniques that enable this model to exploit the parallel computing capacity of the Intel Xeon Phi processor in conjunction with multi-core CPUs.

<a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/Trading-Thalesians-Saeed-Amen/dp/113739952X"></a>

Biography

Matthew Dixon, Ph.D., FRM, Assistant Professor of Finance, Stuart School of Business, Illinois Tech. 

Matthew is an Assistant Professor and specializes in financial modeling, machine learning and high performance computing.  Matthew began his career as a quantitative developer at Lehman Brothers in London before pursuing academics and consulting for financial institutions in quantitative risk modeling. Matthew is a chartered financial risk manager and principal consultant for Quiota LLC, a consulting firm for buy side risk management and trading analytics. He holds a Ph.D. in Applied Mathematics from Imperial College (2007), a Master of Science in Parallel and Scientific Computation with distinction from the University of Reading (2002) and has held postdoctoral and visiting professor appointments at Stanford University and UC Davis respectively. He has published several academic papers at the intersection of financial modeling and high performance computing, chairs the workshop on high performance computational finance at SC and is co-founder of the Thalesians.
results.name: Seminar/Xmas Dinner (London) - Matthew Dixon - Machine Learning in Trading

results.description:
Simply having a great idea alone rarely leads to monetary reward.  Many inventors opt for filing a patent to capture that idea with hope of having an asset that is protectable or ready for licensing.  Unfortunately, the reality of patent writing and filing can lead to a sense of false expectations.

Louis DelJuidice will guide us through a sensible process of understanding patenting strategy and how to craft patent claims worthy of business investment…by yourself or potential investors.


Louis DelJuidice is a partner in the IP Section of Troutman Sanders, in the New York City office.  Louis engages in a full-service IP legal practice covering all aspects of patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets.  Louis concentrates on patent procurement, portfolio management, and patent opinion work.  Louis represents clients of all sizes from individual inventors to numerous universities and large portfolio of Japanese and other foreign-based corporate clients. Louis' technological capability includes electromechanical, communications, electronics, biomedical devices DVD, audio equipment, cellular telephone, digital rights management (DRM), digital watermarking, internet content providers, optics for digital cameras, cutting tools, dialysis machines, absorbent articles, semiconductors, printed circuit board and circuit board connector technologies.
results.name: "How to Train Your Patent Attorney"-Understand patent claims & filing strategies

All - I'm sorry this email is late in coming.  Please join us and please sign up to perform!  The warmest and most supportive audience will be there to applaud you!  


IT'S TIME FOR OUR ANNUAL HOLIDAY PARTY
MONDAY, DECEMBER 14TH, 6:30 - 10:00

It's time to come together once again, to celebrate our year of great music-making and our wonderful community of friends.  As in years past, we'll begin the evening at 6:30 with some food and conversation, followed by our SHOWCASE PERFORMANCE at 7:30.   We welcome all levels of performers!  You needn't have performed before to be part of this fun and supportive event.  And you can be a beginner!  We give extra props and applause to beginners that get up there to play. Here's a few guidelines: 

• Please email me to let me you know you'd like to perform and the number of people that will be joining you on-stage.


• One song/tune per person.  Please no medleys : )  


• Feel free to call on as many as 3 others to perform with you.  (4 people on stage, max. Thanks for your cooperation on this).  


•  Invite your family and friend to join.  We love an audience.  


• Please note that to perform at this event you need to have some affiliation with the slow jam.  Unfortunately, we're unable to accommodate unaffiliated folks looking to perform.  There's a great open mic on wednesday nights at Paddy's for non-members looking to perform. I highly recommend it! 

• There's a $5 fee for the jam, as usual.  Any questions? Give a shout.    


• There will be a jam after the event for anyone wanting to play into the night!


Thanks all for making this jam what it is!  

Sue

results.description:
Please join us for Entrepreneurs & Academics: 2016 Soft Robotics Trends.  We have a truly exciting opportunity to hear from some of the leading robotics experts working on trends impacting soft robotics, including these cutting edge technologies shaping up to be very relevant in 2016:

Modular Robotics.  Modular Robotics are an extremely promising but early stage field, where massive groups of autonomous mini-robots self-assemble to build complex compound robots. Cornell University’s Sibley School of Engineering is working to optimize the easily apparent commercial, military and medical applications.  Speaker: Jonathan Daudelin, Cornell University Sibley School of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering

NASA’s Mission to Mars – Soft Robotic Components. As part of its Mission to Mars, NASA is developing a mechanical counter-pressure glove system using soft robotics technology. Speaker: Matthew Borgatti, Lead Scientist, SuperReleaser

Manipulating Deformable Objects. We will learn how Columbia University Robotics is using predictive simulation and trajectory optimization to manipulate soft objects, allowing robots to enter fields previously thought impossible to automate.  Speaker: Professor Peter Allen, Columbia University Robotics Group, Department of Computer Science

Panel Moderated by: 

• Simone Braunstein, CEO and Founder, Paradox Robotics, and Founder of the Soft Robotics Technology Group Meetup.

...And more information to come!

RSVP: http://www.meetup.com/Soft-Robotics/events/222299065/

Location: Dentons is at 1221 Avenue of the Americas, 24th Floor (on the north side of 48thstreet, to the west of Ave of the Americas).  Proceed to the Tribeca Conference Room.  PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING PHOTO ID MATCHING THE FIRST AND LAST NAME IN YOUR RSVP FOR THE LOBBY SECURITY DESK.

results.description:
Doors open at 6:30 PM, as they do every week. Our uber friendly and efficient greeter, Allen, will be away this week and subbing will be super hostesses Dolores and Claire, who are just as friendly, but may be a little less experienced. If you can, please arrive a few minutes earlier. 

7:00 PM: Outgoing President Sherri Rase will host Open Talk in the Library. You, us and everyone else knows you don't want to miss it. 

8:00 PM: ELECTIONS

It is that time of year again! All members in good standing, please cast your vote of support for the GENEROUS VOLUNTEERS who have stepped forward to help keep GAAMC running another year! 

8:15 PM: Current Affairs
Following elections, please join us for a thoughtful and illuminating look at Current Affairs. Our past topics have ranged from domestic terrorism to voting rights, to prosecuting those who abuse our community physically and emotionally. There’s always something current and that’s where you’ll find facilitator Frank and GAAMC.

In an attempt to predict the affairs that will be most current next year, we may ask your opinions about the issues that our presidential candidates are bringing forth: Are you a vigorous supporter of our 2nd Amendment right to bear arms OR do you support restrictions on gun ownership? Should the U.S. send ground troops to the Middle East to fight ISIS OR are the current air strikes in Syria and Iraq sufficient?

Should the U.S. block Muslims from entering our country OR are there better ways to combat religious extremist jihadists?

Are you for or against NSA surveillance of our phone calls?

Let's attempt to keep our talk to the issues rather then on the candidates themselves.

Share your viewpoints and let's have a lively, enjoyable discussion.

December 21st:  HOLIDAY SHOW
This annual tradition is a great way to chase away the winter chill and share your talents with your friends, family and community.  Mr. Scarlett O'Hara has agreed to emcee the show.  Now, all we need is acts.  If you can sing, dance, read a poem, juggle, tell a joke, or share any other special talents with us, please email [masked].
results.name: Open Talk + Elections + Current Affairs

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. results.description:
This month, let's meet someplace new! Empire Szechuan has closed its doors, so, on Paul's suggestion, let's try Good Stuff Diner, conveniently located on 14th St., between 6th and 7th Ave. This diner features Greek specialties as well as club sandwiches, burgers, over-stuffed sandwiches, salad platters and a range of dinner entrees, in addition to a full bar.

Our topic for the evening will be "Risk":

According to David Viscott, M.D., in his book "Risking," :

"If your life is ever going to get better, you'll have to take risks. To risk is to loosen your grip on the known and the certain and to reach for something you are not entirely sure of but you believe is better than what you now have. Taking a risk is central to everything worthwhile in life. Everything you really want in life involves taking a risk. You cannot grow without taking a risk, a chance. Like all risks, growing requires giving something up without knowing for certain if the next step will be any better. In every risk there is some unavoidable loss, something that has to be given up to move ahead. A dynamic life is a life full of risks, but not hazardous risks where a person takes unnecessary [and potentially dangerous] chances. Not risking is the surest way of losing."

Let's discuss risking and how it relates to personal growth and overcoming fear of loss and uncertainty.

$4 per person for meetup fees.

results.description:
New Foundation Program Class Beginning November 30th

Mondays @ 7:00 pm – 9:00 pm with Resident Teacher, Kadam Peter Kurzynski

Join our first class/info session to learn more

Ask questions

Meet the teacher and other students

Sit-in up to 3 classes or enroll right away!

Buddhism teaches that to find lasting happiness and meaning in our lives we need to follow a spiritual path. To follow this path it is important to be connected with a qualified teacher who can give us personal advice and encouragement, to listen to pure Dharma teachings, and to belong to a strong spiritual community. These enable us to gain deep insight into the meaning of Buddha’s teachings, to maintain a daily meditation practice that is both focused and effective, and to make genuine spiritual progress.

Don’t miss this extraordinary opportunity to study, How to Understand the Mind, by Geshe Kelsang Gyatso. This book offers us deep insight into our mind, and shows how an understanding of its nature and functions can be used practically in every day experience to improve our lives.Part 1 is a practical guide to developing and maintaining a light, positive mind – showing how to recognize and abandon states of mind that arms us, and to replace them with peaceful and beneficial ones. Part 2 describes different types of mind in detail, revealing the depth and profundity of the Buddhist understanding of the mind. It concludes with a detailed explanation of meditation, showing how by controlling and transforming our mind we can attain a lasting state of joy, independent of external conditions. What is the structure of the Foundation Program Class?

Prior to each class, students study an assigned reading homework, usually a few pages long.
Each class begins with chanted prayers and guided meditation.
The teacher reads the assigned selection from the book while giving commentary to the text.
The students divide into pairs to discuss the material.
The teacher and students conclude by deciding what to meditate on in the next class and how to practice during the coming week.
Over the course of time warm friendships develop as students inspire each other, sharing insights and experiences of the spiritual path.
Students sign-up to study for a period of time or for an entire text
Students agree to try to attend each class, learn the material, and to take a test at the conclusion of the study

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/frenchies/events/172371032"></a>

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

results.description:
COME CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS!

WRITE YOUR SCREENPLAY 

A Screenwriting Workshop With Award Winning Screenwriter Jacob Krueger

Whether you’re a young writer picking up the pen for the first time, or an old pro looking to inject new life into your writing, this exciting eight week workshop will teach you a whole new way of looking at the fundamentals, and help you integrate your artistic goals into your real world life. Jacob’s groundbreaking approach to feedback fosters a close-knit community of fellow writers, whose only goal is to support you in yours. Together, you’ll discover a new form of feedback that keeps the focus on what really matters: your story and how you want to tell it. Learn more.

About Jacob Krueger

Throughout his career, Jacob Krueger has collaborated with all kinds of writers, from Academy Award Winner Michel Legrand to Tony Award winners Alain Boublil and Claude-Michel Schonberg (Broadway’s Les Miserables).

Now, he brings his groundbreaking techniques directly to you, with unique Workshops, Master Classes, and Private Coaching designed for writers of all levels with an interest in writing.

Build the writers life you've been seeking today

"Jacob Krueger is a true collaborator, totally dedicated to the project, leaving his ego behind, but nevertheless demanding the highest standards because of his sharp dramatic sense and intuition."
--Claude Michel Schonberg / Composer, Les Miserables

MORE INFO:  http://www.writeyourscreenplay.com

LOCATION: Jacob Krueger Studio 
56 W. 22nd Street, Manhattan
New York, NY 

MEETUP MEMBERS CAN JOIN AT ANY TIME.

NORMAL COST: $350

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!  (New Students Only!)

Class Size is Strictly Limited To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!
results.how_to_find_us: We're on the 8th Floor.  Take the elevator up and go in the door on your right.

results.description:
Tickets will NOT be available at the door!

Purchase through either Paypal or Brown Paper Tickets:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=VMMEKBW9NE8S8

http://steinwaymeetup3.brownpapertickets.com

=============================================

Hey, Gothamites!

The series of "salon concerts" at the temporary showroom of Steinway & Sons concludes with an extremely diverse program of vocal and piano music performed by countertenor Jeffrey Palmer and pianist Riko Higuma. 

(Read artist bios ---> HERE) 

Scroll down for a video of them.

If you are unfamiliar with the countertenor voice type and would like background information: 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Countertenor


PROGRAM (tentative) 

Debussy:          Beau Soir
Copland:          Night Thoughts
Handel:            Amor Nel Mio Penar
Piazzolla:        Winter from The Four Seasons
Traditional:    There Is No Rose Of Such Virtue
Britten:            Corpus Christi Carol

--- a brief intermission --- 

Tchaikovsky:    December from The Seasons
Joni Mitchell:  River
Chopin:              Winter Wind
Britten:              Before Life And After from Winter Words
Paterson:          Joy Ride 
Bach/Gounod: Ave Maria


SCHEDULE

The 7 pm listed start time is necessary to allow for check-in. The music will begin at 7:30. Please do not arrive after that, as this would be extremely disruptive to the performers and audience members.


ADMISSION

$17  - Before Dec 12 
$25 - On/After Dec 12


HOW TO PURCHASE TICKETS

1) Use either of these two links. If you are having trouble with one, the other will usually work: 

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=VMMEKBW9NE8S8

http://steinwaymeetup3.brownpapertickets.com 

2) Brown Paper Tickets phone orders: 1 (800)[masked] 
Please request event #[masked] (no code necessary).

3) Due to strict venue rules, no funds (cash or credit) can be accepted on site. Please purchase your seat in advance via one of the above methods. 

4) The names of all attendees will be on a list at the door. There are no physical tickets.

5) Purchase deadline is 11:30 am on the day of the concert or when the venue capacity is reached.

6) Please note the price increase on December 12. Securing your seat as early as possible is recommended.

7) RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price. 

8) Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled).  However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.


POST-CONCERT MEETING: 

If there is interest, we will go someplace nearby for food, drinks and socializing. 


See you there! 

Sheila & Milton

P.S. As promised, here is the video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jfv3mAiDkg8


Special thanks to:

2015 NYC Tech Holiday Meta-Party

Listing info:

---------------

Note: Please RSVP at http://rsvp.nylug.org/225970914 to be sure

of your entry.

- 2015 NYC Tech Holiday Meta-Party -

When: 7:00 PM until ?, Monday, December 14, 2015

NYC technical user groups are joining forces to hold another holiday party to remember!

- AWSNewYork (for users of Amazon Web Services)

- ChefNYC (for users of Chef)

- CoderDojoNYC (for Coding Mentors in NYC)

- ContinuousDeliveryNYC (Continuous Delivery : NYC Group)

- DebianNYC (New York Debian Local Group)

- DigitalOceanNYC (for users of Digital Ocean)

- DockerNewYork (for users of Docker)

- DrupalNYC (Drupal New York City)

- LispNYC (New York City Lisp User Group)

- Lopsa-NYC (League of Professional System Administrators New York City Chapter)

- NYC*BUG (New York City *BSD User Group)

- NYCCloudFoundry (users of Cloud Foundry PaaS)

- nycdevops (New York City Devops Meetup Group)

- NYC-Clojure (NYC Clojure Users Group)

- NYC-GDG (NYC Google Developers Group)

- NYCPUG (NYC PostgreSQL User Group)

- NYC PyLadies (Mentoring women in Python)

- NYHRUG (New York Red Hat Users Group)

- NYLUG (New York Linux Users Group)

- NYPHP (New York PHP User Group)

- PuppetNYC (New York Puppet User Group)

- TA3M (Techno Activist Third Mondays)

- UNIGROUP (New York City's Unix User's Group)

Everyone of all types of expertise and interests are welcome.  The party starts at 7 PM and will continue until at least 10 PM.  It is the ideal networking opportunity of the season, and a chance to connect with old friends and make new ones.

Our generous sponsors are covering drinks and hors d'oeuvres for the evening.  (Until the funds run out, at which point everyone is welcome to stay and partake of the cash bar.)

The current list of sponsors includes:

- New York Internet (NYI)

- InformIT (Addison-Wesley, Prentice Hall, SAMS...)

- Addteq

- Basho

- Facebook

- Stride

- Trello

- Tumblr

Additional sponsors are welcome to join in and show their support for New York City's technical community.  Contact us at [masked].

Help us make the 2015 holiday party a success!

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members: I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
The philosophy of privacy: does surveillance reduces us to objects? Or does it make us morally better? Using the internet can be seen as a trade-off: privacy for freedom. But the widespread invasion of that privacy by a security state seems to be something different altogether. Join us for a thoughtful discussion on the topic!

Two short recommended readings can be found here. RSVP for this event will begin on 11/30 at 7:00pm. The fee for the meetup is of $5/person, which does *not* include dinner (obviously…).
results.name: The philosophy of privacy

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.
results.name: Healing the Loss of a Love - Attracting a Healthy and Loving Relationship

group.name: Heal the Loss of Love-Attract a Healthy Loving Relationship

results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities
• Develop new resources and capabilities
• Become clear about your life’s purpose
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.
Discover the passion and power that resides within you
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can awaken the healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

• Review the Script

• Talk about The Craft / The Business. 

• Like NYC Screenwriters at Facebook.com/NYCScreenwriters


• Follow @Scriptfeed on Twitter

To Do

• If you sign up after the PASSWORD email blast (1 week before meeting) then email/message [masked]. 

• Please do not distribute passwords, scripts, or materials you obtain from RSVPing to Collective workshops.

Thanks and see you soon!

ABOUT THE SCREENWRITER: Jonas Borgen has written a couple of features, a TV pilot, two novels, a kids book and some shorts.

group.name: New York City Cloud Foundry Meetup

results.description:
I. Agenda, Introductions & Challenges Forum (7:15 PM)


A. Introductions - Each member will introduce yourself briefly, tell us what you do professionally, your GTD experience, and a recent success with your productivity implementation and/or life.

B. Challenges Forum - We'll give a few minutes to have the group help each member with solutions to challenges we may be facing currently with life or work circumstances with our productivity system. These are specific productivity challenges and only one challenge per member for time's sake.

II. Discussion: Calendar Management and Getting Things Done (~8:20 - 8:40 PM)

Since the beginning of time, time mattered. And, time matters still. From project deadlines to leisure time to meetings, time is as precious a commodity as ever. Some even want to recast the way technology is measured by a "time well spent" (YouTube video) standard. Then enter Getting Things Done (GTD), not a time management methodology but an action management methodology. David Allen's GTD doesn't remove time from the personal management equation but he defines how to manage our personal and professional lives through the lens of our actions toward goals. Notwithstanding, he tells us how we use our time, and he gives us rubrics for what should appear in our calendars.

In this month's Meetup, I'd like for us to discuss the ways in which we manage our calendars while practicing GTD. More often than not, we use our calendars more for things GTD doesn't necessarily profess, but it works for us. That's the power of GTD; it knows how to step aside and let productivity happen! And, when it doesn't work, David Allen has provided an "ideal practice" for us to support us back toward productivity. Join us for this Meetup where we will be discussing calendaring, time management, time blocking and time chunking, calendar/agenda/scheduling software/mobile applications, and more! 

Please feel free to bring your copy of GTD, your questions and thoughts on minimalism and simple living as well! Your conversation contributions are what make the discussions awesome!

Directly after this month's Meetup, we will be heading directly to our annual GTD Holiday Gathering! We hope you can join us to help celebrate the end of one productive year and the start of a new one!

III. GTD Resource Sharing (8:40 PM) -- CATEGORY: Weather/Astronomy

This is where everyone can offer a book title, recent blog or magazine article, tip/trick/hack, tool, smartphone app, service or item that has helped them in their life productively either with GTD or otherwise. (We compile resources discussed and post them to our Resources Page in the GTDNYC Google Group. Join us there!)

I ENCOURAGE EVERYONE TO BRING SOME KIND OF GTD OR PRODUCTIVITY RESOURCE THEY KNOW ABOUT OR USE TO OFFER TO THE GROUP!

IV. Announcements / Closing Remarks (8:50 PM)

Upcoming meetups, events, and programs announcements. All announcements must be sent to the Meetup Organizer within the RSVP form to announce to the group, at his sole discretion. Thank you!

Do you mind helping support our GTD NYC Meetup? GTD NYC can now receive small contributions to help it grow and be sustainable. Chip in here: https://secure.meetup.com/gtdnyc/contribute/
results.name: GTD & Calendar Management | GTD NYC

results.description:
Veganizer NYC is beyond excited to announce its first official event. Cafe Frida is a well known Mexican Restaurant in the Upper West Side that has agreed to be 100% vegan for a night. If the event is successful then they will continue serving some of the veganized dishes on their daily menu and they will become the first of many to officially veganize. 

Check out their menu HERE to see what veganized dishes we will be serving.

Joaquin Martinez from the restaurant group is thrilled to host this event and has even encouraged me to consider his other restaurants throughout the city! 

In a letter from the founder, Christina Castaneda, she writes

"Cooking in Mexico is not just about combining ingredients. It is a culture, a celebration, an art and the heart of the family – and sometimes, a sacred feast for the gods...Today’s food trends lean towards the healthy and the uncomplicated... The intense competition and demand for healthier food means we must raise the quality of flavors..."

Before The Event:

Veganizer will work with the kitchen to ensure that Cafe Frida serves 100% vegan dishes to our meet-up.

On the night of the event.

Take lots of photos and video! Let's give them great exposure for doing a good thing! 

Veganizer will provide a list of all the alcoholic drinks that are vegan. 

Prime location in the UWS where there aren't many vegan options.

They are famous for their traditional Mexican dishes and guacamole.

If you have any questions, email me at [masked]

Tell your friends and loved one's that this is our opportunity to show a restaurant that veganizing is the best choice that they can make! Let's support them in their effort to be more conscious!
results.how_to_find_us: 368 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024 (Take the "B" or the "C" to 81st Street)
results.name: Join Veganizer at Cafe Frida in UWS as they pledge to veganize for the night.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly figure drawing session at The National Arts Club.

This session is open to all levels. Open to the public.

<a>Let us know you're coming.</a> 


We operate on a first come first served basis. Arriving by 6:45 is a good way to guarantee a seat.

• Bring your own drawing supplies.


• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break.

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp!

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there.

Simon

results.description:
Don't miss this exclusive opportunity to taste six top-rated wines from the oldest winery in Italy (and some say the second oldest winery in the world!).

The Ricasoli family has been making wine at the Castello Brolio (http://ricasoli.it) in Tuscany since 1141 and they are known as the inventors of Chianti wines. Since 1993, Francesco Ricasoli, 32nd Baron of Brolio, has been at the helm of his family’s winery. With his vast wealth of information from past generations he always strives to uphold the quality and maintain the personality of great Brolio wines--wines which express the unique characteristics of the land and its history.

Wine Lovers of NYC will have the chance to taste some of their top wines at two exclusive tastings guided by charismatic wine expert Tony DiDio, author of The Renaissance Guide to Wine and Food Pairing (http://amzn.to/1MRVXku) on December 14 and 16. Each tasting will be for a limited number of wine lovers and will include cheeses, charcuterie and other snacks prepared by the chef at Pierre Loti Midtown. Wines to be tasted will be:

Brolio Riserva Chianti Classico DOCG Riserva 2011 (WS rating 89)
Colledilà Chianti Classico DOCG Gran Selezione 2011 (Suckling rating 93)
Casalferro Toscana IGT 2011 (Suckling, WE rating 93)
Castello di Brolio Chianti Classico DOCG Gran Selezione 2011 (Suckling rating 96)
Historia Familiae Toscana IGT 2011  (WS rating 94)
Bolgheri DOCG 2013 (WS rating 89)

Attendees will be able to order the wine for home delivery at the event. And a travel agent will be there to tell you about an April tour to Tuscany that will include a full-day visit to Castello Brolio, in addition to wineries in Montalcino and other Tuscan wine destinations.
results.name: Taste Top Wines from the Oldest Winery in Italy

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles
results.how_to_find_us: CRS is located one block east of Broadway and one and a half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.
results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

results.description:
Join Be Social Change & Kristina Drury, founder of TYTHEdesign, on Monday, December 14th from 7PM to 9PM for Design Thinking Fundamentals - Problem Solving for Impact.

Curious about design thinking and how you can adapt it for your work? Design thinking is a problem-solving, idea generating, decision making mindset that is applicable and useful in all disciplines, not just the design field! After years of integrating the design thinking process into their daily work, TYTHEdesign has tailored a class focused on how their theories translate across fields and sectors into real world, real work experience.

===========================================

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE! This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCDesignDec14

**BSC Unlimited pass holders get a 50% discount on this workshop**

===========================================

* Doors open at 6:45, class starts at 7:00 sharp *


Design thinking is a user-centered methodology that helps you to empathize with your clients or community, design to their needs, and experiment with solutions. In this class you will not only learn the tenets of design thinking, but how they can translate into your day-to-day work and interactions with your team. Through activities, case studies and interactive modeling, this class will demystify design thinking and translate it into adaptable strategies to help you innovate within your team, enhance new and existing services, and better connect with your community. This class will help you take design thinking from theory to practice.

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

• An interactive introduction to design thinking

• A process for generating new ideas and ways to efficiently brainstorm

• How to build the capacity for user-centered empathy

• Strategies and resources that can be easily customized to your work and community

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Individuals from all professional or educational backgrounds interested in learning about the design thinking process

• Managers looking for tools to activate collaboration within their teams

• Early stage entrepreneurs or those considering starting a socially-minded venture

• Professionals who have an idea for a project, organization or business that will drive social changeIndividuals looking to add creative thinking methodology to their work


 INSTRUCTOR BIO

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/3aFiMB9DK24Lk63e1fTvsZZNdyDCg9UmgzQRBAyFQNoAHnZsLnLSp_JT5ry1YV-hp1oxqjIDyYE40KSJx2t90kB91ZsJG-YJbhQhDheqaFOJ-fXVvVxYy2E9jzhPin3HRGrDRJ4

Kristina Drury (@TYTHEdesign) founder of TYTHEdesign, is a social entrepreneur, designer and educator. TYTHE, a social impact firm, uses the lens of design and strategy to support organizations build their capacity in the social good community. Under her leadership TYTHE has increased the community impact of over 75 local and global social good organizations including the NYC Dept. of Education, Citi Community Development, Public Policy Lab and California State Library System. Recently, Kristina has been named a UNDP Innovation Expert. Prior to starting TYTHE, Kristina co-led the nonprofit Project H and worked in corporate social responsibility consulting. As an educator she has taught classes, workshops and training to build the capacity of over 600 change-makers, leaders, and entrepreneurs. Her teaching and speaking experience includes engagements at the Clinton Global Initiative University, Cooper-Hewitt Museum and New Museum’s Ideas City Festival.

You can learn about Kristina’s current work here and find out more about her background here.

SPACE PARTNER


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.
results.name: BSC Partner Workshop: Design Thinking Fundamentals - Problem Solving for Impact

results.description:
Join Be Social Change on Monday, December 14th from 7PM to 9PM for Transformative Storytelling - Using Narrative to Communicate, Inspire, and Activate Your Community with Lee-Sean Huang, Cofounder and Creative Director of Foossa.

=========================================== 

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCStoryDec14

===========================================

Storytelling is more than a marketing tool. It’s a management tool.

In this class, we uncover the narrative structures and strategies used by social change practitioners and entrepreneurs for building community and inspiring action. This is a workshop for makers and social entrepreneurs who want to strengthen their skills in storytelling to transform themselves, their teams, and their broader communities.  Storytelling is a powerful tool for building a shared identity, for facilitating mutual understanding, and for facilitating collective action.

We will draw upon successful storytelling methodologies and strategies from the fields of social activism, marketing, and the arts. We will examine and decode examples of successful (and not so successful) storytelling. This class will get “hands on” with activities and exercises that will encourage participants to practice their new storytelling skills.

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN 

• Why storytelling is important for social change

• What are the essential elements and structures of a good story

• How to find and craft compelling stories

• How to adapt and refine your storytelling

• What are some of the possible applications of storytelling

• How to integrate one’s personal and professional stories

• How to use stories to stand out in a crowd

• How to imbue stories with values and emotion

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR  

• Professionals, entrepreneurs, creatives, and communications strategists/marketers ready to focus on company and brand storytelling

• Professionals who have an idea for a project, organization or business that will drive change

• Professionals who already use storytelling in their work looking to find ways to systematize and refine their approach

• Professionals curious about how storytelling can enrich their work.

INSTRUCTOR BIO

Lee-Sean Huang (@LeeSean) is the cofounder and creative director of Foossa. As a community-centered designer and social innovation strategist, he has devoted his career to fostering creative civic participation and building movements for the common good.

He was previously the founding member of the design practice at Purpose, creative director of Meu Rio and a co-founder of Hepnova Multimedia. He has worked on five continents and has collaborated with organizations including the United Nations, Human Rights Watch, the SEIU, the Dalai Lama Center, the Brazil Foundation, the Packard Foundation, the Grammy Foundation, the Kigali Genocide Memorial, the Guggenheim Museum, and the Tenement Museum.

Lee-Sean is a faculty member at the School of Visual Arts MFA Design for Social Innovation and has previously lectured and taught at the New School, New York University, Cornell Tech, the College of Staten Island, the University of California Los Angeles, and the University of Hawai’i. You can learn about his current work here and more about his background here.

SPACE PARTNER    

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/KPL4uynCqIoMu2deyfpUIP59J1-rk9uZwr8AQMeHBdGbJTw9YsL_JSkKxTZucHnuclxQsW120aO4HFk4uK8rilV2ZxPHbeyg-sLyxfzjQdMmcjLV-29EequKqpboQGQlLg


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

results.description:
Foursquare for iPad 2.0: how we rebuilt our iPad app from the ground up to relieve technical debt and support iOS 9 multitasking. Sam Grossberg, Foursquare iOS Lead

Swarm 3.0: UI that we’ve built for Swarm 3.0 to "bring back the fun", and some tips and tricks that you can use in your own code. Jeff Forbes, Swarm iOS Lead

Come join us at Foursquare to hear about how we rebuilt our iPad app from the ground up to relieve technical debt and support iOS 9 multitasking...

We had an iPad app that was largely different than our iPhone app. This was good at first, but over time the tech debt of supporting two different apps sharing a lot of code crept in, and a lot of features never got implemented on iPad. With iOS 9 and multitasking and size classes, we decided it was a good opportunity to make our iPad app an adaptive layout of our iPhone app. Come to the talk to learn what challenges we encountered, what tradeoffs we made to minimize tech debt, and what extra infrastructure we built to make our iPhone app look great on the iPad!
results.name: How Foursquare implemented iOS9 on Foursquare for iPad 2.0 & Swarm 3.0
